Top 5 Best Japanese Action Movies You Must Watch

Top 5 Best Japanese Action Movies You Must Watch

Japan has long been known for its rich and diverse cinematic culture. From classic samurai epics to modern-day action thrillers, Japanese filmmakers have produced some of the most iconic and imaginative action movies in the industry. With a perfect blend of adrenaline-pumping sequences and captivating storytelling, these films offer a unique cinematic experience.

In this article, we've compiled a list of the top 10 best Japanese action movies to give you a taste of what this unique film culture has to offer.

"Seven Samurai" is a classic samurai film directed by Akira Kurosawa. Released in 1954, it still stands strong as one of the best and most influential Japanese action movies of all time.

1. Seven Samurai (1954)

The story is set in 16th-century Japan and revolves around a group of villagers who are under constant threat from bandits.

To protect their village, they hire a veteran samurai who then gathers other 6 samurais to help him.

© 2023 trstdly.com

The movie is known for its engaging plot, well-developed characters, and intense action sequences. "Seven Samurai" is often praised for its influence on the action genre and its impact on filmmaking worldwide.

"Battle Royale" is a Japanese film from the year 2000, directed by Kinji Fukasaku. The movie is set in a dystopian future where a group of high school students is forced to participate in a government program called the "Battle Royale." They are taken to a remote island, given weapons, and compelled to fight each other until only one student remains alive.

2. Battle Royale (2000)

This movie is known for its controversial content, depicting teenagers in a brutal life-and-death competition. Despite the controversy, "Battle Royale" has become a cult classic known for its action-packed sequences.

"Rurouni Kenshin Part I: Origins" is the first film of the Rurouni Kenshin series. It's based on the popular manga and anime series "Rurouni Kenshin" by Nobuhiro Watsuki.

3. Rurouni Kenshin Part I: Origins (2012)

This film follows the story of Kenshin Himura, a former legendary samurai and assassin who has vowed never to kill again after the war has ended. His vow is tested when he has to fight against Kanryuu Takeda and his henchmen.

"Rurouni Kenshin Part I: Origins" is well-received for its faithful adaptation of the manga and anime. It offers action-packed scenes, compelling characters, and a focus on Kenshin's personal and moral development.

"Yojimbo" is another classic samurai film by Akira Kurosawa. It follows the story of a wandering ronin named Sanjuro who arrives in a town divided by two rival gangs. Sanjuro plays the gangs off each other, ultimately helping the villagers to overthrow them.

4. Yojimbo (1961)

The film is famous for its iconic lead character, portrayed by Toshiro Mifune, and its skillful blend of action, humor, and drama.

"Azumi" is a Japanese action film released in 2003, directed by Ryūhei Kitamura. It's based on a popular manga of the same name. The story centers on a young girl named Azumi, who is raised and trained as an assassin by a master samurai. She and a group of other young warriors are tasked with a dangerous mission to eliminate warlords and restore peace to the land.

5. "Azumi" (2003) 

The film is known for its high-energy martial arts sequences, and action-packed scenes as Azumi and her comrades face various challenges on their journey.

5 Ballet Movies Every Dance Lover Should Watch

Are you a seasoned ballet enthusiast or discovering the world of dance? These ballet films will delight and inspire you. (Photo by Graceful Ballet Performance on  StockCake)

5 Ballet Movies Every Dance Lover Should Watch

Ballet has long been a source of inspiration for filmmakers.

Ballet dance resulted in captivating movies showcasing this art form's beauty, discipline, and drama. These movies not only showcase ballet's grace and elegance but also explore dancers' lives and struggles. Here are five ballet movies that every dance lover should watch:

1. Black Swan (2010)Genre: Horror/Mystery IMDb: 8/10Rotten Tomatoes: 85%

Directed by Darren Aronofsky, "Black Swan" is a psychological thriller. It follows Nina Sayers, a talented but unstable ballerina on the verge of stardom.

The film explores the intense pressure and mental strain that dancers face. These features It is a compelling watch for ballet enthusiasts and those interested in drama. You can stream "Black Swan" on Amazon Prime Video.

2. Center Stage (2000)Genre: Dance/Musical IMDb: 6,7/10Google Users: 62%

Directed by Nicholas Hytner, "Center Stage" is a classic ballet film that follows a group of teenagers as they enroll at the American Ballet Academy in New York.

The movie highlights the challenges and triumphs of these young dancers as they strive to make it in the competitive world of ballet. You can watch it on Netflix.

3. White Nights (1985)Genre: Thriller/War IMDb: 6,7/10Google Users: 78%

Directed by Taylor Hackford, "White Nights" is a romantic drama that tells the story of two ballet dancers,

one from the Soviet Union and the other from the United States, who find love and support in each other. The film showcases the beauty of ballet and the personal struggles of its dancers. You can stream it on Amazon Prime Video.

4. Yeh Ballet (2020)Genre: Documentary/Drama IMDb: 7,5/10Rotten Tomatoes: 88%

Directed by Naman Aggarwal, "Yeh Ballet" is an original Netflix series that follows two young boys from India who discover their passion for ballet.

The series explores their journey as they face challenges and learn to balance their love for dance with their everyday lives. You can watch "Yeh Ballet" on Netflix.

5. A Swan Lake (2014)Genre: Drama/MusicIMDb: 7,6/10Google Users: 78%

Directed by Yuri Kaczynski, "A Swan Lake" is a documentary that delves into the world of ballet through the lens of the iconic "Swan Lake" ballet.

The film provides an intimate look at the lives of professional ballet dancers and the rigorous training they undergo. You can stream it on Amazon Prime Video.

These ballet movies present a various range of outlooks on ballet. It ranges from the intense pressures of professional dancing to the personal journeys of young dancers. Are you a seasoned ballet enthusiast or discovering the world of dance? These ballet films will delight and inspire you.

8 Best Places to Live in New Orleans, Louisiana

New Orleans has many advantages. Each place offers unique charm and appeal.
Photo by Nick Haynes, pexels

8 Best Places to Live in New Orleans, Louisiana

New Orleans, Louisiana, is a vibrant and varied city known for its rich culture, delicious food, and lively music scene.

If you're considering moving to this exciting city, you may wonder where the best places to live are. Here are 8 New Orleans neighborhoods with unique charm and attractions for residents of all ages.




Best Places to Live in New Orleans

1. Abita Springs

Abita Springs is known for its small-town charm and natural beauty. It is a peaceful, serene community just a short drive outside New Orleans.

Outdoor activities like hiking, biking, and fishing are easy to access. This neighborhood is perfect for nature lovers looking for a quiet escape from the city.

flickr/Bruce Bordelon

2. Algiers Point:

Located across the Mississippi River from downtown New Orleans, Algiers Point offers a historic feel with beautiful architecture and tree-lined streets. It is known for its strong sense of community and local businesses. These qualities make it a great place to live for those who value a close-knit neighborhood feel.

flickr/Bart Everson

3. Bayou St. John

Nestled along the banks of picturesque Bayou St. John, this neighborhood has stunning views. It also access to outdoor recreation options like kayaking and paddleboarding.

With a convenient location close to City Park and the French Quarter, Bayou St. John is a popular choice for those who want to live near the city's heart while enjoying a peaceful waterfront setting.

4. Lakeview

Lakeview is situated along the shores of Lake Pontchartrain.

Lakeview is a picturesque neighborhood with beautiful views and a strong sense of community.

Residents can enjoy easy access to parks, restaurants, and shopping. These features make it an excellent place for families and young professionals.

Best Places to Live in New Orleans

5. East Carrollton

With its tree-lined streets and historic homes, East Carrollton exudes charm and character. This neighborhood is known for its rich culture and diverse community. It has plenty of local businesses and restaurants to explore. Residents can enjoy a relaxed atmosphere while still being close to the excitement of the city.

6. Fillmore


Located in the heart of New Orleans, Fillmore is a lively and mixed neighborhood with historic homes and modern developments. Residents can enjoy easy access to restaurants, bars, and cultural attractions, making it ideal for those who crave a city lifestyle.

Best Places to Live in New Orleans

7. West End

West End presents stunning waterfront views and a laid-back atmosphere along Lake Pontchartrain.

Residents can enjoy waterfront dining, fishing, and boating, making it a popular choice for those who love outdoor activities. With easy access to the Lakefront Airport and the University of New Orleans, West End is a convenient neighborhood for students and travelers.

flickr/Infrogmation of New Orleans

8. Bywater

Bywater is a trendy neighborhood known for its artsy vibe and eclectic mix of residents. It is located just a short distance from the French Quarter.

With its colorful homes, street art, and unique shops, Bywater has a vibrant and creative atmosphere for those who respect artistic expression. Residents can enjoy local breweries, galleries, and live music venues, making it a dynamic and exciting place to call home.

New Orleans has many advantages. It includes a rich cultural heritage, delicious cuisine, and a strong sense of community. Each place offers unique charm and appeal.

These features help you find a place that suits your lifestyle and preferences. Whether looking for a quiet retreat in nature or a bustling urban environment, New Orleans has something for everyone.




Best Places to Live in New Orleans

450 Powerful Fake Friends Quotes to Help You Move On

True friends are rare treasures, while fake friends can hurt us deeply. This collection of 450 quotes about fake friends will help you spot insincerity, protect your heart, and find real connections.

Let these words of wisdom guide you to healthier relationships.

Recognizing Fake Friends

1. Fake friends only call when they need something.

2. Real friends support your dreams. Fake ones get jealous.

3. A true friend has your back. A fake one stabs you in it.

4. Fake friends disappear when times get tough.

5. Real friends accept you as you are. Fake ones try to change you.

6. Fake friends talk behind your back.

7. A genuine friend lifts you up. A fake one brings you down.

8. Fake friends are nice to your face but mean behind your back.

9. Real friends stick around. Fake ones come and go.

10. Fake friends only like you when it’s convenient for them.

Signs of Fake Friendship

11. They never keep their promises.

12. They only contact you when they want something.

13. They gossip about you to others.

14. They’re not happy for your success.

15. They make you feel bad about yourself.

16. They’re unreliable and flaky.

17. They take but never give.

18. They compete with you instead of supporting you.

19. They’re only around during good times.

20. They put you down to make themselves feel better.

Dealing with Fake Friends

21. Don’t waste time on people who don’t value you.

22. It’s better to be alone than with fake friends.

23. Cut toxic people out of your life.

24. Focus on quality friendships, not quantity.

25. Trust your gut if something feels off about a friend.

26. Don’t chase after people who don’t make an effort.

27. Set boundaries with fake friends.

28. Surround yourself with positive people.

29. Learn from bad friendships and move on.

30. Your time is valuable. Spend it with those who matter.

Moving On from Fake Friends

31. Letting go of fake friends creates space for real ones.

32. Don’t look back. You’re not going that way.

33. Sometimes losing friends is gaining peace.

34. Your worth isn’t determined by those who don’t see it.

35. Forgive fake friends, but don’t forget the lesson.

36. Focus on your growth, not on those who’ve wronged you.

37. The right people will come at the right time.

38. Treasure the real friends who stuck by you.

39. Use the pain to become stronger and wiser.

40. Your happiness doesn’t depend on others.

Self-Worth and Friendship

41. You deserve friends who appreciate you.

42. Don’t change yourself to please fake friends.

43. Your value doesn’t decrease based on someone’s inability to see it.

44. Respect yourself enough to walk away from toxicity.

45. True friendship is built on mutual respect.

46. You are enough, with or without their approval.

47. Don’t dim your light for those who aren’t ready for your brightness.

48. Self-love attracts genuine connections.

49. Your worth is not measured by others’ opinions.

50. Be yourself. The right people will love the real you.

Wisdom About Friendship

51. Quality over quantity in friendships.

52. True friends are like stars. You don’t always see them, but you know they’re there.

53. Friendship isn’t about who you’ve known the longest. It’s about who came and never left.

54. A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.

55. Friends are the family we choose for ourselves.

56. Friendship isn’t about being inseparable. It’s about being separated and nothing changes.

57. A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.

58. True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils.

59. The greatest gift of life is friendship.

60. Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, “What! You too? I thought I was the only one.”

Quotes About Betrayal

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: How to Ask Ethnicity Questions: A Comprehensive Guide to Race and Ethnicity Data Collection
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: This guide will explain how to ask ethnicity questions in a good way.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
How to Ask Ethnicity Questions: A Comprehensive Guide to Race and Ethnicity Data Collection

Asking about someone’s race or ethnicity can be tricky. It’s a sensitive topic, but the information is often needed for important reasons. This guide will explain how to ask ethnicity questions in a good way. We’ll cover why this data matters, the rules for collecting it, and tips for doing it right.

Race and ethnicity are complex topics about how people see themselves and their background. There’s no perfect way to ask about it, but there are better and worse ways. The goal is to get accurate information while being respectful and inclusive of everyone.

This guide will help you understand:

• Why race and ethnicity data is collected

• The official rules for asking these questions

• Different ways to format the questions

• How to report and use the data properly

• Challenges and best practices

Whether you’re creating a survey, form, or database, this information will help you ask about race and ethnicity in a thoughtful way.

Why Collect Race and Ethnicity Data?

There are several important reasons to collect data on race and ethnicity:

• Legal requirements: Many organizations have to report this data to the government, like for EEO-1 reports.

• Tracking diversity: Companies and schools use it to measure diversity in their workforce or student body.

• Research: It helps study health, education, and other differences between groups.

• Policy decisions: Government agencies use it to make decisions about programs and resources.

• Civil rights: The data helps identify and address discrimination.

For example, a company might collect race data to see if they’re hiring people from different backgrounds fairly. Or a health study might look at how a disease affects different racial groups.

While collecting this data is useful, it’s also sensitive. People’s identities are personal and complex. That’s why it’s important to ask about race and ethnicity carefully and respectfully.

Race and Ethnicity Standards

In the United States, there are official rules for how the government collects race and ethnicity data. These come from the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). The current standards were set in 1997 and updated in 2023. Here are the key points:

• Race and ethnicity are considered two separate concepts

• There are two questions: one for ethnicity and one for race

• People can choose more than one race

• There are minimum categories that must be used

The minimum categories for ethnicity are:

• Hispanic or Latino

• Not Hispanic or Latino

The minimum categories for race are:

• American Indian or Alaska Native

• Asian

• Black or African American

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

• White

In 2023, a new category was added:

• Middle Eastern or North African

These standards help make sure data is collected the same way across different agencies and organizations. This makes it easier to compare and use the information.

The Two-Question Format

The official way to ask about race and ethnicity is with two separate questions. This is called the two-question format. Here’s how it works:

Question 1: Ethnicity

Are you Hispanic or Latino?

• Yes

• No

Question 2: Race

What is your race? Select one or more races to indicate what you consider yourself to be.

• American Indian or Alaska Native

• Asian

• Black or African American

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

• White

This format has some benefits:

• It separates Hispanic ethnicity from race

• It allows people to choose more than one race

• It matches how the government collects data

However, it also has some drawbacks:

• It can be confusing for some people

• It doesn’t capture all the ways people identify

• It takes more time and space than a single question

While this is the official format, many organizations are now using different approaches to be more inclusive and get better data.

Race and Ethnicity Categories

The standard race and ethnicity categories have specific definitions. It’s important to understand what each category means:

• Hispanic or Latino: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race.

• American Indian or Alaska Native: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment.

• Asian: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.

• Black or African American: A person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa.

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.

• White: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.

• Middle Eastern or North African: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Middle East or North Africa, including, for example, Lebanese, Iranian, Egyptian, Syrian, Iraqi, Israeli.

These categories are broad and don’t capture all the ways people identify. Many organizations add more detailed options or allow people to write in their own response.

Combined Race and Ethnicity Question

Many organizations are now using a combined question that asks about race and ethnicity together. This can be simpler and more inclusive. Here’s an example of how a combined question might look:

What is your race and/or ethnicity? Select all that apply.

• American Indian or Alaska Native

• Asian

• Black or African American

• Hispanic or Latino

• Middle Eastern or North African

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

• White

• Another race or ethnicity (please specify): _________

Benefits of a combined question:

• It’s shorter and simpler

• It allows people to select multiple options

• It doesn’t force people to separate race and ethnicity

• It can include more options easily

Challenges of a combined question:

• It doesn’t match the official two-question format

• It can make it harder to compare data with other sources

• It might not capture as much detail about Hispanic ethnicity

The best approach depends on your specific needs and goals for collecting the data.

Collecting Detailed Responses

To get more accurate and useful data, many organizations collect more detailed information about race and ethnicity. This can be done by:

• Adding subcategories under the main race categories

• Including a write-in option for people to specify their identity

• Asking separate questions about national origin or ancestry

Here’s an example of how you might collect more detailed Asian ethnicities:

If you selected Asian, please specify (select all that apply):

• Chinese

• Filipino

• Indian

• Japanese

• Korean

• Vietnamese

• Other Asian (please specify): _________

Collecting detailed data has benefits:

• It provides a more accurate picture of diversity

• It allows for more specific analysis

• It helps people feel their identity is recognized

But it also has challenges:

• It makes the question longer and more complex

• It can be hard to decide which subgroups to include

• It might make some people uncomfortable sharing such specific information

When collecting detailed data, it’s important to explain why you need it and how it will be used.

Question Instructions

Clear instructions are important when asking about race and ethnicity. Good instructions help people understand how to answer and why you’re asking. Here are some tips for writing instructions:

• Be clear about selecting multiple options: Say “Select all that apply” or “You may select more than one”

• Explain why you’re asking: Briefly state the purpose of collecting the data

• Mention it’s optional: If people don’t have to answer, make that clear

• Use inclusive language: Avoid terms that might exclude or offend people

Here’s an example of good instructions:

We are collecting this information to better understand the diversity of our community. Your response is voluntary and will be kept confidential. Please select all options that apply to you.

Some other things to consider in your instructions:

• Explain how the data will be used

• Mention any legal requirements for collecting the data

• Provide a way for people to ask questions if they’re unsure

Good instructions help people feel more comfortable answering and can improve the quality of your data.

Example Question Formats

There are many ways to format race and ethnicity questions. Here are some examples of different approaches:

Two-Question Format (Official OMB Standard)

1. Are you Hispanic or Latino?

• Yes

• No

2. What is your race? Select one or more races to indicate what you consider yourself to be.

• American Indian or Alaska Native

• Asian

• Black or African American

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

• White

Combined Question with Minimum Categories

What is your race and/or ethnicity? Select all that apply.

• American Indian or Alaska Native

• Asian

• Black or African American

• Hispanic or Latino

• Middle Eastern or North African

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

• White

• Another race or ethnicity (please specify): _________

Detailed Categories with Examples

What is your race and/or ethnicity? Select all that apply and enter additional details in the spaces below.

• American Indian, Alaska Native or Indigenous (e.g., Navajo Nation, Blackfeet Tribe, Maya)

• Asian

o East Asian (e.g., Chinese, Japanese, Korean)

o South Asian (e.g., Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi)

o Southeast Asian (e.g., Filipino, Vietnamese, Thai)

• Black or African American (e.g., African American, Jamaican, Nigerian)

• Hispanic or Latino (e.g., Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban)

• Middle Eastern or North African (e.g., Lebanese, Egyptian, Moroccan)

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (e.g., Native Hawaiian, Samoan, Tongan)

• White (e.g., German, Irish, English)

• Another race or ethnicity: _________

These are just a few examples. The best format depends on your specific needs and the population you’re surveying.

Reporting Race and Ethnicity Data

After collecting race and ethnicity data, it’s important to report it correctly. Here are some guidelines for reporting:

• Use the minimum categories: When possible, report data using at least the minimum OMB categories.

• Be clear about multiple responses: Explain how you’re handling people who selected more than one race.

• Don’t combine groups without explanation: If you group categories together, explain why and how.

• Protect privacy: Don’t report small groups that might identify individuals.

• Be consistent: Use the same categories and methods across different reports.

• Explain your methods: Describe how you collected and analyzed the data.

Here’s an example of how you might report race and ethnicity data:

Race and Ethnicity of Survey Respondents:

• Hispanic or Latino: 18%

• White (not Hispanic or Latino): 60%

• Black or African American (not Hispanic or Latino): 12%

• Asian (not Hispanic or Latino): 5%

• American Indian or Alaska Native (not Hispanic or Latino): 1%

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (not Hispanic or Latino): <1%

• Two or More Races (not Hispanic or Latino): 3%

• Another race or ethnicity: 1%

Note: Percentages may not add up to 100% due to rounding. Respondents could select multiple options. Those who selected Hispanic or Latino and another race are only counted in the Hispanic or Latino category.

When reporting, always consider the context and purpose of your data. Make sure your reporting is accurate, clear, and respectful.

Challenges in Collecting Race and Ethnicity Data

Collecting race and ethnicity data can be difficult. Here are some common challenges:

• Changing identities: How people identify can change over time or in different situations.

• Mixed heritage: Many people have complex racial and ethnic backgrounds that don’t fit neatly into categories.

• Cultural differences: Concepts of race and ethnicity vary across cultures and countries.

• Privacy concerns: Some people may not want to share this personal information.

• Limited categories: Standard categories don’t capture all identities.

• Inconsistent data: Different methods of asking can lead to different results.

• Misunderstanding: People might interpret questions or categories differently.

• Legal issues: There are laws about how this data can be collected and used.

Here’s an example of how these challenges might play out:

A person with one Black parent and one White parent might choose “Black or African American” in one survey, “White” in another, and “Two or More Races” in a third. Or they might not feel any of these options truly represent them.

To address these challenges:

• Be clear about why you’re collecting the data

• Offer multiple ways for people to identify themselves

• Keep up with changing standards and best practices

• Be flexible and open to feedback

Remember, there’s no perfect way to collect this data. The goal is to be as accurate and respectful as possible.

Best Practices for Asking About Race and Ethnicity

To collect good race and ethnicity data, follow these best practices:

1. Make it optional: Let people choose if they want to answer.

2. Allow multiple selections: Let people choose more than one race or ethnicity.

3. Include a write-in option: Give people a way to describe their identity in their own words.

4. Use clear, respectful language: Avoid outdated or offensive terms.

5. Explain why you’re asking: Tell people how the data will be used.

6. Keep it confidential: Protect people’s privacy and explain how you’ll do that.

7. Be consistent: Use the same categories across all your forms and surveys.

8. Stay updated: Keep up with changing standards and best practices.

9. Test your questions: Try out different formats to see what works best.

10. Be inclusive: Consider adding categories beyond the minimum standards if needed for your population.

Here’s an example of how these practices might look in action:

What is your race and/or ethnicity? This information helps us ensure our programs serve all communities. Your response is optional and confidential. Select all that apply.

• American Indian or Alaska Native

• Asian

• Black or African American

• Hispanic or Latino

• Middle Eastern or North African

• Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

• White

• Another race or ethnicity (please specify): _________

• I prefer not to answer

Remember, the best approach depends on your specific needs and the community you’re serving. Be open to feedback and willing to make changes as needed.

The Future of Race and Ethnicity Data Collection

How we ask about race and ethnicity is changing. Here are some trends and possible future directions:

• More detailed categories: There’s a push to include more specific ethnic groups.

• New categories: The Middle Eastern and North African category is being added to many surveys.

• Focus on identity: Questions might focus more on how people see themselves, not just ancestry.

• Multiple dimensions: Surveys might ask about race, ethnicity, and national origin separately.

• Open-ended questions: Some researchers are using open questions instead of checkboxes.

• Data linking: Combining data from different sources to get a more complete picture.

• AI and machine learning: New tools might help analyze complex racial and ethnic data.

• Global perspectives: More attention to how race and ethnicity are understood in different countries.

Here’s an example of how a future question might look:

How would you describe your racial and ethnic background? Please share as much detail as you’re comfortable with. You can mention multiple identities, specific ethnic groups, or national origins.

[Open text box for response]

The future of race and ethnicity data collection will likely involve more flexibility and nuance. The goal is to better capture the complex ways people identify themselves.

Conclusion

Asking about race and ethnicity is complex but important. Good data helps create fairer and more inclusive communities. Here are the key things to remember:

• There are official standards, but they’re always changing

• Be clear about why you’re asking and how you’ll use the data

• Let people choose multiple options or describe themselves

• Be respectful and protect people’s privacy

• Stay flexible and open to feedback

As our understanding of race and ethnicity evolves, so will how we ask about it. The most important thing is to approach the topic with care and respect for everyone’s identity.

By following best practices and staying informed, you can collect race and ethnicity data in a way that’s accurate, inclusive, and useful. This data can help create positive change and ensure everyone is represented fairly.

6 Fun Facts About Himeji Castle, The Most Beautiful Haunted Castle In Japan

6 Fun Facts About Himeji Castle, The Most Beautiful Haunted Castle In Japan

Nestled in the heart of Japan, Himeji Castle stands as a captivating blend of history, architecture, and folklore. This majestic fortress is often hailed as one of Japan's most beautiful castles. It has captured the imagination of visitors for centuries. But beneath its stunning exterior lies a collection of intriguing stories, making it more than just a picturesque landmark.

In this article, we will uncover some amazing facts about Himeji Castle that you may never know before. From its captivating history to its eerie tale, we will find out why it's known as the most beautiful haunted castle in Japan.

1. It Has Been Remodeled Several Times

Himeji Castle's story began in 1333 as a simple fort, but in 1346, it got a remarkable makeover and transformed into a castle. As time passed, it underwent several facelifts.

Remodeling Of Himeji Castle

One remarkable moment was in 1580 when Toyotomi Hideyoshi decided to add a three-story central tower on Himeyama Hill. Then, in 1600, Ikeda Terumasa gave the castle a complete overhaul, turning it into the grand castle we see today. These changes in Himeji Castle's history reveal not only its evolution but also Japan's rich history.

2. The Largest And Most Visited Castle In Japan

Himeji Castle is Japan's biggest castle. It has 83 buildings surrounded by fortifications and moats. It's also the most famous castle in the country, attracting around 1.5 million visitors every year.

Surprisingly, the beautiful Himeji Castle was once abandoned. In 1871, it was deserted, and some of its buildings were even destroyed to make room for Japanese army barracks.

3. It Was Once Abandoned

Saving The Abandoned Himeji Castle

The government planned to demolish the entire castle complex, but it was saved thanks to the efforts of Nakamura Shigeto, an army colonel. He convinced the government that Himeji Castle was a national treasure worth preserving, leading to its status as a national treasure and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

4. It Survived From Bombing During World War 2

One of the most amazing things about Himeji Castle is its survival during World War II. Despite heavy bombing in Himeji City, the castle remained virtually unscathed. An unexploded bomb landed on the top floor of Himeji Castle, sparing it from destruction.

Besides its beauty, Himeji Castle is famous for its ghostly tales, with one of the most famous being the story of Okiku.

5. The Tale Of Okiku

The Legend of Okiku

Legend has it that Okiku was a servant of Aoyama, a successful samurai. She discovered Aoyama's plot against his lord and reported it to her loyal lover, a warrior, leading to the failure of Aoyama's scheme.

Realizing Okiku's involvement, Aoyama accused her of stealing one of ten valuable dishes. She was captured, tortured, and eventually thrown into a well. It's believed that Okiku's spirit still lingers in the castle to this day.

Himeji Castle is believed to be the home of Osakabe Hime, a powerful yokai or Japanese spirit. She resembles a majestic old woman adorned in a 12-layered kimono. 

6. The House Of Osakabe Hime

Osakabe Hime

According to the Yokai website, Osakabe Hime can manipulate people like puppets and see into their hearts and desires. However, she avoids meeting people and spends most of her time in a secret area within Himeji Castle. Once a year, she meets the castle lord to predict the castle's fortune for the coming year, according to the website.

Park Min Young Reveals Her Diet Tips, But She Doesn't Recommend It

In the entertainment industry, many artists experience significant weight changes.

To show this character, Park Min Young decides to go on a strict diet.

As reported by Allkpop, she shared her tips. But she doesn't recommend it.

The diet method is to reduce food intake and dependence on ionic drinks. 

This tip worries many people.

This extreme diet has the potential to have negative health effects, such as muscle loss, hair loss, and digestive problems.

Park Min Young has stated that she does not recommend such extreme diet methods. 

She had doubts about whether she could fully into the character considering her age. But in the end her dedicated success in the drama.

In her previous role as Kim Mi Soo in the tvN drama 'What's Wrong with Secretary Kim,' she focused on sports every day.

Earth's Largest Infinity Palace is a Legacy of Ancient World History

Earth's Largest Infinity Palace is a Legacy of Ancient World History

World history calls this ancient palace complex Weiyang. When translated, it means that it has yet to reach its center point or that there is still more than half of it. Colloquially, it can also mean endless or borderless.

It is actually one of the two main palace complexes of the Han Dynasty, the other of which is called Changle Palace. The name Changle can be translated as eternal happiness, and it is thought that the combination of the two palaces' characters means that eternal happiness has not yet reached its halfway point.

Weiyang Palace is located in the city of Chang'an, now known as Xi'an, in central China's Shaanxi province. The complex spans 2.15 kilometers from east to west, while the length from north to south totals 2.25 kilometers. This means that the total area covered is 4.8 square kilometers.

Although Weiyang Palace was once the largest palace complex in the world, it remains in ruins today.

The few relics of world history that can now be seen bear witness to the splendor of the Han dynasty that once occupied the area.

Weiyang Palace is an imperial palace complex built during the ancient Chinese empire. Although the palace complex was built during the Han Dynasty, it was also used by several other Chinese imperial dynasties.

Eventually, Weiyang Palace lost its importance and was no longer used by Chinese emperors. The palace is now razed to the ground; all that remains today are archaeological ruins.

According to Ancient Origins, in 202 BC, the Han Dynasty was founded. Two years later, its founder, Emperor Gaozu of Han, commissioned the construction of the imperial complex.

This colossal task was overseen by chancellor Xiao He. The palace complex was intended as an office where the emperor worked.

Previously, the emperor's palace was in Changle Palace, built on Xingle Palace's ruins. After the emperor moved his palace to Weiyang Palace, Changle Palace was converted into the empress's residence.

Although the Han Dynasty ended in 220 AD, Weiyang continued to be used by several different imperial dynasties. For example, the Western Jin Dynasty, which had its capital in Chang'an between 312 and 316 AD, utilized this palace complex.

During the subsequent Northern and Southern Dynasties, Chang'an served as the capital of several states, meaning the palace was also used during this period.

According to World History, Chang'an, located near modern Xian in Shaanxi Province, was the capital of several ancient Chinese dynasties from Zhou to Tang

Eventually became one of the world's great metropolises, with regular tree-lined streets, high walls, recreational parks, and areas used for specific functions.


The city layout resembles other Asian capitals, especially Japan and Korea. Mark Cartwright mentions, "In the early period, Chang'an was dominated by the Weiyang palace built on cut terraces on the dragon's head hill above the city."

Chang'an was an ideal location for a capital because it was surrounded by mountains. This boundary provided a safe barrier from invading enemies. It was also close to the Yellow River and the Wei River. The advantages of geography are described in the ancient history of the Han Dynasty written by Pan Ku.

Chang'an continued to be the capital of the Chinese Empire during the Tang Dynasty, but during this period, Weiyang Palace lost its importance and usefulness. Tang emperors began building new palaces for themselves.

The destruction of Weiyang Palace is also said to have occurred during the Tang Dynasty. It is claimed that raiders, on their way to the Tang capital, razed the palace complex to the ground.

It is known that during the An Lushan Rebellion of the 8th century and during the Huang Chao Rebellion of the 9th century, the rebels captured the Tang capital. Because of this, little remains of the once magnificent palace today.

The area occupied by the former Weiyang Palace is now a world-historical archaeological site. Excavations conducted there have revealed some information. For example, archaeological research shows that the palace complex was surrounded by a large square wall accessible through several gates. In addition, two entrances in each complex division had gate towers.

Archaeological information about Weiyang Palace is complemented by textual sources. For example, while archaeologists can provide information on the dimensions of the palace's main hall, the materials used for the foundations of these halls can be gleaned from historical texts.

In 2014, Weiyang Palace was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

The five-thousand-kilometer Silk Road network from central China to the Zhetsyu region in Central Asia is designated as the Silk Road: Chang'an-Tianshan Corridor Route Network.

Silk Road UNESCO, World Heritage Sites are sections of the ancient Silk Road and historical sites located along the route designated as World Heritage Sites by UNESCO.

6 Most Haunted Places In Greensboro, NC, That You Must Visit

Greensboro, North Carolina, is known for its rich history and culture; some consider it the Confederacy's final capital city.

But did you know that it is also home to several haunted places? It ranges from historic battlefields to college campuses and even a mysterious bridge.

Greensboro has no shortage of spooky stories to tell. If you're a fan of the paranormal or just looking for a thrill, here are six haunted places in Greensboro that you must visit.




Most Haunted Places In Greensboro, North Carolina

Photo: flickr/Chris Dilworth

1. Guilford Courthouse National Park

This historic battlefield was the site of a pivotal battle during the Revolutionary War. Many visitors have reported hearing phantom gunshots. Some also see ghostly soldier apparitions wandering the grounds.
Photo: flickr/Chris Dilworth

flickr/Guilford College

2. Guilford College

Guilford College was founded in 1837. Guilford College is rumored to be haunted by the spirit of a former student who tragically died on campus.

3. The Biltmore Greensboro

Originally built in 1895, The Biltmore Greensboro is a luxurious hotel with a dark past. Guests have reported encountering strange noises. Some visitors also told unexplained shadows throughout the building.

4. Greensboro College

Greensboro College was established in 1838. Greensboro College is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former professor. His apparations still roam the halls late at night.
Photo: flickr/Greensboro College

5. New Garden Cemetery

This cemetery dates back to the early 1800s. It is the final resting place of many Greensboro residents. Visitors have reported seeing apparitions and hearing eerie whispers among the tombstones.
Photo: ngfm.org

6. Lydia’s Bridge


Legend has it that a young woman named Lydia tragically died on this bridge many years ago. Some say her spirit still lingers, appearing to those who dare to cross the bridge at night.

BBC News Presenter Apologizes After Raising Middle Finger During Live Broadcast

BBC News Presenter Apologizes After Raising Middle Finger During Live Broadcast

BBC News presenter Maryam Moshiri was caught giving the camera the middle finger live on air in what she says was a “private joke” gone wrong.

Moshiri was momentarily seen with a raised middle finger as BBC News switched to the studio for the headlines. Realizing she was live on air, she quickly scrambled to compose herself and told viewers: “Live from London, this is BBC News.”

The blunder has been clipped and shared by various X (formerly Twitter) accounts and has since gone viral. Moshiri has now issued an explanation and apology.

The presenter explained that she was sharing a private joke with her producers in the studio, which involved counting down with her fingers and ending with a potentially offensive gesture.

“Hey everyone, yesterday just before the top of the hour, I was joking around a bit with the team in the gallery,” she wrote on X. “I was pretending to count down as the director was counting me down from 10-0.. including the fingers to show the number. So, from 10 fingers held up to one.

“When we got to 1, I turned [my] finger around as a joke and did not realize that this would be caught on camera. It was a private joke with the team, and I’m so sorry it went out on air! It was not my intention for this to happen and I’m sorry if I offended or upset anyone. I wasn’t ‘flipping the bird’ at viewers or even a person really. It was a silly joke that was meant for a small number of my mates.”

Moshiri is one of the BBC News channel’s chief presenters and has worked for the broadcasting company for over 20 years.

In other news, CBBC stars Hacker T Dog and Lauren Layfield recently reunited to replicate their viral “We’re just normal men” clip from 2016. The clip, which resurfaced and went viral in 2022, showed the dog puppet, controlled by puppeteer Phil Fletcher, saying in a deadpan voice, “We’re just normal men… we’re just innocent men,” causing Layfield to break into laughter.

Over a year after the clip circulated online, Layfield and Hacker T Dog reunited in a post on the latter’s Instagram page on Friday (November 24). In the new clip, the pair channeled the energy of their original video as they jokingly attempted to come up with a 'meme' moment.

How Long to Cook Salmon Perfectly for Beginners: A Step-by-Step Tutorial

Salmon is an adaptable and delicious fish. Salmon can be prepared in various ways. However, achieving the perfect doneness can be challenging, especially for beginners.

How Long to Cook Salmon Perfectly for Beginners: A Step-by-Step Tutorial

This step-by-step tutorial will guide you through how long to cook salmon perfectly.

We will use four cooking methods: air fryer, oven, stovetop pan, and grill. Each technique offers a unique flavor profile and texture. So you can choose the one that suits your preference. Let's look at the details with easy-to-follow recipes and instructions.

Let's check out some tips and tricks on how long to cook salmon perfectly, compiled from numerous sources, on Friday (22/09/2023).

ca-creative-unsplash

Tips On How To Cook Salmon

Remember that these tips are general guidelines. The exact cooking time may vary based on factors like your tools, the temperature of the salmon when you start, and personal taste choices. It's always a good idea to watch your salmon as it cooks. Then, modify the cooking time as needed to complete the perfect result. Here are some general tips on how long to cook salmon:

• Consider the Thickness: The cooking time for salmon depends mainly on the thickness of the fillet. Thicker pieces will take longer to cook than thinner ones. As a rule of thumb, you can estimate about 4-6 minutes of cooking time per half-inch (1.27 cm) of thickness.

• Use a Timer: Set a timer to avoid overcooking your salmon. It's easy to get distracted in the kitchen. So, it prevents salmon from being perfectly cooked to overcooked quickly.

• Room Temperature: Allow your salmon to come to room temperature before cooking. This helps it cook more evenly.

Tips

• Preheat the Cooking Surface: Whether you're grilling, pan-frying, or baking, ensure the cooking surface is correctly preheated. This provides a nice sear or crust on the outside.

• Skin-On or Skinless: If you're cooking salmon with the skin on, start cooking it skin-side down. This allows the skin to crisp up nicely. If you don't want the skin, you can easily remove it after cooking.

• Seasoning: Season your salmon with salt and pepper before cooking. You can also use additional herbs, spices, or marinades to add flavor.

• Watch for Doneness Signs: Salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork and is opaque in the center. The flesh should change from translucent to opaque.

• Resting Time: Allow the cooked salmon to rest for a few minutes before serving. This helps redistribute the juices and ensures a juicy, flavorful result.
Photo: pixabay-picjumbo_com

• Use a Meat Thermometer (Optional): To be very detailed about the doneness, you can use a meat thermometer. Insert it into the thickest part of the salmon. It should read around 145°F (63°C) for cooked salmon.

• Modify for Cooking Method: Different cooking methods have different cooking times. For example, grilling and pan-frying are quicker, while baking or broiling may take longer. Refer to specific recipes for precise times.

• Experiment: The ideal cooking time for salmon can vary depending on personal preference. Some prefer a little undercooked salmon in the center for a more tender and moist texture. While others like it to be fully cooked. Experiment to find the level of doneness you like best.

How Long to Cook Salmon in an Air Fryer

Ingredients:


• 2 salmon fillets

• 1 tablespoon olive oil

• Salt and pepper to taste

• Lemon wedges for garnish (optional)

Photo: sunorwind-unsplash

Instructions:

1. Preheat your air fryer to 375°F (190°C) for 5 minutes.

2. While heating the air fryer, brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season them with salt and pepper.

3. Place the salmon fillets in the air fryer basket in a single layer, leaving some space between them.

4. Cook for 8-10 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fillets. For every inch of thickness, add 2 minutes to the cooking time.

5. Check for doneness by gently inserting a fork or knife into the thickest part of the fillet. If it flakes easily and is opaque in the center, it's done.

6. Serve hot with lemon wedges if desired.

Photo: david-b-townsend-unsplash

How Long to Cook Salmon in the Oven

Ingredients:

• 2 salmon fillets

• 1 tablespoon olive oil

• Salt and pepper to taste

• Fresh herbs (such as dill or thyme) for garnish (optional)

Photo: melanie-andersen-unsplash

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).

2. Brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season them with salt and pepper.

Photo: ca-creative-unsplash

3. Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.

4. Bake for 12-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fillets. Add 2-3 minutes to the cooking time for every inch of thickness.

5. The salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork and is opaque in the center.

6. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired before serving.

How Long to Cook Salmon in a Pan

Ingredients:

• 2 salmon fillets

• 1 tablespoon butter or olive oil

• Salt and pepper to taste

• Lemon slices for garnish (optional)

Instructions:

1. Heat a skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat and add butter or olive oil.

2. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.

3. Place the fillets in the hot pan, skin-side down, if applicable.

4. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the fillets. Add 1-2 minutes to the cooking time for every inch of thickness.

5. Flip the fillets gently using a spatula when the bottom side is golden brown.

6. The salmon is ready when it flakes easily with a fork and has a crispy exterior.

7. Serve with lemon slices if desired.

Photo: micheile-henderson-unsplash

How Long to Cook Salmon on the Grill

Ingredients:

• 2 salmon fillets

• 1 tablespoon olive oil

• Salt and pepper to taste

• Lemon wedges and fresh herbs for garnish (optional)

Photo: jennifer-burk-unsplash

Instructions:

1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat and oil the grates to prevent sticking.

2. Brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

3. Place the fillets on the grill, skin-side down, if applicable.

4. Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the fillets. Add 1-2 minutes to the cooking time for every inch of thickness.

5. Flip the fillets carefully using a spatula when grill marks appear, and the salmon releases easily.

6. The salmon is done when it flakes easily and has grill marks on both sides.

7. Garnish with lemon wedges and fresh herbs if desired.

With these step-by-step tutorials on how long to cook salmon using different methods, you can confidently prepare this delicious fish to perfection.

Do you prefer an air fryer, oven, stovetop pan, or grill? Follow the recommended cooking times and techniques for a delicious salmon dish. It will impress your family and friends. Enjoy your culinary journey!

50 Math Jokes for Kids That Will Make You Giggle

50 Math Jokes for Kids That Will Make You Giggle

Math jokes for kids are a fun way to make learning more enjoyable. These jokes bring smiles to our faces while also helping us see math in a new, fun light. Whether at home, in class, or during a break, math jokes can brighten up any moment.

Many of us find math difficult or boring, and this can make learning a challenge. Math jokes for kids can help change that by adding humor to the subject. When we laugh at a math joke, it can reduce our stress and make us feel more positive about learning math.

In this article, we have selected some of the best math jokes for kids from various sources, Thursday (12/9/2024). These jokes will not only make us laugh but also help us feel more relaxed and confident about math.

The Best Math Jokes for Kids

1. Why is six afraid of seven? Because seven eight nine!

2. Why was the math book sad? It had too many problems.

3. Parallel lines have so much in common. It's a shame they'll never meet.

4. Where do math lovers go on a tropical vacation? The Bermuda Triangle.

5. What did the triangle say to the circle? You're pointless.

6. Why should you never talk to pi? Because it will go on and on forever.

7. What is a math teacher's favorite season? Sum-mer.

8. What's the king of the pencil case? The ruler.

9. Why was the math teacher suspicious of prime numbers? They were all odd.

10. What did the calculator tell the student before their math test? "Don't worry, you can count on me!"

11. Are monsters good at math? No, unless you Count Dracula.

12. What do you call a group of men who love math? Algebros.

13. How do you transform seven into an even number? Just remove the "s."

14. Did you hear the one about the statistician? Probably.

15. Why shouldn't you let advanced math intimidate you? It's easy as pi!

16. Why can't a nose be 12 inches long? Because then it would be a foot.

17. Why wasn't anyone talking to the circle? Because there was no point.

18. What is a bird's favorite type of math? Owl-gebra.

19. Where do multiplication problems eat breakfast? – At Time's Tables.

20. Why do plants hate math? Because it gives them square roots.

21. Why was the obtuse triangle always upset? Because it's never right.

22. Which snakes are good at math? Adders.

23. What is three plus four? A math problem.

24. What did the zero say to the eight? Nice belt!

25. What are ten things you can always count on? Your fingers.

More Funny Math Jokes for Kids

26. How do you maintain heat in a cold room? Head to the corner. It's probably 90 degrees there.

27. Who do geometry teachers like to hang out with? A small circle of friends.

28. Why can't you trust mathematicians? Their loyalties are divided.

29. How many apples can you put in an empty box? One. After that, it's not empty any more.

30. Where do math teachers go on vacation? Times Square!

31. Why did the student get upset when their teacher called them average? It was a 'mean' thing to say.

32. What do you call an adorable angle? Acute angle.

33. Why did the two 4's skip lunch? Because they already eight!

34. Why was the equal sign so humble? Because it knew it wasn't greater than or less than anyone else!

35. Why did the student eat his math homework? Because the teacher told him it was a piece of pi!

36. Why did seven eat nine? Because you're supposed to eat 3 squared meals a day!

37. What's the best tool to do math? Multi-pliers.

38. How do you make one vanish? Add a 'g' and it's gone!

39. What do you call a number that can't keep still? A roamin' numeral!

40. Why was the math test so happy? Because it got a lot of "pi"!

41. How does a mathematician plow fields? With a pro-tractor.

42. Parallel lines have so much in common … It's a shame they'll never meet.

43. I saw my math teacher with a piece of graph paper yesterday. I think he must be plotting something.

44. What's a swimmer's favorite kind of math? Dive-ision!

45. Why did the student do multiplication problems on the floor? The teacher told him not to use tables.

46. You know what seems odd to me? Numbers that can't
be divided by two.

47. There are three types of people in this world; those that can count, and those that cannot.

49. Why do we never ask a big number for dinner? It is hard to 'count' on them.

50. Why was the multiplication table so happy at the party? Because it was in its prime!

'Squid Game' Actor Oh Young Soo Found Guilty Of Sexual Harrasment

'Squid Game' Actor Oh Young Soo Found Guilty Of Sexual Harrasment

Actor Oh Young-soo, famous for his role in "Squid Game," has been found guilty of sexual misconduct by a South Korean court. 

He received an eight-month suspended sentence and was ordered to attend classes on sexual violence.

Oh, aged 79, denies the charges and plans to appeal. 

He was accused of inappropriate behavior with a female actor in 2017, including hugging, kissing, and making sexual comments towards her.

Despite his fame from "Squid Game," the court found the victim's claims against Oh valid. 

Oh's career has been affected by this issue, and he won't be returning for the second season of Squid Game, set to release later this year.

Quotes from Winnie the Pooh About Love and Life

Have you ever heard of Winnie the Pooh?

It's an animated movie that tells the story of a lovable bear named Winnie.

The movie takes place in the Hundred Acre Wood, where Winnie and her friends go on exciting quests and solve problems.

But what makes the movie special are the memorable quotes from Winnie the Pooh. They teach us valuable life lessons about friendship and kindness.

Quotes from Winnie the Pooh are heartwarming sayings from the characters that have inspired people until now.

These quotes remind us that even the smallest acts of love can make a big difference the life of others. So let’s dive into a list of quotes from Winnie the Pooh!

Quotes from Winnie the Pooh on Love

  • "Some people care too much. I think it’s called love."

35 Self-Worth Quotes: Positive Phrases to Boost Your Confidence

35 Self-Worth Quotes: Positive Phrases to Boost Your Confidence

Self-confidence is like a superpower that helps us overcome life's challenges with resilience and courage. But sometimes, maintaining that confidence can be challenging. This is where self-worth quotes come in.

Reading self-worth quotes can encourage a mindset of self-belief and positivity. Whether you're seeking a little extra encouragement or a reminder of your worth, they are here to remind you just how special and capable you truly are.

Let's dive into these positive phrases and let them serve as guiding lights on your journey toward greater confidence and self-belief!


Self Worth Quotes on Accepting Yourself

1. “Self-worth comes from one thing – thinking that you are worthy.” – Wayne Dyer

2. “It took many years of vomiting up all the filth I’d been taught about myself, and half-believed before I was able to walk on the earth as though I had a right to be here.” – James Baldwin

3. “You have been criticizing yourself for years, and it hasn’t worked. Try approving of yourself and see what happens.” – Louise L. Hay

4. “Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.” – Jean Vanier

5. “It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves.” – Sir Edmund Hillary

6. “Did your mom ever tell you, ‘If you can’t say something nice, don’t say anything’? She was right–and talking nicely also applies when you’re talking to yourself, even inside your head.” – Victoria Moran

7. “Because one believes in oneself, one doesn’t try to convince others. Because one is content with oneself, one doesn’t need others’ approval. Because one accepts oneself, the whole world accepts him or her.” – Lao Tzu

8. "Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it." - M. Scott Peck

9. "To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don’t need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself." - Thich Nhat Hanh

10. "You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection." - Buddha

Self-Worth Quotes to Love Yourself

1. “Find the love you seek, by first finding the love within yourself. Learn to rest in that place within you that is your true home.” – Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

2. “Love is the great miracle cure. Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.” – Louise Hay

3. “Love yourself enough to set boundaries. Your time and energy are precious. You get to choose how you use it. You teach people how to treat you by deciding what you will and won’t accept.” – Anna Taylor

4. “No other love no matter how genuine it is, can fulfill one’s heart better than unconditional self-love.” – Edmond Mbiaka

5. “If you don’t love yourself, nobody will. Not only that, you won’t be good at loving anyone else. Loving starts with the self.” – Wayne Dyer

6. “Self-love is an ocean and your heart is a vessel. Make it full, and any excess will spill over into the lives of the people you hold dear. But you must come first.” – Beau Taplin

7. “To love oneself is the beginning of a life-long romance” – Oscar Wilde

8. “Loving yourself isn’t vanity. It’s sanity.” – Katrina Mayer

9. "Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world." - Lucille Ball

10. “I think the most important thing in life is self-love, because if you don’t have self-love, and respect for everything about your own body, your own soul, your own capsule, then how can you have an authentic relationship with anyone else?” – Shailene Woodley

Self-Worth Quotes to Always Follow Your Heart

1. “Don’t waste your energy trying to change opinions … Do your thing, and don’t care if they like it.” – Tina Fey

2. You have no responsibility to live up to what other people think you ought to accomplish. I have no responsibility to be like they expect me to be. It’s their mistake, not my failing.” ― Richard P. Feynman

3. “Don’t let the noise of others’ opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most importantly, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become. Everything else is secondary.” – Steve Jobs

4. “Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don’t matter and those who matter don’t mind.” — Dr. Seuss

5. "Your self-worth is determined by you. You don’t have to depend on someone telling you who you are." - Beyoncé

NCT's Jaehyun Announces Military Enlistment Date

NCT's Jaehyun Announces Military Enlistment Date

NCT's Jaehyun has officially announced his military enlistment date.

On September 26, his agency released the following statement.

"Hello, this is SM Entertainment.

NCT’s Jaehyun applied to the Army Band and received a notification of acceptance from the Military Manpower Administration today.

Accordingly, he is scheduled to enlist as an active-duty soldier on November 4 to fulfill his mandatory service." 

"On the day of his entry into the recruit training center, there will be no official event to prevent safety accidents due to the congestion caused by the presence of many soldiers and their families."

"We ask for your unwavering support and love until the day Jaehyun completes his military service and returns in good health.

Thank you."

Born in 1997, he will be the second NCT member to enlist, following Taeyong.

Taeyong joining the military back in April 2024.

Jaehyun of NCT will enlist in the military on November 24, 2024, and be discharged on May 3, 2026.

10 Fun Facts and Trivia About Sound Waves to Expand Your Knowledge

10 Fun Facts and Trivia About Sound Waves to Expand Your Knowledge

Take a beautiful journey into the world of sound. It is where the echoes of curiosity echo through unexpected corridors of knowledge.

These fun facts and trivia about sound waves offer glimpses into the often-overlooked nuances of auditory wonders. It expands our understanding of how sound shapes the tapestry of our sensory experiences.

The symphony of nature unfolds unexpectedly, and one of the most beautiful chapters is about erupting volcanoes.

1. Erupting Volcanoes Are The Loudest Natural Sound

Beyond the visual splendor, these geological giants release the loudest natural sounds on Earth. During the eruption of Krakatoa, measuring instruments located 160 km (100 mi) away captured the thunderous roar, registering a staggering 172 dB. Scientists consider this eruption the loudest sound ever accurately measured by humans, highlighting the raw power of Earth's fiery explosions.

Venturing into the vastness of outer space, an eerie silence envelops the cosmic. The reason lies in the essential nature of sound waves—they need a medium to travel through.

2. There Is No Sound in the Space Outer

On Earth, air molecules vibrating and hitting serve as this medium. However, in the vacuum of space, empty of air or any other medium, sound waves find no path to cross. The absence of sound in space creates surreal silence. It leaves the cosmic theater empty of the auditory drama we experience on our home planet.

pexels-steve-johnson-

3. Soundproof Paint Isn’t An Effective Soundproofing Solution

In the search for calmness, the charm of soundproof paint with the promise of noise-free environments. Ingeniously designed to absorb sound and convert it into harmless heat energy, the science behind soundproof paint is fascinating.

However, the practical outcomes may not meet the heightened expectations.

Despite its charming belief, soundproof paint often falls short of providing the complete soundproofing solutions it suggests. The complexity of sound absorption and room acoustics must be more nuanced to achieve the desired results.

Fun Facts About Sound Waves

Dive into the depths of an underwater world. You'll encounter a curious phenomenon—sound traveling with fantastic clarity and speed.

4. Sound Moves Faster Through Water

This is attributed to the densely packed water molecules. It allows sound waves to travel about four times faster than in the air. Underwater soundscapes tell of a realm where clarity and rapid transmission define the acoustic landscape. It's a reminder of the unique physics at play under the surface, where the aquatic environment shapes the journey of sound in fascinating ways.

The speed of sound is a dynamic parameter influenced by the temperature of the medium it travels through. At a generally accepted temperature of 20° C (68° F), the speed of sound is calculated at 343 m/second, equivalent to 1,235 km/h, 1,125 ft/s, and 767 mph.

5. The Speed Of Sound Depends On The Temperature

However, this speed changes with temperature. In water, where molecules are densely packed, the sound rate accelerates to 1,482 m/second. This speed variability proves the intricate relationship between sound and the environmental conditions it encounters. Sea lions can hear much better underwater than on land. It enriches our understanding of the various acoustic landscapes surrounding us.

In the symphony of buzzing insects, flies emerge as silent performers. Despite their endless flight and constant presence, flies cannot be heard.

6. Flies Cannot Hear

Denied from the auditory realm, these buzzing animals navigate their surroundings using other senses, primarily relying on their antennae. Flies live in a silent dimension in a world often filled with buzzing sounds. Their existence is marked by the absence of the very vibrations they create.

Man's best friend, the loyal canine companion, has auditory prowess that exceeds human abilities. With their extraordinary hearing ability, dogs can detect high-frequency sounds well beyond the range of human ears. This unique gift transforms them into nature's perfect sound detectors, tuned to sensitivity.

7. Dogs Hear Better Than Humans

In the pastoral realm, an incredible harmony unfolds as cows tell of their unexpected liking for music.

8. Music Helps Cows Produce Milk

Farmers have discovered that exposing cows to calming melodies contributes to a more relaxed environment. Amazingly, this calm atmosphere translates into increased milk production. The next time you encounter a farmer serenading his herd, you'll see entertainment and a strategic orchestration to benefit cow productivity.

The scary thrill of horror movies is often heightened by an unseen power— infrasound.  Filmmakers leverage this low-frequency sound, invisible to the human ear, to cause fear and unease.

9. Horror Movies Use Infrasound

Infrasound's hidden effects can trigger anxiety, shivering, and even heart pulses. It strengthens the psychological impact of cinematic fright. Unseen but deeply felt, infrasound weaves a chilling undertone that stays long after the credits roll.

Beyond the human hearing spectrum, the animal kingdom grows as a heightened sense symphony. Dogs are famous for their sensitive hearing and sound navigators, detecting frequencies far beyond human abilities.

10. Animals and Sound

Dolphins are masters of communication, harnessing ultrasound and echolocation to navigate their surroundings. Bats, with their ultrasound prowess, read their environments with precision.

Foxes, often overlooked, have incredibly sharp and precise hearing. It showcases the various auditory adaptations that thrive in the animal kingdom.

In sound, these fun facts and trivia invite us to listen more closely.

These facts about sounds explore the silent worlds of flies, the musical preferences of cows, and the unseen that haunt the shadows of horror films. As we solve the mysteries of sound, let these pieces of knowledge resonate. It creates a harmonious symphony of understanding in the auditory landscape of our curiosity.

Fun Facts About Sound Waves

25 Life Is Too Short Quotes to Inspire You to Value Your Time and Enjoy Every Moment

25 Life Is Too Short Quotes to Inspire You to Value Your Time and Enjoy Every Moment

Life is too short to waste a single moment. In the hustle and bustle of our daily lives, it's easy to lose sight of the preciousness of time.

That's why we've gathered some insightful "Life is Too Short Quotes" to remind you to cherish every second. So you can enjoy every experience, and embrace every chance that comes your way.

Life Is Too Short Quotes

"Life is Too Short Quotes" capture timeless wisdom that highlights the brevity of life.

It also motivates individuals to pursue their passions, create meaningful relationships, and enjoy the present. We can use these quotes as motivation to value our time, prioritize what matters most, and live life to the fullest.

Life Is Too Short Quotes

Best "Life Is Too Short Quotes"

  • "One Life is about realizing there’s no second chances in this one life that we were given to live." – Jonathan Anthony Burkett

  • "Life is a preparation for the future; and the best preparation for the future is to live as if there were none." – Albert Einstein

  • "Life is available only in the present moment. If you abandon the present moment you cannot live the moments of your daily life deeply." – Thich Nhat Hanh
  • "We cannot waste time. We can only waste ourselves." – George M. Adams

  • "Life’s too short to wait, but sometimes, a few things, a few people, a few magicks, a few miracles are worth the wait."– Radhika Mundra

  • "After all, life is too short to be anything but happy." – Karl Marx

  • "Life is too short, and the time we waste in yawning never can be regained." – Stendhal

  • "I think life is far too short to concentrate on your past. I rather look into the future." – Lou Reed

  • "Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?" – Friedrich Nietzche

  • "In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years." – Abraham Lincoln

Life Is Too Short Quotes to Inspire You

  • "Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand-and melting like a snowflake."– Francis Bacon

  • "Life is short, so I’m knowing exactly where I’m putting my time. I don’t want to do things that I don’t have to do." – Mira Nair

  • "Short as life is, we make it still shorter by the careless waste of time." – Victor Hugo

  • "Every moment of life is precious and can never happen again and therefore is a reason to appreciate, be grateful for and celebrate the fact that you are alive." – Zelig Pliskin

  • "Live honestly to a higher note. Life is too short. So, do the best you can and live your life to a higher note." – Kimora Lee Simmons

  • "The trick is to enjoy life. Don’t wish away your days, waiting for better ones ahead." – Marjorie Pay Hinckley

  • "Our time here on this planet is limited. Focus on what brings you joy – not brings you stress." – Unknown

  • "There comes a point in your life when your love for yourself needs to become more important than your need to hold onto the past." – Karen Salmansohn

Life Is Too Short Quotes to Inspire You to Enjoy Every Moment

  • "Life is short. Time is fast. No replay. No rewind. So enjoy every moment as it comes." – Unknown

  • "Be the best part of you. Live your own best life. Recognize that we all have things we are good at, things we are not good at, and everything in between." – Ari Gunzburg

  • "Don’t let fear interfere. It’s how you use your fear that counts. Don’t let it exhaust you -let it excite you. Change the narrative. You only get one life." – Brittany Burgunder

  • "Enjoy every moment you have. Because in life, there are no rewinds, only flashbacks."– Anmol Andore

  • "Life is short. Stop worrying so much. Have fun. Be grateful. Be yourself. Don’t allow others to bring you down. Life is a one time offer. Live to your fullest." – Karen Salmansohn

  • "Quit hanging on to the handrails . . . Let go. Surrender. Go for the ride of your life. Do it every day." – Melody Beattie

"Life is short. So do the things which make you happy. And be with people who make you happy. Look for the good in every day – even if some days you have to look harder." – Karen Salmansohn

Depression is a serious mental health issue that affects millions of people worldwide.

Depression Movies

1. Silver Linings Playbook (2012)

He navigates life after being released from a mental institution. Jennifer Lawrence stars as Tiffany, a young widow struggling with her own mental health issues. Together, they form an unlikely bond that helps them navigate their challenges. You can stream "Silver Linings Playbook" on Amazon Prime.

  • Genre: Comedy/Horror
  • IMDb: 7,8/10

"Little Miss Sunshine" tells the story of the dysfunctional Hoover family.

2. Little Miss Sunshine (2006)

10 Girls' Bangs Hairstyles: Look Beautiful and Suitable for All Face Shapes

The hairstyle with bangs has been a popular trend among women for years. This hair style suits all hair types, face shapes, and ages.

10 Girls' Bangs Hairstyles: Look Beautiful and Suitable for All Face Shapes

Bangs are shorter strands of hair that are styled to the front, giving a fresh and elegant impression.

One of the advantages of having bangs is its ability to adjust to the shape of the face.

Bangs can change the appearance of the face and add exciting dimensions.

For example, for someone with a round face, side-swept bangs can create the illusion of a longer face.

Meanwhile, for people with long faces, thick bangs can help make their face look more proportional.

Here are some popular girl's bangs hairstyles that many people love, according to various sources.

Micro Bangs Hairstyle Model

Micro bangs, also known as baby bangs, are a hairstyle with short bangs that fall above the eyebrow line. This style was once popular among Korean women as it highlights and enhances the oval shape of the face.

Side-Swept Bangs Hair Style

The side-swept bangs hairstyle is a highly versatile choice. The front hair is cut as bangs and styled to fall on one side of the face.

This style is suitable for various face shapes, especially providing a special effect on oval and square faces.

Side-swept bangs make the face appear more balanced and add extra dimension to the appearance.

Straight Bangs Hair Model

The straight bangs hairstyle showcases simplicity and elegance. The front hair is cut evenly with the same length. This style suits those with strong jawlines and round faces.

Layered Bangs Hairstyle

Layered bangs or fringe is a hairstyle that adds dimension to the bangs by giving them multiple layers.

The front hair is transformed into bangs with thinner and more dynamic layers.

This style is perfect for those who want to soften their jawline or highlight their facial features.

With layered bangs, the appearance looks softer and more feminine.

Short Bangs Hairstyle Model

Short bangs create a stronger and bolder impression. The front hair is cut shorter than usual. This style is suitable for those with small foreheads or sharp facial features.

Long Layered Ponytail

This model combines long front bangs with added layers to the hair. This cut is suitable for various face shapes, especially oval faces.

Thick Retro Bangs Hairstyle

Inspired by the hairstyles of the 60s and 70s, this thick bangs have a strong retro vibe. For those who want to stand out with a classic touch, these thick bangs create a dramatic and attention-grabbing effect.

Middle Part Bangs Hairstyle Model

The front hair is arranged by splitting the bangs right in the middle. This style gives an elegant touch. The separated bangs in the middle highlight a more balanced facial impression and draw attention.

Curly Bangs Hairstyle

For those who have curly hair or want to try a different look, curly bangs are the right choice. The front part of the hair is cut into bangs and left to naturally curl. Curly bangs create a cheerful impression.

Side-Swept Bangs Hairstyle Model

This style cuts the front hair into bangs that are directed to one side of the face. This look gives an elegant and feminine impression. The side bangs add a graceful and sophisticated touch to the appearance.
