Top 6 Must-Watch Judi Dench Movies of All Time

Top 6 Must-Watch Judi Dench Movies of All Time

Judi Dench is a celebrated British actress known for her versatile talent and captivating performances on both stage and screen.

With a career spanning over six decades, Dench has won numerous awards, including an Academy Award, a Tony Award, and multiple BAFTA Awards. Her ability to embody a wide range of characters with depth and authenticity has solidified her as one of the greatest actresses of her generation.

Let's take a look at some of the best Judi Dench movies of all time.

1. Philomena (2013)

- IMDb: 7.6
- Rotten Tomatoes: 91%
- Available on: Max, Fandango at Home, Prime Video

Philomena

In this heartwrenching drama, Dench plays Philomena Lee, a woman searching for her long-lost son. Based on a true story, the film follows Philomena's journey as she teams up with journalist Martin Sixsmith to uncover the truth about her son's disappearance. Dench delivered a powerful performance that earned her critical acclaim and an Academy Award nomination.

2. Skyfall (2012)

- IMDb: 7.8
- Rotten Tomatoes: 92%
- Available on: Max, Fandango at Home, Prime Video

Skyfall

Dench reprises her role as M, the head of MI6, in this action-packed James Bond film. As Bond faces a new adversary threatening the agency, M finds herself in the crosshairs of danger. Dench brings gravitas and depth to her character, making M a formidable presence in the Bond franchise.

3. Shakespeare in Love (1998)

- IMDb: 7.1
- Rotten Tomatoes: 92%
- Available on: Max, Fandango at Home, Prime Video

Shakespeare in Love

In this romantic comedy, Dench portrays Queen Elizabeth I of England. As the ruler of England, she becomes entangled in the love affair between William Shakespeare and Viola de Lesseps. Dench's portrayal of the iconic queen is both regal and witty, showcasing her ability to command the screen with grace and charisma.

4. Notes On A Scandal (2006)

- IMDb: 7.4
- Rotten Tomatoes: 88%
- Available on: Max, Fandango at Home, Prime Video

Notes On A Scandal 

Dench stars as Barbara Covett, a lonely and manipulative teacher who becomes obsessed with a younger colleague. As her obsession spirals out of control, Barbara's actions have devastating consequences for both herself and those around her. Dench's chilling performance earned her an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress.

5. Mrs. Brown (1997)

- IMDb: 7.2
- Rotten Tomatoes: 88%
- Available on: Prime Video

Mrs. Brown 

In this historical drama, Dench portrays Queen Victoria during her grieving period after the death of her beloved husband, Prince Albert. When a Scottish servant named John Brown enters her life, he helps the queen find solace and companionship. Dench's nuanced performance captures Victoria's emotional turmoil and strength as she navigates her personal life and royal duties.

6. Iris (2001)

- IMDb: 7
- Rotten Tomatoes: 79%
- Available on: Fandango at Home, Prime Video

Iris 

Dench stars as acclaimed author Iris Murdoch in this biographical drama. The film chronicles Murdoch's life and battle with Alzheimer's disease, as seen through the eyes of her devoted husband, John Bayley. Dench captures the essence of Murdoch's brilliance and vulnerability with grace and sensitivity, delivering a poignant and moving performance.

6 Tips to Recover from Muscle Fatigue After a Workout

6 Tips to Recover from Muscle Fatigue After a Workout

Working out is great for your body, but sometimes it can leave your muscles feeling tired and sore. This is called muscle fatigue. It is important to take care of your muscles after a workout so they can recover well.

Here are six simple tips to help your muscles recover from fatigue and get you ready for your next workout.

These tips are easy to follow and can make a big difference.

1. Drink Enough Water

Drinking water is very important for muscle recovery. When you work out, you lose water through sweat. If you don’t drink enough water, your muscles can get tired and sore.

Try to drink water before, during, and after your workout. This helps to keep your muscles hydrated and can reduce muscle fatigue.

2. Get Enough Sleep

Sleep is essential for muscle recovery. When you sleep, your body repairs and builds muscle tissue. If you don’t get enough sleep, your muscles may not recover properly. Try to get 7-9 hours of sleep each night. Good sleep helps your muscles feel better and can make you stronger.

3. Take a Break

It’s important to give your muscles time to rest. If you work out every day, your muscles may not have enough time to recover. Try to take at least one or two days off from working out each week. This rest time helps your muscles recover and prevents injury.

4. Eat More Protein and Carbs

What you eat can help your muscles recover. Protein helps to repair muscle tissue, and carbs give you energy. Try to eat foods like chicken, fish, eggs, beans, rice, and pasta. Eating a balanced meal after your workout can help reduce muscle fatigue and make you feel better.

5. Stretch After Workout

Stretching after a workout can help your muscles recover. It helps to reduce muscle stiffness and improve flexibility. Try to stretch each muscle group for 15-30 seconds after your workout. This can help your muscles relax and recover faster.

6. Massage

Getting a massage can help reduce muscle fatigue. Massage increases blood flow to your muscles, which helps to remove waste products and bring in nutrients. You can get a professional massage or use a foam roller at home. This can help your muscles feel better and recover quicker.

30 Brother and Sister Quotes to Cherish Your Sibling Bond

30 Brother and Sister Quotes to Cherish Your Sibling Bond

The bond between brother and sister is usually higher than that of best friends. Sometimes, we have to tell them how much we care, but often, we are too embarrassed or afraid to say it. Using brother and sister quotes is the most effective way to express your care, humor, and concern for them.

Brother and sister quotes typically express the dynamics and significance of the relationship between siblings. They can be heartwarming or humorous words to highlight the memories, challenges, or unique bond between siblings. Reading sibling quotes can be a way to improve relationships with siblings and realize the value of sibling bonds.

We have collected 30 brother and sister quotes to cherish your sibling bonds. Check it out!

Best Brother and Sister Quotes

  • "I, who have no sisters or brothers, look with some degree of innocent envy on those who may be said to be born to friends." – James Boswell

  • "Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet." – Vietnamese Proverb

  • "Your parents leave you too soon and your kids and spouse come along late, but your siblings know you when you are in your most inchoate form." – Jeffrey Kluger

  • "Sisters and brothers just happen, we don't get to choose them, but they become one of our most cherish relationships." ― Wes Adamson

  • "What brothers say to tease their sisters has nothing to do with what they really think of them." – Esther M. Friesner

  • "Siblings that say they never fight are most definitely hiding something." — Lemony Snicket

  • "Siblings are the people we practice on, the people who teach us about fairness and cooperation and kindness and caring quite often the hard way." — Pamela Dugdale

  • "Having lots of siblings is like having built-in best friends." – Kim Kardashian

  • "You may be as different as the sun and the moon, but the same blood flows through both your hearts. You need her, as she needs you." – George R.R. Martin

  • "Brothers and sisters separated by distance joined by love." – Chuck Danes

Touching Brother and Sister Quotes 

  • "Brother and sister, together as friends, ready to face whatever life sends. Joy and laughter or tears and strife, holding hands tightly as we dance through life." – Suzie Huitt

  • "There is a destiny which makes us brothers; none goes his way alone. All that we send into the lives of others comes back into our own." – Edwin Markham

  • "Siblings: As we grew up, my brothers acted like they didn't care, but I always knew they looked out for me and were there!" – Catherine Pulsifer

  • "I have a wonderful shelter, which is my family. I have a wonderful relationship with my brother and sister; this makes me feel that I know always where I belong." – Jose Carreras

  • "Sisters annoy, interfere, criticize. Indulge in monumental sulks, in huffs, in snide remarks. Borrow. Break. Monopolize the bathroom. Are always underfoot. But if catastrophe should strike, sisters are there. Defending you against all comers." – Pam Brown

  • "Our brothers and sisters are there with us from the dawn of our personal stories to the inevitable dusk." – Susan Scarf Merrell

  • "If you have a brother or sister, tell them you love them every day – that's the most beautiful thing. I told my sister how much I loved her every day. That's the only reason I'm OK right now." – Amaury Nolasco

  • "After a girl is grown, her little brothers – now her protectors – seem like big brothers." – Terri Guillemets

  • "Growing up, I had a very normal relationship with my brother and sister. But, over time, they became my best friends, and now I hang out with them all the time. I'm very close to them." – Logan Lerman

  • "I think people that have a brother or sister don't realize how lucky they are. Sure, they fight a lot, but to know that there's always somebody there, somebody that's family." – Trey Parker

Funny Brother and Sister Quotes

  • "The highlight of my childhood was making my brother laugh so hard that food came out of his nose." – Garrison Keillor

  • "Having a sister is like having a built-in best friend who annoys you 24/7. I wouldn't trade it for the world." - Unknown

  • "Siblings: the only people who will fight like cats and dogs one minute and have your back the next." - Unknown

  • "A brother is a person you can always count on...to annoy you at the most inconvenient times." - Anonymous

  • "Siblings: the original frenemies since forever." - Anonymous

  • "Brother: a person who always has your back, usually when you're turned around." - Unknown

  • "Having a brother means always having someone to blame the broken lamp on." - Unknown

  • "I smile because you're my sister. I laugh because there's nothing you can do about it." - Unknown

  • "Siblings are like built-in comedians. They know exactly how to make you laugh and drive you crazy at the same time." - Unknown

  • "Brothers are just superheroes in disguise, annoying superheroes." - Anonymous

Author

Rizki Amelia Putri (Intern Writer)

5 Haunted Places In Iowa You Need To See For Eerie Encounters

If you're looking for a spooky adventure, these haunted places in Iowa will give you a chilling experience.  (Photo: pinterest)

5 Haunted Places In Iowa You Need To See For Eerie Encounters

Iowa is known for its cornfields and friendly people. This landlocked state also has a darker side—haunted places that will send shivers down your spine.

Iowa has some of the Midwest's most eerie and ghostly spots, from abandoned asylums to historic homes with tragic pasts. If you're brave enough to explore these haunted places. Let's check out five must-see spots in the state.






Haunted Places In Iowa

flickr/jetling/WindRanch

1. Edinburgh Manor

Edinburgh Manor in Monticello is a former mental institution that is said to be haunted by the spirits of former patients. Visitors have reported hearing strange noises and feeling an eerie presence while exploring the abandoned hallways.

2. The Villisca Axe Murder House

The Villisca Axe Murder House in Villisca is notorious for the gruesome murders that took place there in 1912. Eight people were brutally killed with an axe. Their spirits are still said to haunt the house.

Paranormal investigators have captured some chilling evidence of ghostly activity at this eerie location.

flickr/WindRanch

3. Farrar Schoolhouse

The Farrar Schoolhouse in Maxwell is a former one-room schoolhouse. This site is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a former teacher. Visitors have reported hearing phantom footsteps and seeing unexplained shadows moving through the building.

flickr/Dirk DBQ

4. Mathias Ham House

The Mathias Ham House in Dubuque is a historic mansion with a dark past. It is said to be haunted by the ghost of Mathias Ham himself and other former residents. Visitors have reported hearing whispers and feeling cold spots in various rooms throughout the house.

The Squirrel Cage Jail in Council Bluffs is a unique rotary jail. It is said to be haunted by the spirits of former inmates.

Photo: flickr/Martin Konopacki

5. Squirrel Cage Jail

The eerie, three-story structure with rotating cells has been featured on numerous paranormal TV shows for its ghostly activity. Visitors have reported hearing phantom footsteps. Some also feel a sense of unease while exploring this creepy jail.
Photo: flickr/Jimmy Emerson, DVM

If you're looking for a spooky adventure, these haunted places in Iowa will give you a chilling experience. 

Are you a skeptic or a believer in the supernatural? Exploring these eerie sites will leave you with goosebumps and a newfound fascination with the paranormal.

So, if you dare, pack your bags. Let's take a ghostly journey through some of Iowa's most haunted spots. You might encounter something mystical that will make your hair stand on end.

6 Portraits of Lee Da In, Lee Seung Gi's Wife Who is Expecting First Child

South Korean singer-actor Lee Seung-gi is going to become a father.

On November 1, South Korean media outlet JTBC News reported that his wife, South Korean actress Lee Da-in, was expecting their first child.

This news has been officially confirmed by the 36-year-old actor's agency, Human Made, which he founded in mid-2021.

Lee Da-in's agency, 9ato Entertainment, has also confirmed her pregnancy.

The agency revealed that Lee Da In will give birth in February 2024.

The agency also prioritized her health and securing a stable pregnancy.

Lee Da In is currently working on the television series "My Dearest."

Although filming for the historical romance K-drama is expected to continue through its final broadcast week, her role is almost complete.

Lee Seung Gi and Lee Da In revealed their relationship in May 2021 and married on April 7, 2023.

Their wedding was private at the Grand Intercontinental Seoul Parnas Hotel in Samseong, Gangnam, Seoul.

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: In this article, we’ll share lots of freaky questions you can ask your crush to spice things up and learn more about each other.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Freaky Questions to Ask Your Crush: Spice Up Your Conversations

Talking to your crush can be exciting but also a bit scary. You want to keep the conversation fun and interesting, but it’s not always easy to know what to say. That’s where freaky questions come in! These are fun, silly, or slightly naughty questions that can help you get to know your crush better and make your chats more exciting. In this article, we’ll share lots of freaky questions you can ask your crush to spice things up and learn more about each other.

Fun and Flirty Questions

Let’s start with some light and playful questions to break the ice:

• What’s the weirdest dream you’ve ever had?

• If you could have any superpower, what would it be and why?

• What’s your favorite cheesy pickup line?

• If you were a flavor of ice cream, which one would you be?

• What’s the most embarrassing thing that’s ever happened to you on a date?

• If you could trade lives with any celebrity for a day, who would it be?

• What’s the strangest food combination you actually enjoy?

• If you could instantly become an expert in something, what would it be?

• What’s your go-to dance move when no one’s watching?

• If you could have dinner with any historical figure, who would you choose?

These questions are great for getting the conversation flowing and showing your fun side. They can help you both relax and laugh together, which is important when you’re getting to know someone.

Deeper Getting-to-Know-You Questions

Once you’ve broken the ice, you might want to ask some questions that dig a little deeper:

• What’s your biggest fear in life?

• If you could change one thing about the world, what would it be?

• What’s the most valuable life lesson you’ve learned so far?

• What’s something you’ve always wanted to try but haven’t yet?

• Who has been the biggest influence in your life and why?

• What’s your idea of a perfect day?

• If you could relive one moment in your life, what would it be?

• What’s the craziest thing on your bucket list?

• What’s a secret talent or skill that most people don’t know you have?

• If you could send a message to your younger self, what would you say?

These questions can help you understand your crush’s values, dreams, and personality better. They show that you’re interested in who they really are, not just surface-level stuff.

Silly and Random Questions

Sometimes, the best way to keep things fun is to ask totally random questions:

• If you were a kitchen appliance, which one would you be and why?

• What’s the weirdest thing you’ve ever eaten?

• If you could have an unlimited supply of one thing for the rest of your life, what would it be?

• What’s the most useless talent you have?

• If you were a cartoon character, who would you be?

• What’s the strangest place you’ve ever fallen asleep?

• If you could invent a holiday, what would it celebrate?

• What’s the funniest WiFi name you’ve ever seen?

• If you were a sandwich, what kind would you be?

• What’s the weirdest thing you’ve ever used as a bookmark?

These quirky questions can lead to lots of laughs and show off your creative, playful side. They’re great for keeping the mood light and fun.

Would You Rather Questions

“Would you rather” questions are always fun and can reveal a lot about someone’s preferences:

• Would you rather be able to fly or breathe underwater?

• Would you rather always be 10 minutes late or 20 minutes early?

• Would you rather have the ability to talk to animals or speak all human languages?

• Would you rather have unlimited money or unlimited time?

• Would you rather be famous for your talents or infamous for a scandal?

• Would you rather live in a treehouse or an underground bunker?

• Would you rather never have to sleep again or never have to eat again?

• Would you rather always have to sing instead of speak or always have to dance while walking?

• Would you rather be able to read minds or see the future?

• Would you rather have a rewind button or a pause button for your life?

These questions can spark interesting debates and help you understand how your crush thinks and what they value.

Hypothetical Scenario Questions

Asking about imaginary situations can be really fun and revealing:

• If you woke up one day with the ability to time travel, what’s the first thing you’d do?

• If you could switch lives with anyone for a day, who would it be and why?

• If you suddenly became invisible, what would you do first?

• If you could have dinner with any three people, dead or alive, who would you choose?

• If you won the lottery tomorrow, what’s the first thing you’d buy?

• If you could instantly become an expert in one thing, what would it be?

• If you could live in any fictional world, which one would you choose?

• If you could have any animal as a pet, regardless of how dangerous it is, what would you pick?

• If you could change one thing about yourself, what would it be?

• If you could travel anywhere in the world right now, where would you go?

These questions let you both use your imagination and can lead to fun, creative conversations.

Slightly Spicy Questions

If you’re feeling brave and want to turn up the heat a little, try these slightly spicier questions:

• What’s your idea of a perfect first kiss?

• Have you ever had a crush on a teacher or someone you shouldn’t have?

• What’s the most daring thing you’ve ever done?

• If you could kiss anyone in the world right now, who would it be?

• What’s your biggest turn-on?

• Have you ever had a secret admirer or been one yourself?

• What’s the most romantic thing someone’s ever done for you?

• If you could go on a dream date, what would it be like?

• What’s your favorite physical feature about yourself?

• Have you ever had a crush on a friend’s partner?

Remember, only ask these if you’re both comfortable with this level of conversation. It’s important to respect boundaries and not make anyone feel uncomfortable.

Questions About Likes and Dislikes

Learning about your crush’s preferences can be really interesting:

• What’s your all-time favorite movie and why?

• If you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?

• What’s your biggest pet peeve?

• What’s your favorite way to relax after a long day?

• What kind of music do you love the most?

• What’s your idea of the perfect vacation?

• What’s a book that changed your life?

• What’s your favorite childhood memory?

• What’s something you’re terrible at but love to do anyway?

• What’s your favorite season and why?

These questions can help you find common interests and understand what makes your crush happy.

Future and Goals Questions

Asking about someone’s future plans and dreams can be really revealing:

• Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

• What’s your biggest goal in life right now?

• If you could have any job in the world, what would it be?

• What’s something you’ve always wanted to learn?

• If you could change one thing about the world, what would it be?

• What’s a place you’ve always wanted to visit?

• What’s the craziest thing you want to do before you die?

• If you could master any skill instantly, what would you choose?

• What kind of impact do you want to have on the world?

• If you could be remembered for one thing, what would you want it to be?

These questions show that you’re interested in your crush’s aspirations and can lead to meaningful conversations about what’s important to them.

Personality and Self-Reflection Questions

These questions can help you understand how your crush sees themselves:

• What three words would you use to describe yourself?

• What’s your biggest strength? Your biggest weakness?

• If you could change one thing about your personality, what would it be?

• What’s something you’re proud of about yourself?

• How do you think your friends would describe you?

• What’s a belief you had as a child that you no longer have?

• What’s the best compliment you’ve ever received?

• What’s something you’ve done that you never thought you’d be able to do?

• What’s your biggest regret in life so far?

• If you could give advice to your younger self, what would it be?

These questions can lead to deeper, more personal conversations and help you understand your crush’s self-image and values.

Pop Culture and Entertainment Questions

Talking about movies, TV shows, and other entertainment can be a fun way to connect:

• If your life was a movie, what genre would it be?

• What’s a TV show you can watch over and over without getting bored?

• If you could be any character from a book or movie, who would you choose?

• What’s the worst movie you’ve ever seen?

• If you could have dinner with any fictional character, who would it be?

• What’s your guilty pleasure when it comes to movies or TV shows?

• If you could live in any TV show universe, which one would you pick?

• What’s a song that always puts you in a good mood?

• If you could star in a remake of any movie, which one would you choose?

• What’s a book you think everyone should read at least once?

These questions can help you find shared interests and give you ideas for future date activities.

Childhood and Family Questions

Learning about someone’s past can help you understand them better:

• What’s your favorite childhood memory?

• Who in your family are you closest to?

• What’s the best piece of advice a family member has given you?

• What was your favorite toy or game as a kid?

• If you could relive one day from your childhood, which would it be?

• What’s a family tradition you’d like to pass on to your own kids someday?

• What’s the craziest thing you did as a teenager?

• Who was your childhood hero?

• What’s something your parents always say?

• If you could change one thing about your upbringing, what would it be?

These questions can help you understand your crush’s background and the experiences that shaped them.

Adventure and Travel Questions

If you’re both into travel and adventure, try these questions:

• If you could live anywhere in the world for a year, where would it be?

• What’s the most adventurous thing you’ve ever done?

• If you could go on a road trip with anyone, who would you choose?

• What’s the best trip you’ve ever been on?

• If you could instantly transport yourself anywhere in the world right now, where would you go?

• What’s a place you’ve always wanted to visit but haven’t yet?

• If you could only travel by one mode of transportation for the rest of your life, what would you choose?

• What’s the craziest thing you’ve ever eaten while traveling?

• If you could learn any language instantly, which would you choose?

• What’s your idea of the perfect vacation?

These questions can spark conversations about shared interests in travel and maybe even inspire future trip ideas together.

Philosophical and Thought-Provoking Questions

For deeper conversations, try these more philosophical questions:

• Do you believe in fate or do you think we make our own destiny?

• What do you think happens after we die?

• If you could know the absolute truth to one question, what would you ask?

• What do you think is the meaning of life?

• Do you think humans will ever make contact with aliens?

• If you could solve one world problem, what would it be?

• Do you think technology is making our lives better or worse?

• What do you think is the most important quality in a person?

• If you could be immortal, would you want to be?

• What do you think is the biggest challenge facing our generation?

These questions can lead to deep, meaningful conversations and help you understand your crush’s worldview.

Funny and Lighthearted Questions

Sometimes, it’s good to keep things light and silly:

• If you were a vegetable, which one would you be and why?

• What’s the worst fashion trend you’ve ever participated in?

• If you had to wear one outfit for the rest of your life, what would it be?

• What’s the funniest joke you know?

• If you could have any animal’s ability, what would you choose?

• What’s the weirdest thing you’ve ever done for a dare?

• If you were a character in a cartoon, what would your catchphrase be?

• What’s the strangest dream you’ve ever had?

• If you could rename yourself, what name would you choose?

• What’s the silliest fear you have?

These questions can lead to lots of laughter and show off your fun, playful side.

Questions About Relationships and Love

If you want to steer the conversation towards romance, try these questions:

• What’s your idea of a perfect date?

• Do you believe in love at first sight?

• What’s the most romantic movie you’ve ever seen?

• What’s your love language?

• What’s the sweetest thing someone’s ever done for you?

• What do you think is the key to a successful relationship?

• Have you ever been in love?

• What’s your biggest deal-breaker in a relationship?

• Do you believe soulmates exist?

• What’s the most important quality you look for in a partner?

These questions can help you understand your crush’s views on love and relationships, and might even give you ideas for future dates!

Conclusion

Asking freaky questions can be a fun way to get to know your crush better and keep your conversations exciting. Remember, the key is to keep things light, fun, and respectful. Pay attention to how your crush responds and be ready to change the subject if they seem uncomfortable. Use these questions as a starting point, but don’t be afraid to come up with your own based on your shared interests and experiences. Most importantly, be yourself and have fun! Getting to know someone should be an enjoyable experience for both of you.

NASA Sent 'Message in a Bottle' to Jupiter's Moon to Communicate with Aliens?

NASA Sent 'Message in a Bottle' to Jupiter's Moon to Communicate with Aliens?

NASA's Europe Clipper spacecraft will carry a commemorative metal plaque when it launches in October to explore Jupiter's oceanic moon.

When NASA's Europa Clipper launches its highly anticipated mission to an icy moon in October, the spacecraft will carry a unique design engraved with names, poems, and artwork symbolizing humanity.

The US space agency has a long history of sending meaningful names and designs on missions, including the Voyager spacecraft, Perseverance Explorer, and Parker Solar Probe. Now it's Europa Clipper's turn to continue the tradition of delivering designs that show why humans are driven to explore the universe.

This latest mission heads to Jupiter's moon Europa, one of several oceanic worlds on the moon that are considered the best places to search for extraterrestrial life. Scientists estimate that oceanic worlds contain twice as much water as Earth's oceans, found under Europe's thick icy crust. Earth's oceans contain about 321 million cubic miles (1.3 billion cubic kilometers) of water, according to a National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration report.

Triangular panels, decorated on both sides and made of the rare metal tantalum, will seal the spacecraft's sensitive electronic devices inside the vault to protect them from Jupiter's harsh radiation.

On the inside of the vault is a tiny silicon chip printed on which 2.6 million names were submitted by the public. The microchip is at the center of the design, which shows a bottle floating in orbit around Jupiter and its moons to symbolize the cosmic message inside the bottle.

Technicians at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, used an electron beam to draw a name smaller than one-thousandth the width of a human hair.

At the bottom of the bottle, the design features the original poem In Praise of Obscurity: An Ode to Europe, Written by American poet Ada Limon and engraved in her own handwriting, along with a portrait of the late planetary science pioneer Ron Greeley, a professor at Arizona State University who played an important role in laying the groundwork for the development of missions to Europe.

The side of the plaque facing the inside of the dome also bears the inscription of the Drake equation, developed by the late astronomer Frank Drake of the University of California Santa Cruz in 1961 to estimate the probability of finding advanced life beyond Earth. The equation remains important in astrobiology research as scientists search for evidence of life beyond our planet.

The outside of the painting is a waveform, or visual representation of sound waves, depicting the word "water" in 103 languages worldwide. The core of the spiral is a symbol that means "water" in American Sign Language. Audio of the spoken language collected by linguists for NASA is available on its website.

The other side of the metal plate is covered with waveforms depicting the word "water" in different languages.

NASA's early investigations, e.g., Voyager 10, continue to inspire artwork carried on other planetary science missions.

When NASA's twin Voyager probes were launched to explore the solar system just weeks apart in 1977, they carried an identical golden record designed as the first recorded interstellar message from humanity to potential intelligent life in the universe.

The record contains audio and video files intended to capture the diversity of life and culture on Earth, including greetings in 59 human languages and 115 photographs of life.

According to NASA, the Europa Clipper painting was designed in this spirit to honor the potential connection between the Moon and the oceans on Earth.

"The content and design of Europa Clipper's dome panels are full of meaning," Lori Glaze, director of NASA's Planetary Science Division, said in a statement.

"It brings together the best that humanity has to offer in the universe - science, technology, education, art and math. The message of connectedness through water, which is essential to all life as we know it, perfectly illustrates Earth's connection to this mysterious ocean, a world we are eager to explore."

After traveling 1.6 billion miles (2.6 billion km) to Europa, Europa Clipper will fly over the ice-covered moon in the next few years to see if the ocean beneath could support life.

Europa Clipper is scheduled to make nearly 50 flybys of Europa, reaching 16 miles (25.7 kilometers) above the thick ice sheet to survey almost the entire moon.

The spacecraft will use cameras, spectrometers, ice-penetrating radar, and thermal instruments to understand how the Moon formed and whether life might exist in the icy ocean.

"We put as much thought and inspiration into the design of these panels as we did into the mission itself," Robert Pappalardo, JPL's project scientist, said in a statement.

"This has been a decades-long journey, and we can't wait to see what Europa Clipper will show us in this aquatic world."

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: The Most Viewed TikTok Is Now Reaching 3.6B Views! What Is That?
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: The video's minimalistic nature has sparked widespread curiosity and debate among users and analysts alike.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
The Most Viewed TikTok Is Now Reaching 3.6B Views! What Is That?

When it comes to the list of most-watched videos on TikTok, there is quite a variety of content involved.

Leah Halton's reverse lip sync is the fourth most-watched video with 1.1 billion views, and Zach King's Harry Potter-inspired Magic Ride tops the list with 2.3 billion views on TikTok.

​In a surprising twist on viral content, a 10-second TikTok video featuring nothing but a black screen has amassed an astounding 3.6 billion views, making it the platform's most-viewed video to date. ​

The video's minimalistic nature has sparked widespread curiosity and debate among users and analysts alike.

The most viewed video on TikTok is currently at 3.6B views

It’s a 10-second video of a black screen pic.twitter.com/FMRXUvLarj

— Dexerto (@Dexerto) April 4, 2025

As reported by Dexerto, TikTok user Lasi's video was uploaded on June 7, 2023, and has continued to gain many views since then without showing anything.

Instead, all it shows is a black screen for a few seconds which, by default, automatically restarts from the beginning once it's finished.

Since it doesn't show anything, viewers unknowingly watch the video multiple times, causing the view count to skyrocket.

At the time of writing, the video has been viewed more than 3.6 billion times. However, it is far from being the most liked video, with only 1.1 million likes at the time of writing.

The video has gone viral on the app several times over the years, with the most recent being April 2025.

What makes the 'blank screen' get so many views?

Some speculate that the video's success may be attributed to factors such as algorithmic anomalies, mass sharing as part of a viral challenge, or users' intrigue leading to repeated views.

It could be that Lasi is using their account to test their own viewbotting program, so it's unclear whether it looks legitimate or not.

Despite various theories, the reason behind the video's unprecedented popularity remains unclear.​

5 Most Haunted Places in Sheffield, UK : Uncovering the City's Ghostly Secrets

Each place tells its own story, inviting visitors to uncover the ghostly secrets that linger in the shadows of Sheffield. (Photo by Zenith on Pexels)

5 Most Haunted Places in Sheffield, UK: Uncovering the City's Ghostly Secrets

Sheffield, a vibrant city in South Yorkshire, is known for its rich industrial history and stunning landscapes.

However, beneath this modern façade lies a collection of ghostly tales and haunted locations that have captured the imagination of locals and visitors alike. These places are steeped in mystery and intrigue, from eerie hospitals to ancient inns. Here are five of Sheffield's most haunted locations, unveiling the city's ghostly secrets.

1. The Old Queens Head

This historic pub, dating back to the 16th century, is famous for its ghostly sightings. Patrons have reported seeing a woman in white wandering through the rooms, accompanied by strange sounds and flickering lights.

The Old Queens Head is not just a place to enjoy a drink;

it's also a spot where the past seems to linger, making it one of Sheffield's most haunted locations.

Most Haunted Places in Sheffield, UK

2. Vickers Corridor, Northern General Hospital

The Vickers Corridor in the Northern General Hospital has earned its reputation as one of the most haunted places in Sheffield.

Staff and visitors have claimed to hear unexplained footsteps and see shadowy figures moving through the corridor. Some even report feeling cold spots, as if a ghostly presence is nearby. The hospital's history adds to its eerie atmosphere, making it a place where the line between life and the afterlife feels blurred.

3. The Old John Watts Building
Another intriguing spot is The Old John Watts, an old pub with a rich history dating back to the 18th century. This establishment is known for its ghostly apparitions and mysterious happenings.

Visitors have shared stories of seeing an apparition of a former landlord, who is said to roam the building. Many also report unusual noises, such as clinking glasses and footsteps from empty rooms, contributing to its haunted reputation.

4. Stocksbridge Bypass

The Stocksbridge Bypass is a road and a site of chilling ghost stories. It is said to be haunted by the spirit of a woman who tragically lost her life in an accident on the bypass.

Drivers often report seeing her figure walking along the road, and some have experienced their cars inexplicably stalling as they pass through this eerie stretch.

The bypass has become well-known among locals for these frightening encounters, making it one of Sheffield's most talked-about haunted locations.

Most Haunted Places in Sheffield, UK

5. Mosborough Hall

Lastly, Mosborough Hall is a beautiful hotel with a dark past. This 12th-century building has been the site of many ghostly encounters. Guests and staff have reported hearing whispers, seeing apparitions, and feeling sudden drops in temperature.

The hall is said to be haunted by several spirits, including a woman in white and a soldier from its historical past. The combination of its age and history adds to the unsettling atmosphere, making Mosborough Hall a must-visit for those intrigued by the supernatural.

In conclusion, Sheffield has numerous haunted places that reflect its rich history and ghostly legends.

From pubs filled with spectral patrons to roads haunted by tragic tales, these locations offer a glimpse into the city's mysterious past. Whether you believe in the supernatural or are simply curious about local lore, exploring these haunted sites can provide an exciting adventure. Each place tells its own story, inviting visitors to uncover the ghostly secrets that linger in the shadows of Sheffield.

Australian Traveler Surprised Changi Airport Can Find Lost Items in Less than 30 Minutes

Australian Traveler Surprised Changi Airport Can Find Lost Items in Less than 30 Minutes

An Australian traveler and TikTok user reported a lost item at Singapore's Changi Airport. She said she couldn't believe it when she received an email stating that the item had been found less than 30 minutes later.

The TikTok user known as Nim expressed her amazement and gratitude to the airport in a video uploaded to her TikTok account @niminthewild on Sunday, May 26, 2024.

In the 52-second video, Nim said this was her 'story in Singapore' that happened to her partner the night before.

The TikToker, who moved to Singapore in 2022, shared that her partner was exiting Changi Airport to buy souvenirs at a duty-free shop. "In her hurry, she ended up leaving her bag on a bollard in the arrivals pick-up area and my partner thought it was long gone," said the Australian lawyer.

"But I had looked it up on the internet and realized you could mark an item as lost, so I did so without expecting it to be found."

She then followed the instructions on the 'Lost & Found' page on Changi Airport's website. Anyone can inquire about items lost on a plane or at the airport on the site. The lost item was found quickly by the airport.

"Within 30 minutes, we got an email back from Changi, saying that they found the item and were waiting for us to pick it up," the TikToker said.

Nim expected nothing when reporting the lost item. She didn't believe it would be found so quickly.

"We thought it was long gone. And I know in this case, it wasn't sentimental at all. Just the fact that they found it, and obviously no one else took it, or maybe someone gave it away."

"Crazy. So grateful. Thank you Changi Airport. You're the best!" she continued.

Her video even received a response from Changi Airport's official TikTok account, which left the comment, "Yay, glad to help."

Her story also prompted netizens to share their experiences in the comments section. One netizen wrote, "I was sick and withdrew US$500 from the ATM and left. The person behind chased me with the cash I forgot to bring."

@niminthewild only good karma 🫰🏼🫰🏼 @Changi Airport #sg #singapore #singaporetiktok #singaporetrending #singaporelife #singaporean #sgtt #sgnews #sgfyp #sgtravel #singaporetravel #changiairport #singaporeimagine #changi ♬ now its been years since i left new york - oceanblvd7777777

Another said, "I dropped my wallet on Orchard Road and the person who found it called the business card inside to track me down."

One netizen also opined, "Honesty is a strange concept in some countries."

In order to prevent lost luggage, Changi Airport launched the iChangi application in 2022. The app tracks the baggage of passengers who land, take off, or transit.

Top 5 Best Ben Affleck Movies You Should Watch

Top 5 Best Ben Affleck Movies You Should Watch

Benjamin Géza Affleck, or Ben Affleck, is a famous American movie superstar. Born in 1972, he has had a long and successful career in the film industry, starring in a variety of critically acclaimed movies. From action-packed thrillers to heartwarming dramas, Affleck has showcased his versatility as an actor.

If you're a fan of his work or looking to discover some of his best films, here are the top Ben Affleck movies that you need to add to your watchlist.

1. Good Will Hunting (1997)

Will Hunting is a genius mathematician who was recently paroled from jail. He worked as a janitor at MIT, where a professor discovered his hidden talent.

Ben Affleck appeared as Chuckie, one of Will's best friends. He also wrote the story alongside Matt Damon, which won the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay.

2. Argo (2012)

"Argo" is based on the true story of Tony Mendez. He was a CIA agent who had to rescue a team of six Americans who were trapped in Tehran during the hostage crisis in 1979.

This movie is produced and directed by Ben Affleck, who also plays the leading role of Tony Mendez. This movie won three Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay, and Best Film Editing.

3. Shakespeare in Love (1998)

A fictional film about the legendary British playwright William Shakespeare. Shakespeare is struggling with writer's block when he meets and falls in love with a noblewoman. This forbidden affair inspired him to write his most famous work, Romeo and Juliet.

Ben Affleck has a small but memorable role in the film as Ned Alleyn, a famous actor who plays Romeo and Juliet. This movie won several Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Actress.

4. Gone Girl (2014)

Nick Dunne reports his missing wife to the media and gains widespread sympathy from the public. However, his image soon starts to crumble as clues begin to point to him as the prime suspect in his wife's missing.

Ben Affleck takes the central role as Nick. He successfully portrays the character's complex emotions and inner turmoil. His portrayal keeps the audience guessing about Nick's innocence or guilt, adding to the suspense of the movie.

5. Dazed and Confused (1993)

It's the last day of school in 1976 Texas high school, and a group of students choose to go on an adventure to celebrate it.

Ben Affleck plays the role of Fred O'Bannion, the main antagonist of the movie. He's a bully who loves to torment the freshman. His powerful acting makes him one of the most memorable characters in the movie.

How to Check Credit Score in the US and How to Improve It

Are you aware of how to check credit score? Your credit score is a crucial number that influences various aspects of your financial well-being. It determines whether you qualify for loans, credit cards, or even rental agreements. Keeping track of your credit score helps you make informed financial decisions and avoid potential setbacks.

Many people do not realize they can access their credit scores for free and that different sources may provide slightly different scores. If you fail to check your credit score regularly, you may overlook errors that could negatively impact your financial standing. Monitoring your credit score helps you stay in control of your financial health and address any issues quickly.

In this article, we will cover what a credit score is, why it matters, how it is calculated, and several ways how to check credit score. Additionally, you will find practical steps to improve your credit score over time. We gathered the information from various sources, Friday (7/3/2025).

What is a Credit Score?

A credit score is a number that shows how reliable you are at paying back borrowed money. It helps lenders check out how likely you are to repay borrowed money. Your credit score is derived from information found in your credit reports, which are compiled by three major credit bureaus: Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion.

Credit scores typically range between 300 and 850. A higher score indicates responsible credit management, making it easier to qualify for loans with favorable terms. On the other hand, a lower score may limit your borrowing options and result in higher interest rates.

Several factors contribute to your credit score, including your payment history, total outstanding debt, and length of credit history. Knowing how to check credit score helps you to regularly review it to provide valuable insights into your financial standing.

Why is Credit Score Important?

Your credit score plays a significant role in your financial opportunities. A strong credit score makes it easier to secure loans, obtain credit cards, and even rent a home. It also affects your ability to get lower interest rates, which can save you money over time.

Lenders use credit scores to evaluate financial risk. A high credit score suggests that you are a responsible borrower, which can result in better loan offers. In contrast, a low credit score may lead to loan denials or higher interest rates.

Additionally, some landlords, insurance providers, and even employers may check your credit score when making decisions. Maintaining a good credit score opens doors to better financial opportunities and ensures greater stability in the long run.

How Credit Score is Calculated

Credit scores are calculated based on data collected from your credit report. The three credit bureaus gather and update this information regularly. Your credit score is determined by the following factors:

1. Payment History: Making on-time payments is the most critical factor in maintaining a good credit score.

2. Credit Utilization: The amount of credit you use compared to your credit limit plays a key role in your score.

3. Length of Credit History: Having long-standing credit accounts can positively impact your score.

4. New Credit Inquiries: Applying for multiple new credit accounts in a short time can lower your score.

5. Credit Mix: A diverse credit portfolio, including credit cards, auto loans, and mortgages, can be beneficial.

Understanding how these factors influence your score allows you to make informed decisions about your financial habits.

How to Check Credit Score

There are several reliable ways to check your credit score. Here are some of the most common methods:

1. Review Your Credit or Loan Statements: Many banks, credit card issuers, and financial institutions provide free credit scores to their customers through monthly statements or online accounts.

2. Consult a Credit or Housing Counselor: Nonprofit organizations and government-approved credit counselors can offer free credit reports and guidance on managing your score.

3. Use a Credit Score Service: Some websites and financial apps provide free credit score access. However, some services may require a subscription for additional features.

4. Purchase Your Score from a Credit Bureau: You can buy your credit score directly from Equifax, Experian, or TransUnion.

Checking your credit score regularly ensures accuracy and helps you identify any potential issues before they become major problems.

How to Improve Credit Score

Improving your credit score requires consistent financial habits. Here are a few essential tips to enhance your credit rating:

1. Make Timely Payments: Paying bills on time is crucial for maintaining a good score. Set up automatic payments or reminders to avoid late fees and prevent damage to your credit history.

2. Reduce Your Credit Card Balances: Keeping balances low on credit cards helps improve your score. Try to use less than 30% of your available credit limit to show responsible usage.

3. Monitor Your Credit Report for Errors: Errors in your credit report can hurt your score. Check your report regularly and dispute any mistakes with the credit bureau to ensure accuracy.

4. Limit New Credit Applications: Applying for too many new accounts at once can lower your score. Only apply for credit when necessary to prevent multiple hard inquiries on your report.

5. Keep Older Accounts Open: The length of your credit history matters. Keeping older accounts open and in good standing can positively impact your credit score over time.

By following these steps, you can build a solid credit history and increase your creditworthiness over time.

After Thought

Knowing how to check credit score is essential for financial stability. Regularly reviewing your score helps track progress, fix errors, and improve your rating. A strong score leads to better loans, lower interest rates, and greater financial opportunities. Monitoring your credit score can help you stay on top of your finances and avoid potential issues. Take control of your credit today and secure a better financial future.

WHOOP 5.0: A Comprehensive Review of the Latest Fitness Tracker

WHOOP has launched its latest fitness tracker, the WHOOP 5.0, promising a significant leap forward in health and fitness monitoring.

This isn't just an incremental update; it's a substantial overhaul, addressing many of the shortcomings of its predecessor while introducing exciting new features.

“This isn’t just a product launch. It’s a new chapter for WHOOP and for our members,” said Will Ahmed, WHOOP Founder & CEO.

“We’ve taken everything we’ve learned over the past decade and built a platform to help our members perform and live at their peak for longer. We’ve held nothing back.”

Smaller and Smarter

The most immediate improvement is the size.

The WHOOP 5.0 is 7% smaller than the WHOOP 4.0, making it significantly more comfortable to wear 24/7.

This smaller form factor doesn't compromise functionality; in fact, it enhances it.

The device boasts a more powerful processor, resulting in a smoother and more responsive user experience within the accompanying app.

Enhanced Battery Life and Charging Options

One of the standout features is the dramatically improved battery life.

WHOOP claims up to 14 days or more on a single charge, a considerable improvement over previous models and one of the best battery lives in the wearable market.

Users also have the option of a standard charger or the convenient Wireless PowerPack for charging directly on the wrist.

Advanced Sensor Technology

The WHOOP 5.0 utilizes more sophisticated sensors that collect data 25 times per second with 10 times better power efficiency.

This translates to significantly more accurate readings for heart rate, sleep quality, and other vital metrics.

This enhanced accuracy allows for more precise insights into your overall health and fitness levels.

Comprehensive Health Monitoring

Beyond the basic fitness tracking, the WHOOP 5.0 provides a more holistic view of your health.

It offers more accurate stress monitoring, more precise sleep stage tracking, and improved recovery metrics.

The premium WHOOP MG version even includes a Heart Screener feature designed to detect atrial fibrillation (AFib), a potentially serious heart condition.

Customization and Integration

The WHOOP 5.0 offers a high degree of customization.

Users can choose from a variety of straps to personalize their look, and the device can even be integrated with WHOOP Body Smart Apparel, allowing for wear beyond the wrist.

The seamless integration with the WHOOP app provides personalized training guidance and goal tracking based on your continuously evolving health data.

Price Point

Now, Whoop is dividing subscription tiers based on price and feature set.

The entry-level Whoop One tier costs $199 annually, includes Whoop 5.0 hardware, a wired charging pack, and the basic fitness tracking metrics plus AI coaching.

The mid-tier Whoop Peak subscription costs $239 annually (same as the current 12-month subscription). It includes everything on Whoop One, plus the new Healthspan metric, stress tracking, a wireless charger, and the Health Monitor dashboard for viewing your metrics.

The premium Whoop Life subscription costs $359 a year, adds in EKGs and blood pressure insights, and comes with the Whoop MG hardware.

ANNOUNCING THE ALL-NEW WHOOP

I’m proud to introduce the most ambitious leap forward in our technology ever. Two new hardware devices: WHOOP 5.0 & MG. 14 Day Battery Life. Healthspan. Heart Screener with FDA clearance. Blood Pressure Insights. New bands and apparel. And more 👇🏼 pic.twitter.com/OyfIcDbUM2

— Will Ahmed (@willahmed) May 8, 2025

30 Girl Boss Quotes: Inspiration and Motivation for Ambitious Women

These quotes are here to help you ignite motivation, foster resilience, and remind ambitious women everywhere that they have the power to achieve greatness. (Photo by Junior REIS on Unsplash).

30 Girl Boss Quotes: Inspiration and Motivation for Ambitious Women

Do you feel unfamiliar with the word "girl boss"? You can learn more about it by reading this article.

"Girl boss" is an increasingly popular term to describe a woman who is independent, confident, and ambitious in her career. It celebrates women's empowerment and leadership. It also emphasizes resilience, determination, and an entrepreneurial spirit.

To help you better understand the girl boss, we have compiled 30 girl boss quotes below.

In today's world, being a "girl boss" isn't just about leadership. It's about empowerment, determination, and breaking barriers. Whether you're an entrepreneur, a corporate professional, or pursuing your dreams in any field, embracing your ambitions is vital.

This article brings together a collection of inspiring girl boss quotes. These quotes will help you ignite motivation, boost resilience, and remind ambitious women everywhere that they have the power to reach greatness.

Let’s read these empowering phrases below. Without further ado, let’s begin!

A. Famous Girl Boss Quotes

1. "If you’re offered a seat on a rocket ship, don’t ask what seat! Just get on." – Sheryl Sandberg

2. "It took me quite a long time to develop a voice, and now that I have it, I am not going to be silent." – Madeleine Albright

3. "The most effective way to do it, is to do it." – Amelia Earhart

4. "I am not afraid of storms for I am learning how to sail my ship." – Louisa May Alcott

5. "The question isn’t who’s going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me." – Ayn Rand

6. "Success isn’t about how much money you make; it’s about the difference you make in people’s lives." – Michelle Obama

7. "You can’t be that kid standing at the top of the waterslide, overthinking it. You have to go down the chute." – Tina Fey

8. "I never dreamed about success. I worked for it." – Estée Lauder

9. "The only way to do great work is to love what you do." – Steve Jobs

10. "Don’t be afraid to speak up for yourself. Keep fighting for your dreams!" – Gabby Douglas

B. Cool Girl Boss Quotes

1. "She remembered who she was and the game changed." – Lalah Delia

2. "The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." – Eleanor Roosevelt

3. "I’m tough, ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay." – Madonna

4. "Well-behaved women seldom make history." – Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

5. “When you learn how much you’re worth, you’ll stop giving people discounts.” — Karen Salmansohn

6. “She was a wild one; always stomping on eggshells that everyone else tip-toed on.” — Kaitlin Foster

7. "Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another stepping stone to greatness." — Oprah Winfrey

8. "Slay your own dragons, princess." – Unknown

9. "If you’re too comfortable, it’s time to move on. Terrified of what’s next? You’re on the right track.” — Susan Fales Hill

10. "I’m not bossy, I’m the boss." – Beyoncé

C. Empowering Girl Boss Quotes

1. "Women are the largest untapped reservoir of talent in the world." — Hillary Clinton

2. "Stop telling yourself you don't know what to do. Yes, you do. Listen to your intuition and trust yourself." — Katherine Sullivan

3. “Sometimes you gotta be a beauty and a beast.” — Nicki Minaj

4. "I am not a difficult woman at all. I am simply a strong woman and know my worth." – Angelina Jolie

5. "Know that there is no finish line; fortune favors action. Race balls-out toward the extraordinary life that you've always dreamed of, or still haven't had time to dream up. And prepare to have a hell of a lot of fun along the way." — Sophia Amoruso

6. “You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.” — A.A. Milne

7. "A strong woman understands that the gifts such as logic, decisiveness, and strength are just as feminine as intuition and emotional connection. She values and uses all of her gifts." – Nancy Rathburn

8. "I am a woman with thoughts and questions and shit to say. I say if I’m beautiful. I say if I’m strong. You will not determine my story – I will." – Amy Schumer

9. "A woman's best protection is money of her own." — Clare Boothe Luce

10. "Be a girl with a mind, a woman with attitude, and a lady with class." – Unknown

Zhanna D'Art, Vegan Raw Food Diet Influencer, Dies of Starving

Local media stated that she asked for medical treatment during her Southeast Asia tour and died on 21 July.

Zhanna D'Art, Vegan Raw Food Diet Influencer, Dies of Starving

Vegan influencer Zhanna Samsonova, known as Zhanna D'Art, passed away at 39.

The cause of death is supposed to be starvation. Her friends and family reported that she was starving due to an exclusive diet of exotic fruit in Malaysia.

Zhanna D'Art is an influencer on the social media platforms TikTok, Facebook, and Instagram.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Raw food Creation by Zhanna D’art (@rawveganfoodchef)

Local media stated that she asked for medical treatment during her Southeast Asia tour and died on 21 July.

Several months earlier, she was already showing signs of exhaustion while in Sri Lanka. Her feet were swollen with lymph.

Her friends asked her to seek medical help. But she still continued her strict diet.

Samsonova has been on a raw vegan diet for the last four years, especially fruit, sunflower seed sprouts, fruit smoothies, and juices.

A friend mentioned that Samsonova's diet consisted of giant jackfruit and durians for the last seven years.

Her journey with raw food is motivated by her want to keep her youth.

She wanted to improve her health after watching her friends look older because of their "junk food" diet.

A raw food diet may offer health benefits, such as weight loss, improved heart health, and reduced risk of diabetes.

But it can also lead to a lack of essential nutrients. Like calcium, Vitamin D, and Vitamin B12,

as mentioned by Healthline.

A recent study published in the Journal of Nutrition found that 100% of participants on a raw vegan diet had bad input of Vitamin B12.

Despite her diet, some of Samsonova's followers refuse to believe it. They said that the chemicals in the fruit she ate were caused by her death.

Zhanna D'Art's family is awaiting medical reports to determine the official cause of death. The family is also waiting for a death certificate.

Unfortunately, Zhanna D'Art is not the first person to be a victim of the effects of a raw food diet.

The Breakfast Question: Understanding the Importance of Your Morning Meal

Breakfast is often called the most important meal of the day. But why is it so important? And what happens if we skip it? Let’s explore the world of breakfast and answer some common questions about this morning meal.

What is Breakfast?

Breakfast is the first meal of the day. The word “breakfast” comes from two words: “break” and “fast”. When we sleep at night, we don’t eat for many hours. This is called fasting. When we wake up and eat, we “break” this “fast”. That’s why the meal is called breakfast!

People eat breakfast at different times. Some eat as soon as they wake up. Others wait a few hours. In many countries, breakfast is eaten between 6:00 AM and 10:00 AM.

Why is Breakfast Important?

Eating breakfast has many benefits:

• It gives you energy to start your day

• It helps you focus and think better

• It can improve your mood

• It may help control your weight

• It provides important nutrients your body needs

When you sleep, your body uses up energy. Breakfast helps refill this energy. It’s like putting fuel in a car before a long trip.

What Happens If You Skip Breakfast?

Some people choose not to eat breakfast. This is called “skipping breakfast”. What happens if you do this?

• You might feel tired or weak

• It may be harder to focus on work or school

• You might eat more later in the day

• You could miss out on important nutrients

However, not everyone feels bad when they skip breakfast. Some people feel fine without it. It depends on your body and habits.

There’s a famous question about breakfast. It goes like this: “How would you feel if you hadn’t eaten breakfast this morning?”

This question became popular on the internet. It’s used to test how people think about imaginary situations. The correct way to answer is to imagine not eating breakfast, even if you did eat it.

For example, good answers might be:

• “I would feel hungry.”

• “I might have less energy.”

• “I would look forward to lunch.”

These answers show you can think about a situation that didn’t really happen.

Common Breakfast Foods Around the World

Breakfast foods are different in every country. Here are some examples:

• United States: Eggs, bacon, pancakes, cereal

• England: Beans, sausages, eggs, toast

• Japan: Rice, fish, miso soup

• India: Dosa, idli, paratha

• Mexico: Huevos rancheros, chilaquiles

Some foods are eaten for breakfast in many countries. These include eggs, bread, fruit, and coffee or tea.

Healthy Breakfast Choices

A good breakfast should give you energy and important nutrients. Here are some healthy breakfast ideas:

• Oatmeal with fruit and nuts

• Whole grain toast with avocado

• Yogurt with berries and granola

• Eggs with vegetables

• Smoothie made with fruits and vegetables

Try to include protein, whole grains, and fruits or vegetables in your breakfast. This will help you feel full and energized.

Breakfast and Weight Control

Some people think skipping breakfast helps them lose weight. But research shows this might not be true. People who eat breakfast often:

• Eat less during the day

• Make healthier food choices

• Have an easier time controlling their weight

However, what you eat for breakfast matters. A healthy breakfast is better than a breakfast full of sugar and unhealthy fats.

Breakfast for Children

Breakfast is especially important for children. Kids who eat breakfast often:

• Do better in school

• Have better concentration

• Are less likely to be overweight

• Get more of the nutrients they need

Many schools offer breakfast programs to make sure children start the day with a good meal.

Quick and Easy Breakfast Ideas

Many people say they don’t have time for breakfast. Here are some quick ideas:

• Banana and peanut butter on toast

• Hardboiled eggs (make them the night before)

• Overnight oats

• Greek yogurt with fruit

• Whole grain cereal with milk

You can also prepare some breakfast items the night before to save time in the morning.

Breakfast and Exercise

If you exercise in the morning, should you eat breakfast first? It depends:

• For light exercise, you might be fine without eating first

• For harder workouts, eating something light can help

• After exercise, it’s good to eat to help your body recover

Everyone is different, so try different times to eat and see what feels best for you.

Breakfast Around the World

Let’s look at some interesting breakfast traditions from different countries:

• In China, congee (a type of rice porridge) is common

• In Brazil, people often eat bread, ham, cheese, and coffee

• In Australia, Vegemite on toast is popular

• In Morocco, people might eat bread with olive oil and herbs

• In Germany, a breakfast might include various breads, meats, and cheeses

These different breakfasts show how food traditions vary around the world.

The History of Breakfast

Breakfast hasn’t always been seen as important. In the past:

• Ancient Romans rarely ate breakfast

• In the Middle Ages, breakfast was often seen as unhealthy

• The idea of breakfast as the “most important meal” started in the 1900s

Today, most nutrition experts agree that breakfast is beneficial for most people.

Breakfast and Mental Health

Eating breakfast might be good for your mental health. Some studies show:

• People who eat breakfast often have less stress

• Breakfast can improve mood

• Eating in the morning might help with depression symptoms

The connection between food and mood is complex, but starting your day with a good meal seems to help many people feel better.

Common Breakfast Mistakes

Even if you eat breakfast, you might make some common mistakes:

• Eating too much sugar

• Not including protein

• Drinking too much caffeine

• Eating too little

• Eating too much

A balanced breakfast with a mix of nutrients is usually best.

Breakfast for Different Diets

People with different diets need to think about their breakfast choices:

• Vegetarians might eat eggs, dairy, or plant-based proteins

• Vegans could choose foods like tofu scramble or plant-based milk with cereal

• People on low-carb diets might focus on eggs, meats, and vegetables

• Gluten-free eaters need to avoid wheat and some other grains

There are many ways to have a healthy breakfast that fits your diet.

Breakfast and Culture

Breakfast is more than just food. It can be an important part of culture:

• In some places, breakfast is a time for family to gather

• Some cultures have special breakfast foods for holidays

• In some countries, breakfast is a big meal. In others, it’s very small

• Breakfast foods can be a way to connect with your heritage

Understanding breakfast in different cultures can teach us a lot about those cultures.

The Science of Breakfast

Scientists have studied breakfast a lot. Here’s what some research shows:

• Eating breakfast might help control blood sugar levels

• A good breakfast can improve memory and attention

• People who eat breakfast often have better overall diets

• Skipping breakfast might increase the risk of heart disease

However, more research is needed to fully understand all the effects of breakfast.

Breakfast and Productivity

Many people believe breakfast helps them work better. Here’s why:

• It provides energy for the morning

• It can improve focus and concentration

• Eating breakfast might help you make better decisions

• It can prevent mid-morning hunger and distractions

If you have an important morning task, a good breakfast might help you perform better.

Breakfast Habits Around the World

Different countries have different breakfast habits:

• In Italy, breakfast is often just coffee and a small pastry

• In Iceland, people might eat fish for breakfast

• In parts of Africa, leftover dinner is common for breakfast

• In Turkey, a breakfast spread might include many small dishes

These habits show how breakfast can vary greatly depending on where you are.

The Future of Breakfast

Breakfast is changing. Here are some trends:

• More people are eating breakfast foods at other times of day

• Plant-based breakfast options are becoming more popular

• Some people are trying intermittent fasting, which might mean skipping breakfast

• Breakfast delivery services are growing

As our lives change, the way we eat breakfast is likely to keep changing too.

Conclusion

Breakfast is an important meal for many people around the world. It can provide energy, nutrients, and a good start to the day. However, what makes a good breakfast can be different for everyone. Some people feel best when they eat a big breakfast, while others prefer something small or even no breakfast at all.

The key is to listen to your body and choose foods that make you feel good and help you stay healthy. Whether you’re answering “the breakfast question” or just deciding what to eat in the morning, remember that breakfast can be an important part of a healthy lifestyle.

No matter what you choose for breakfast, the most important thing is to make choices that work well for you and your health. Breakfast can be a great way to start your day, but how you start your day is a personal choice. The best breakfast is one that fits your lifestyle, tastes good to you, and helps you feel your best.

33 Japanese Quotes About Life to Elevate Your Soul and Guide Your Everyday Living

33 Japanese Quotes About Life to Elevate Your Soul and Guide Your Everyday Living

In philosophy, wisdom often transcends time and borders. Japanese quotes also offer deep insights into the human experience.

Japanese culture is no exception, boasting a rich tradition of inspiring quotes that guide our everyday lives. These Japanese quotes about life serve as powerful reminders. These words boost our souls and navigate the complexities of existence. So, engage yourself in this collection of wisdom from the land of the rising sun.

Japanese Quotes About Life

1. 七転び八起き (nana korobi ya oki)
Translation: Fall down seven times but get up eight times.

2. 千里の道も一歩から (senri no michi mo ippo kara)
Translation: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

Japanese Quotes About Life

3. 井の中の蛙大海を知らず (i no naka no kawazu taikai wo shirazu) Translation: “A frog in a well knows nothing of the sea.”

4. "Vision without action is a daydream. Action without vision is a nightmare." - Japanese Proverb

5. 自業自得 (jigoujitoku) Translation: “Self-work, self-profit.”

6. "The deeper the darkness, the more dazzling the light will shine." - Haruki Murakami

7. 死人に口なし (shinin ni kuchinashi)
Translation: Dead men tell no tales.

8. "The bamboo that bends is stronger than the oak that resists." - Japanese Proverb

9. "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." - Japanese Proverb

10. 自ら墓穴を掘る (mizukara boketsu wo horu)
Translation: Dig your own grave.

11. "One kind word can warm three winter months." - Japanese Proverb

12. 案ずるより産むが易し (anzuru yori umu ga yasushi) Translation: “It’s easier to give birth than to think about it.”

Japanese Quotes About Life

13. 見ぬが花 (minu ga hana) English translation: “Not seeing is a flower,” “Reality is never as good as your imagination”

14. 覆水盆に返らず (fukusui bon ni kaerazu)

15. 継続は力なり。 (keizoku wa chikara nari) English Translation: “Continuing on is power,” or “don’t give up.”

16. 恋とせきとは隠されぬ (koi to seki to wa kakusarenu)

17. あほに取り合うばか (aho ni toriau naka) Translation: “Only a fool deals with a fool.”

18. 猿も木から落ちる (saru mo ki kara ochiru)

19. 疑心暗鬼 (gishin’angi) English Translation: “Suspicion will raise bogies.”

20. 酒は本心を表す (sake wa honshin wo arawasu)

21. 危機一髪 (kiki ippatsu) English Translation: “A close call” or “in the nick of time”

22. 明日は明日の風が吹く (ashita wa ashita no kaze ga fuku)
Translation: The winds of tomorrow will blow tomorrow.

Japanese Quotes About Life

23. 雨降って地固まる (ame futte chikatamaru) Translation: “When it rains, earth hardens” or “Adversity builds character”

24. 恋とせきとは隠されぬ。(koi to seki to wa kakusarenu) Translation: “Love and a cough cannot be hidden.”

Translation: There’s no medicine for falling in love.

26. 負けるが勝ち (makeru ga kachi) English Translation: “To lose is to win.”

27. 鯛も一人はうまからず (taimo hitori wa umakarazu) English Translation: “Even a sea bream loses its flavor when eaten alone.”

29. 因果応報 (inga ouhou) English Translation: “Bad causes, bad result”, “karma” or “what goes around comes around”

Japanese Quotes About Life

These Japanese quotes about life offer wisdom that can lighten our souls and guide our lives.
