IVE's Wonyoung Healthy Diet Tips, Achieve a Slim Body and Healthier Skin

Jang Wonyoung, also known as Wonyoung from IVE, is famous for her talent and charm and her slim and healthy figure. Many fans are curious about how she maintains her health, especially her diet.

Wonyoung does not follow extreme diets that are difficult to maintain to achieve her ideal body shape. The 20-year-old idol practices several healthy diet secrets you can adopt, starting with a balanced diet and a healthier lifestyle.

Are you curious about her healthy diet? Let's take a closer look at the information below!

1. Healthy and Balanced Diet

Wonyoung pays a lot of attention to her nutrition. With her busy schedule as an idol, she always ensures that her food is full of nutrients. Her diet mainly focuses on high-quality protein sources, healthy carbohydrates, and fiber-rich fruits and vegetables.

For example, at breakfast, Wonyoung often chooses high-protein foods like eggs and milk, which provide enough energy to support her daily activities. She also includes green vegetables like spinach, rich in vitamins and minerals essential for her health.

2. Reduce High-Calorie Foods and Junk Food

Wonyoung, as an idol who needs to maintain her appearance, is very careful about the food she eats. She believes in avoiding junk food and high-calorie items. These types of food usually have low nutritional value but are high in fat, sugar, and salt, which can lead to weight gain and various health issues.

She prefers healthy foods like fruit and vegetable salads, fresh fruits, low-fat yogurt, and nuts rich in protein and fiber. This way, she can feel full longer without consuming too many calories. Additionally, Wonyoung shares some of her favorite healthy foods.

One dish she enjoys is Risotto, rice cooked in broth until it becomes creamy and sticky. She also recommends Grilled Tuna, prepared with oil, and Egg Pudding made from low-calorie ingredients. These meals are not only delicious but also support her healthy lifestyle.

3. Consume Enough Water

Hydration is an important factor in maintaining health and keeping an ideal weight. Born on August 31, 2004, she always tries to meet her body's fluid needs every day.

Water is vital for proper body function and helps with metabolism and digestion. Additionally, it helps moisturize the skin, making it look more radiant. To avoid excessive sugar intake, Wonyoung does not consume sweet and carbonated drinks, which tend to have empty calories.

Instead, she prefers to drink plain water and herbal tea, which help maintain her body's hydration levels. This way, she stays healthy and supports her skin's appearance, keeping it fresh and glowing.

4. Controlled Eating Portions

Wonyoung believes that success in dieting is not only about the food types chosen but also the portion sizes taken. She prefers to eat small amounts of food frequently throughout the day rather than having large meals simultaneously.

This approach helps her body digest food more effectively and prevents excessive hunger, often leading to overeating. By managing her portion sizes, Wonyoung can control her calorie intake while still getting the energy she needs for her activities.

5. Regular Exercise as Support for a Diet Program

The younger sister of beautiful actress Jang Da-Ah also leads an active lifestyle. She maintains her fitness through dance practice, which is part of her routine as a K-pop idol. Dancing is not only effective for burning calories, but it also helps improve cardiovascular health and muscle strength.

If you want to follow Wonyoung's diet tips, staying physically active is important. Whether you exercise, walk, cycle, or do yoga, all these activities play a crucial role in keeping your metabolism high and supporting healthy weight loss.

6. Think Positively about Our Body

One key factor in Wonyoung's successful diet is her positive attitude towards her body. She doesn’t focus on the number on the scale but prioritizes how she feels while living a healthy and fit life.

This approach is very beneficial because it emphasizes the importance of overall health rather than just striving for an ideal physical appearance. As a result, we can learn to appreciate our bodies more without getting caught up in unrealistic beauty standards.

Places To Visit In Gurgaon: The 5 Hidden Gems in India You Need to Explore

Places To Visit In Gurgaon: The 5 Hidden Gems in India You Need to Explore

Gurgaon is also known as "Gurugram." This bustling city is located in the state of Haryana, India.

While it may be famous for its corporate offices and modern infrastructure, Gurgaon offers many hidden gems to be explored. It ranges from ancient temples to serene natural parks. There is something for everyone to enjoy in this lively city. In this article, we will introduce you to five hidden gems in Gurgaon that you need to visit.

Places To Visit In Gurgaon

pujasthan.com

1. Shri Mata Sheetla Devi Mandir (Gurugram, Haryana)

Shri Mata Sheetla Devi Mandir is a famous temple dedicated to the goddess Sheetla Devi. It is located in the heart of Gurugram.

This ancient temple, believed to be over 500 years old, holds excellent religious value for the locals and attracts devotees from all over the country.

This site is known for its beautiful architecture and spiritual atmosphere.

Places To Visit In Gurgaon

If you're a nature lover, Sultanpur National Park is a must-visit destination in Gurgaon. This bird sanctuary is home to various avian species, making it a paradise for birdwatchers.

2. Sultanpur National Park

Spread across 143 acres, Sultanpur National Park offers a calm escape from the bustling city life. The park boasts over 250 species of birds, including migratory birds. They arrive here during the winter months. Take a relaxing walk through the park's well-maintained trails and catch glimpses of colorful birds in their habitat.

.instagram.com/skyjumpertp_gurgaon

3. SkyJumper Trampoline Park Gurgaon

For a fun-filled and exciting experience, head to SkyJumper Trampoline Park in Gurgaon. This indoor park is perfect for children and adults looking to release their inner child.

Jump, flip, and bounce on the trampolines spread across the park's big space. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced jumper, this park offers a variety of activities and challenges to suit all skill levels. This hidden gem in Gurgaon has adrenaline-pumping fun, from dodgeball to slam dunk basketball.

4. Farrukh Nagar Fort

Step back in time and explore the historical wonders of Farrukh Nagar Fort. It is located on the outskirts of Gurgaon. This 18th-century fort is evidence of the region's rich history.

The fort was built by Nawab Faujdar Khan, a governor during the reign of Mughal emperor Farrukhsiyar, thus the name "Farrukh Nagar Fort." As you walk through the fort's ancient walls and corridors, you can't help but imagine the majesty and glory it once held during its heyday. The fort's architectural beauty and design delight history fans and photography lovers alike.

bird.in/saikaangan-new

5. Sai Ka Angan Temple

Situated in the heart of Gurgaon, Sai Ka Angan Temple is a peaceful haven for devotees of Sai Baba. This temple has a sense of calmness and peacefulness. It provides a much-needed escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.

The temple is decorated with beautiful marble pillars and detailed carvings. These features create a soothing atmosphere for visitors. Devotees come here to seek blessings and find solace in the divine presence of Sai Baba. The temple also hosts various religious events and festivals. Their event attracted a large number of devotees.

In conclusion, Gurgaon may be known for its corporate and modern infrastructure, but it offers so much more.

These places to visit in Gurgaon are waiting to be explored. They offer a variety of experiences for everyone, from spiritual temples to serene natural parks. There is something for every age group to enjoy. So, next time you visit Gurgaon, don't forget to check out these hidden gems and make the most of your trip.

8 Interesting Facts About Jeep Wrangler

8 Interesting Facts About Jeep Wrangler

The Jeep Wrangler is a famous and tough car from the United States of America. It is great for driving off-road and has a cool style. Here we compiled some interesting facts about the Jeep Wrangler

The Name Origin

No one is sure where the name "Jeep" comes from. Some people say it comes from "General Purpose" (GP), which sounds like "Jeep." Others say it comes from Eugene the Jeep, a character in Popeye. The true origin is still unknown.

Various Types

The Jeep Wrangler has different versions, called "trims." There is the basic Sport, the more comfortable Sahara, and the tough Rubicon for off-road adventures. Each trim has unique features.

The Iconic 'Grille'

The Jeep Wrangler has a special grille with seven slots on its front side. This design was first made by Henry Ford for a military vehicle in 1941. Jeep started using this grille in 1990, and it became very popular.

Built for Off-Roading

The Jeep Wrangler Rubicon is made for off-road driving. It has high ground clearance, special tires, and a system called Rock-Trac to help on rough terrain. It also has Tru-Lok, which locks the wheels for better control.

Can Tow (Carry) Heavy Weight

The Jeep Wrangler Unlimited Rubicon can tow heavy things. It can pull up to 3,500 pounds. This is enough for a small camper, a trailer with a boat, or even a trailer with two horses.

Military Background

The Jeep Wrangler is based on military vehicles used in World War II. The original Jeeps were made by a company called Willys. After the war, Willys made a civilian version called the CJ, which means "Civilian Jeep."

Influenced Other 4x4s

The Jeep Wrangler inspired other off-road vehicles. It even helped create the first Land Rover in 1947 because it used a Jeep chassis (the base frame of a vehicle). Many other 4x4 cars followed its design.

Hollywood Famous

The Jeep Wrangler has been in over a thousand movies and TV shows. Its most famous appearance is in the Jurassic Park movies. The Jeep Grand Cherokee, another Jeep model, has also been in many films and TV shows.

30 Star Quotes: Discovering A Sky Full of Inspiration

30 Star Quotes: Discovering A Sky Full of Inspiration

Star quotes shine brightly, just like the stars themselves. They light up the sky of our thoughts. They're like guiding lights, showing us the way through the dark. And even since ancient times, people have found comfort and inspiration by looking up at the stars.

Star quotes encourage us to believe in ourselves and our dreams. Whether they're about perseverance, love, or the wonders of the universe, these star quotes have a way of speaking to our hearts and inspiring us.

Scroll on to uncover some inspiring star quotes that will ignite your imagination.

Inspirational Star Quotes

  • “It shows you exactly how a star is formed; nothing else can be so pretty! A cluster of vapor, the cream of the milky way, a sort of celestial cheese, churned into light.” – Benjamin Disraeli

  • “May all the stars hang bright above her dwelling, Silent as though they watched the sleeping earth!” – Samuel Taylor Coleridge

  • “Only in the darkness can you see the stars.” – Martin Luther King Jr.

  • “It is reasonable to hope that in the not too distant future we shall be competent to understand so simple a thing as a star.” – Arthur Eddington

  • “There wouldn’t be a sky full of stars if we were all meant to wish on the same one.” – Frances Clark

  • “Second star to the right, and straight on till morning.” – Peter Pan

  • “There wouldn’t be a sky full of stars if we were all meant to wish on the same one.” – Frances Clark

  • “We are bits of stellar matter that got cold by accident, bits of a star gone wrong.” – Arthur Eddington

  • “It’s the kind of kiss that inspires stars to climb into the sky and light up the world.” – Tahereh Mafi

  • “The stars look like they’re so close, you could reach out and touch them. But you can’t. Sometimes things look a lot closer than they are.” – Kami Garcia

  • “I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.” – Sarah William

  • “Each star is a mirror reflecting the truth inside you.” – Aberjhani

  • “There is no shortage of fault to be found amid our stars” – John Green

  • “Not just beautiful, though-the stars are like the trees in the forest, alive and breathing. And they’re watching me.” – Haruki Murakami

  • “Maybe that’s what life is… a wink of the eye and winking stars.” – Jack Kerouac
  • “I will love the light for it shows me the way; yet I will love the darkness for it shows me the stars.” –Augustine ‘Og’ Mandino

  • “New stars offer to the mind a phenomenon more surprising, and less explicable, than almost any other in the science of astronomy.” – George Adams

  • “Look at the stars. See their beauty. And in that beauty, see yourself.” – Draya Mooney

  • “The real friends of the space voyager are the stars. Their friendly, familiar patterns are constant companions, unchanging, out there.” – James Lovell

  • “The stars are the land-marks of the universe.” – Sir John Frederick William Herschel

  • “Moonlight drowns out all but the brightest stars.” – R.R. Tolkien

  • “Not just beautiful, though – the stars are like the trees in the forest, alive and breathing. And they’re watching me.” – Haruki Murakami

  • “For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.” – Vincent Van Gogh

  • “Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.” – Theodore Roosevelt

  • “A sky as pure as water bathed the stars and brought them out.” – Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

“Remember to look up at the stars and now down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious. And however difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. It matters that you don’t just give up.” 

– Professor Stephen Hawking

  • “It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.” – William Shakespeare

  • “We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.” – Oscar Wilde

  • “Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.” – Stephen Hawking

  • “I like the night. Without the dark, we’d never see the stars.” – Stephenie Meyer

Jay Weinberg Speaks Out After Being Fired from Slipknot

Jay Weinberg Speaks Out After Being Fired from Slipknot

Drummer Jay Weinberg opened up after his dismissal from metal band Slipknot last week. Weinberg revealed his feelings and felt "heartbroken and deceived" by the decision.

"I was devastated and felt cheated when I received the call as I felt on the morning of November 5, news that you soon learned," Weinberg said in a post on his Instagram account.

"However, I am deeply moved, and truly grateful, for the love and support I have received from this incredible community, which I consider my creative and artistic home," he continued.

Weinberg recalls when he was appointed to replace the late Joey Jordison in 2014, or almost 10 years ago. Weinberg says he is grateful for the journey of the past decade.

He also ensures that he will continue to work and is committed to continuing his work behind the drum chair.

"I love playing drums. I will always love playing drums. I will always have a passion for music, art, and creative expression. Nothing will ever change that," said Weinberg.

"I don't know how, and I don't know when, but I hope to create loud, passionate, and sincere music that we can all enjoy," he continued.

On Sunday November,5, Jay Weinberg officially did not become part of Slipknot after being in the band since 2014. The drummer left after becoming a Slipknot member, replacing the position left by Joey Jordison in 2013.

"We would like to thank Jay Weinberg for his dedication and passion over the past ten years or so," wrote Slipknot's official statement.

"Nothing can replace Joey's original energy, but Jay honored Joey's parts and contributed to the last three albums so we, the band, and the fans appreciate it."

"But as always, Slipknot is determined to keep growing. The band has decided to make a creative decision and part ways with Jay," the official statement continued.

Jay Weinberg joined Slipknot in 2014. He replaced Joey Jordison, the original personnel who formed Slipknot with Shawn Crahan and Paul Gray in 1995.

Since then, Weinberg has been involved in several of Slipknot's musical projects. Call it 5: The Gray Chapter (2014), We Are Not Your Kind (2019), and The End, So Far (2022).

Jay Weinberg also joined Slipknot on two world concert tours: the Prepare for Hell Tour from 2014 to 2016 and the We Are Not Your Kind World Tour from 2019 to 2021.

Slipknot was recorded to part with two personnel throughout 2023. Before Weinberg, Craig Jones resigned and is no longer Slipknot's keyboardist.

Slipknot now consists of 8 personnel, with Shawn Crahan as the only original band member.

Besides Crahan, Slipknot consists of Mick Thomson, Corey Taylor, Sid Wilson, Jim Root, Alessandro Venturella, Michael Pfaff, and a secret musician.

4 Most Haunted Places In South Africa

Are you ready for a thrilling journey through South Africa's spookiest spots? Get ready to hear ghostly tales and uncover the mysteries of haunted places! South Africa is not just about safaris and beautiful landscapes. It's also home to some fascinating, creepy stories that will send shivers down your spine! (Photo by Alessio Lin on Unsplash)

4 Most Haunted Places In South Africa

In this exciting article, we'll travel to this beautiful country to uncover some of the most haunted places in South Africa and their spine-chilling stories. So brave your heart, and let's start this spooky journey together! (Image by Brigitte Werner from Pixabay)

1. Table Mountain

Table Mountain is the icon of Cape Town and one of the most popular tourist attractions in the city. Many people come to this beautiful place to enjoy the breathtaking panoramic view of Cape Town. (Photo by Marlin Clark on Unsplash)

Table Mountain: A Haunted Paradise

Many people believed that Table Mountain was haunted. Legend said that there was a man in the past that wanted to take revenge against the governor of Cape Town. This man then gave the governor's son a beautiful flute. The son loved the gift and played the beautiful flute. One thing that he and his father didn't know was that the flute was owned by a leper. Soon after, the boy became ill. The son was then exiled to a hut on Table Mountain, where he played his flute until the end of his life.

2. Cape Point

Cape Point is another very popular attraction in Cape Town, South Africa. While it's famous for its beautiful scenery, Cape Point is also the birthplace of the famous legend of the Flying Dutchman. (Photo by Jean-Baptiste D. on Unsplash_

Cape Point: The Legend of Flying Dutchman

According to IOL, the legend started after a Dutch ship captained by Hendrik van der Decken was missing in the water around Cape Point in 1641. His ship was caught in the storm and broke into pieces. Legend said that he shouted, "I will round this Cape even if it takes me until Judgment Day," as his last word. Legend said that the ship and its crew were cursed to roam the seas forever, never finding rest or safe harbor.

Story said that on stormy nights or in foggy conditions, the ghost ship can still be seen in the water around Cape Point and other seas around the world. (Image from Wikimedia/Public Domain)

3. Erasmus Castle

Erasmus Castle is a beautiful mansion located in the city of Pretoria, South Africa. It was built in 1903 by a wealthy farmer named Jochemus Johannes Petrus Erasmus. (Photo by JW Hurter on Wikimedia/CC BY-SA 3.0)

Today, many people know it as "Die Spookhuis" or "The Haunted House." That's because there are many mysterious experiences happening around the house. According to The Little House Of Horror, there's a story about a ghost of a woman dressed in a Victorian nightgown. The ghost appears in the window and sometimes in the garden.

There's also a story about a mysterious man sitting on an armchair. It's said that the mysterious man only sat on the armchair and didn't respond to any questions. Some said that they heard mysterious footsteps in the house, while others claim they saw the light and taps turn on and off by themselves.

4. Castle of Good Hope

The Castle of Good Hope is an old fort located in Cape Town. It was built in the 17th century by slaves. The fort is surrounded by mysteries and is known as one of the most haunted places in the country. (Image by Jeanine Smal from Pixabay)

According to Cape Town Tourism, some workers and visitors said they heard mysterious voices and footsteps in the dungeon and in the narrow corridors of the fort. There's a story about a ghost of a black dog that approaches visitors and then disappears mysteriously. (Photo by Nina Ganci on Unsplash)

Castle of Good Hope

One of the most famous ghosts in Castle of Good Hope is the ghost of Lady Anne Barnard. She lived in the castle from the 1790s to the 1800s. Her job was to entertain important guests. It's said that her ghost still appears when there're important guests that come to the castle. (Photo by Nina Ganci on Unsplash)

7 Places to Visit in South Dakota: Exploring the Beauty of the Sunshine State

7 Places to Visit in South Dakota: Exploring the Beauty of the Sunshine State

South Dakota is a beautiful state in the United States that is famous for its stunning natural scenery and rich history. It is a must-visit destination for those who love nature and want to explore the beauty of the Sunshine State.

From majestic mountains to unique historical landmarks, South Dakota offers a wide range of attractions that will leave you in awe. Here are some of the best places to visit in South Dakota:

1. Mount Rushmore National Monument

One of the most iconic landmarks in the United States, Mount Rushmore is a must-see when visiting South Dakota.

This massive sculpture features the faces of four former presidents - George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln, carved into the granite cliffs of the Black Hills.

The monument is not only impressive to look at, but it also offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains.

2. Crazy Horse Memorial

Another famous monument in South Dakota is the Crazy Horse Memorial, a massive sculpture that honors the legendary Native American leader Crazy Horse. This ongoing project aims to depict Crazy Horse riding a horse and pointing into the distance.

When completed, it will be the largest sculpture in the world. Visitors can learn about the history and culture of Native Americans at the visitor center and museum located on-site.

3. Custer State Park

Custer State Park is a nature lover's paradise, offering diverse wildlife and outdoor activities such as hiking, fishing, and wildlife viewing. The park is home to a large herd of bison and features scenic drives like the Needles Highway and Iron Mountain Road.

Visitors can also hike the Sylvan Lake Shore Trail and explore the challenging trails leading up to Black Elk Peak, the highest peak in the state.

4. Wind Cave National Park

Wind Cave National Park is home to one of the longest and most complex caves in the world, with over 140 miles of explored passageways. Visitors can take guided tours of the cave to marvel at its unique boxwork formations and intricate calcite crystals.

Above ground, the park offers stunning hiking trails and opportunities to spot bison, pronghorn, and other wildlife in their natural habitat.

5. Badlands National Park

The Badlands National Park is a truly unique destination in South Dakota, known for its rugged terrain and striking rock formations. Visitors can explore the park's dramatic canyons, towering spires, and fossil-rich cliffs on hiking trails or scenic drives.

The park is also a haven for wildlife, with bighorn sheep, prairie dogs, and bison roaming freely across the landscape.

6. The Mammoth Site of Hot Springs

The Mammoth Site is an active paleontological site and museum where visitors can see fossils of Ice Age mammals.

The site is home to over 61 mammoth bones, as well as remains of other animals like oxen, llamas, and camels. Guided tours are available to learn about the history and significance of the site.

Deadwood is a historic town known for its Wild West history and culture. 

7. Deadwood

Visitors can explore the town's museums, casinos, and breweries and visit Mount Moriah Cemetery, where many of the town's famous figures are buried. Deadwood is also famous for its annual motorcycle rally, which attracts thousands of visitors each year.

6 Places to Visit in Nova Scotia: An Underrated Tourist Destination in Canada

6 Places to Visit in Nova Scotia: An Underrated Tourist Destination in Canada

When people think of traveling to Canada, popular destinations like Niagara Falls, Toronto, and Quebec often come to mind. However, Nova Scotia is a hidden gem that should not be overlooked.

This beautiful province on Canada's east coast offers a unique blend of history, culture, and natural beauty that is sure to captivate any traveler. Here are some of the best places to visit in Nova Scotia:

1. Peggy's Cove

One of Nova Scotia's most iconic landmarks, Peggy's Cove is a picturesque fishing village known for its rugged coastline, historic lighthouse, and stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean.

Visitors can explore the winding pathways that lead to the lighthouse, stroll along the rocky shoreline, and enjoy fresh seafood at one of the local restaurants.

Cape Breton Island is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts.

2. Cape Breton

It is home to the famous Cabot Trail, a scenic drive that offers breathtaking views of the Gulf of St. Lawrence and the Atlantic Ocean.

Cape Breton is also known for its quaint fishing villages, lush forests, and pristine beaches.

Be sure to visit the charming town of Baddeck, where you can learn about the life of Alexander Graham Bell at the Alexander Graham Bell National Historic Site.

3. Lunenburg

A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Lunenburg is a charming town that is steeped in history and maritime tradition. The town's colorful waterfront buildings, cobblestone streets, and historic architecture make it a popular destination for tourists.

Be sure to visit the Fisheries Museum of the Atlantic to learn about the town's seafaring past and take a stroll along the picturesque waterfront.

4. Fortress of Louisbourg

Step back in time at the Fortress of Louisbourg National Historic Site, a reconstructed 18th-century French fortress that offers a fascinating glimpse into Canada's colonial history. Explore the fortified walls, period buildings, and costumed interpreters who bring the past to life.

Nova Scotia's vibrant capital city, Halifax, has a rich maritime history, thriving arts scene, and lively waterfront district.

5. Halifax

Visit the Maritime Museum of the Atlantic to learn about the city's seafaring past, explore the historic Halifax Citadel, and sample fresh seafood at the waterfront restaurants.

Don't miss the chance to take a stroll along the waterfront boardwalk and visit the charming shops and boutiques.

6. Kejimkujik National Park

For nature lovers, Kejimkujik National Park is a paradise of pristine wilderness, crystal-clear lakes, and lush forests.

Hike along scenic trails, paddle a canoe or kayak on the tranquil waterways, and camp under the stars in this peaceful natural oasis.

Keep an eye out for wildlife such as deer, beavers, and songbirds as you explore this beautiful park.

Louis Tomlinson Brings Television to Glastonbury Festival to Watch Euro 2024

Louis Tomlinson Brings Television to Glastonbury Festival to Watch Euro 2024

The Glastonbury Festival, which finished last week, is still being discussed on social media. Various interesting moments are still being discussed, one of which is the ridiculousness displayed by Louis Tomlinson.

The former One Direction personnel were present at Glastonbury as an audience, but they actually brought a television. Instead of watching musical performances, Tomlinson and his friends watched the England national team compete in Euro 2024.

In several videos circulating on TikTok, hundreds of people gathered to watch the match between England vs Slovakia on a television carried by Tomlinson.

When he brought the television to Glastonbury, the 32-year-old singer and songwriter seemed to know what he wanted. He even wore an England national team jacket.

When interviewed by the BBC after the match, Tomlinson admitted that he deliberately brought a television. According to him, that's what Glastonbury Festival is like.

"We brought a TV, it's very Glasto, with some rocks and a little stand. Sometimes it's difficult (to watch), because the signal comes and goes. But luckily we (England national team) won and we made it," said Louis Tomlinson.

Some netizens also responded to Tomlinson's behavior through the comments column.

"He is a soccer addict, and I am a Louis Tomlinson addict. So, I understand it," said one netizen.

For information, the 2024 Glastonbury Festival features Coldplay, Dua Lipa, and SZA as the main performers. Other performers include Shania Twain, Cyndi Lauper, Keane, and SEVENTEEN.

40 Bird Quotes: Inspiration, Freedom, and Life Lessons

Birds, with their easy flight and sweet songs, have always amazed people. Watching them fly high in the sky makes us think about freedom and dreams. Many bird quotes talk about this feeling, helping us remember the beauty and hope that are all around us. 

From the simple joy of seeing a bird fly to the deep meanings birds have in different cultures, bird quotes show us new ways to think about life. They encourage us to follow our dreams, find our own freedom, and enjoy the small beautiful things around us. Birds are often used to explain big feelings and ideas in life. 

In this article, we have gathered some of the most beautiful and powerful bird quotes from various sources, Monday (28/4/2024). These quotes will make you smile and bring a little more light into your life. 

Meaningful Bird Quotes

1. "Wherever there are birds, there is hope." - Mehmet Murat Ildan

2. "The sound of birds stops the noise in my mind." -Carly Simon

3. “A bird in hand is a certainty. But a bird in the bush may sing.” - Bret Harte

4. "I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance." - E.E. cummings

5. "I'm very happy being me, although sometimes I'd love to be a bird so that I could fly." - Joy Fielding

6. "My heart is like a singing bird." - Christina Rossetti

7. "I wake up every morning new, free as a bird." - Ashley Cole

8. "Hear how the birds, on every blooming spray, With joyous music wake the dawning day.” - Alexander Pope

9. ”Be as a bird perched on a frail branch that she feels bending beneath her; still, she sings away all the same, knowing she has wings.” – Victor Hugo.

10. “The presence of a single bird can change everything for one who appreciates them.” - Julie Zickefoose

11. "Birds are the first and the greatest performers.” - Olivier Messiaen

12. "Birds are magical. Their flight alone can arouse a clever thought.” - Michael Bassey Johnson

13. “Birds will give you a window, if you allow them. They will show you secrets from another world– fresh vision that, though it is avian, can accompany you home and alter your life. They will do this for you even if you don’t know their names– though such knowing is a thoughtful gesture. They will do this for you if you watch them.” - Lyanda Lynn Haupt

14. “Everyone likes birds. What wild creature is more accessible to our eyes and ears, as close to us and everyone in the world, as universal as a bird?” - Sir David Attenborough.

15. “Tame birds sing of freedom. Wild birds fly.”- John Lennon.

Quotes About Bird in a Cage

1. "A forest bird never wants a cage." - Henrik Ibsen

2. "Birds are not meant to be caged, their spirits should soar free." – Maya Angelou

3. "We think caged birds sing, when indeed they cry.” - John Webster

4. "Birds born in cages think that flying is an illness.” - Alejandro Jodorowsky

5. "Birds are not free since Men have invented cages.” - Mehmet Murat ildan

6. "How can a bird that is born for joy sit in a cage and sing?” - William Blake

7. "God loved the birds and invented trees. Man loved the birds and invented cages." - Jacques Deval

8. "But a caged bird stands on the grave of dreams." - Maya Angelou

9. "The caged bird sings with a fearful trill, of things unknown, but longed for still, and his tune is heard on the distant hill, for the caged bird sings of freedom." - Maya Angelou

10. "Caged birds sing of freedom, free birds fly." - Thorolf Rafto

Inspirational Bird Quotes

1. "Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly." - Langston Hughes

2. "No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings." - William Blake

3. “The reason birds can fly and we can't is simply because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings.” - J.M. Barrie

4. "Tomorrow, the birds will sing. Be brave. Face life." - Charlie Chaplin

5. "Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings." - Salvador Dali

6. "Life without dreams is like a bird with a broken wing - it can't fly." - Dan Pena

7. "The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation." - A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

8. "A heart without dreams is like a bird without feathers." - Suzy Kassem

9. "God gives every bird its food, but He does not throw it into its nest." - Josiah Gilbert Holland

10. "A bird cannot fly with one wing only. Human space flight cannot develop any further without the active participation of women." - Valentina Tereshkova

11. "It's impossible to explain creativity. It's like asking a bird, 'How do you fly?' You just do." - Eric Jerome Dickey

12. "Birds of a feather flock together." - Proverb

13. "A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song." – Maya Angelou

14. “It is not only fine feathers that make fine birds.” - Aesop

15. "You cannot fly like an eagle with the wings of a wren.” - William Henry Hudson

16. "Until you spread your wings; you’ll have no idea how far you can fly.” - Napoleon Bonaparte.

17. “Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.” - Rabindranath Tagore.

18. “Soft feathers cannot make a cruel bird kind.”- Munia Khan.

19. "Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn’t people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?” - Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

20. "Success is full of promise till one gets it, and then it seems like a nest from which the bird has flown." - Henry Ward Beecher

Safety Quotes: 30 Words to Inspire a Safer Workplace

These safety quotes serve as a reminder that safety isn't just a policy, but a mindset we should all embrace. (Photo by Marianna Krzakiewicz on Unsplash)

Safety Quotes: 30 Words to Inspire a Safer Workplace

Creating a safe workplace is important for the well-being of everyone involved. Sometimes, a few wise words can remind us of the importance of safety and inspire us to take action.

In this article, we have collected some powerful safety quotes to help motivate you and your team to stay vigilant and prioritize safety every day.

These quotes serve as a reminder that safety isn't just a policy, but a mindset we should all embrace. They often provide motivation, insight, and reminders about safe practices and the value of preventing accidents and injuries.

So, let’s explore these 30 safety quotes together and let them inspire us to create a safer environment for everyone. Don’t miss out!

A. Short Safety Quotes

1. "Don’t learn safety by accident." – Jerry Smith

2. "Don’t turn your back on safety; if it’s unsafe, report it!" – Unknown

3. "Safety brings first aid to the uninjured." — F.S. Hughes

4. "The safety of the people shall be the highest law." — Marcus Tullius Cicero

5. "Safety doesn’t happen by accident." — Jerry Smith

6. "An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure." — Benjamin Franklin

7. "Confidence cannot find a place wherein to rest in safety." – Virgil

8. "Safety is not a gadget but a state of mind." — Eleanor Everet

9. "Precaution is better than cure." — Edward Coke

10. "Working safely is like breathing – if you don’t, you die." — Jerry Smith

B. Safety Quotes to Remind Yourself

1. "Safety is not an intellectual exercise to keep us in work. It is a matter of life and death. It is the sum of our contributions to safety management that determines whether the people we work with live or die." — Sir Brian Appleton

2. "How employees manage health and safety in the workplace or how labor rights are respected are issues important for employees and investors alike. Companies can, and should do good right alongside doing well." – Tim Smith

3. "Concern for man and his safety must always form the chief interest of all technical endeavors." – Albert Einstein

4. "Carefulness costs you nothing. Carelessness may cost you your life." – Safety saying, circa the early 1900s

5. "I never thought I’d hear myself say it, but safety comes first!" – J. K. Rowling

6. "If you put good people in bad systems, you get bad results. You have to water the flowers you want to grow." – Stephen Covey

7. "Deterrence is not a preeminent value; the primary values are safety and morality." – Herman Kahn

8. "Safety is something that happens between your ears, not something you hold in your hands." — Jeff Cooper

9. "I do care a great deal about the environment. Still, my real work and my greatest challenge are trying to overcome deceits that end up jeopardizing public health and safety." – Erin Brockovich

10. "You don’t need to know the whole alphabet of safety. The a, b, c of it will save you if you follow it: Always Be Careful." — Colorado School of Mines Magazine

C. Safety Quotes to Share with Your Coworkers

1. "Of the major incentives to improve safety, by far the most compelling is that of economics. The moral incentive, which is most evident following an accident, is more intense but is relatively short-lived." – Jerome F. Lederer

2. "I’m glad to see how young people are stepping up regarding safety. They are focused on safety rather than being told to be safe. It makes a difference when people own things." – Scott Cam, The Block

3. "If you are the proprietor or managing director of a company, you are ultimately responsible for the health and safety of all aspects of the business." – Unknown

4. "The government’s first duty and highest obligation is public safety." – Arnold Schwarzenegger

5. "Occupational safety and health are vital to the dignity of work." – Juan Somavia

6. "If you think professional safety officers are expensive, wait until you see what an amateur costs." – Unknown

7. "One earnest worker can do more by personal suggestion to prevent accidents than a carload of safety signs." – Making Paper

8. "If the owner or manager does not show an interest in preventing employee injury and illness, then the employees will probably not give it much thought either." – Rhode Island Small Business Recovery Program

9. "Your employees learn by example. If they don’t see you practicing good safety habits, they won’t think safety is important." — Electrical Construction & Maintenance (EC&M) Magazine

10. "Our motto is to work for peace based on social justice. Our mandate is to improve the condition, health and safety of workers, and our mission is universal." – David A. Morse

Man in Australia Got Attacked by Wild Kangaroo While Rescuing His Dog

He was attacked by a wild kangaroo while rescuing his dog in the river.

Man in Australia Got Attacked by Wild Kangaroo While Rescuing His Dog

A man in Australia named Mick Moloney wrestled with a wild kangaroo to save his dog.

This dramatic meeting took place in Mildura, Australia. The kangaroo tied the dog's head.

Moloney documented this horrific incident on TikTok.

He uploaded it on October 14 and 15. Many users watched the original video millions of times, but TikTok removed the video. He re-uploaded a shorter version on October 18.

In the video, Moloney is seen in the Murray River fighting a muscular kangaroo holding his dog.

His dog, Hatchi, went missing while relaxing by the river. He then looked for it. Moloney saw a kangaroo with Hatchi in the river. The dog struggled to get free.

At first, Moloney tried to scare the kangaroo with loud noises. But it didn't work. Then he went down to the river and faced the muscular kangaroo.

In the video, Moloney said, "I'm going to punch your head." Moloney also asked the kangaroo to free the dog before attacking the animal. The kangaroo attacked him and dropped Moloney's phone into the river.

He did not catch some of the video because his phone fell.

After the camera returned to recording, the kangaroo was no longer near the dog.

The kangaroo was still trying to attack him when he walked away from the river and met his dog on land.

Moloney also showed his hand was bleeding to the camera. 

But he is happy that his dog is back. He assured the users that his dog was fine.

In the video, Moloney also clarifies that he loves animals. He had no purpose of being cruel at all, including the kangaroo.

35 Itachi Uchiha Quotes From Naruto: Lessons In Strength, Sacrifice, And Wisdom

35 Itachi Uchiha Quotes From Naruto: Lessons In Strength, Sacrifice, And Wisdom

In the world of Naruto, Itachi Uchiha is one of the most enigmatic and intriguing characters. Known for his immense power and unparalleled intelligence, Itachi Uchiha quotes throughout the series have left a lasting impact on fans.

From his reflections on life and death to his thoughts on sacrifice and love, Itachi's words carry a weight that resonates with many. Whether you're a die-hard fan of the series or a casual viewer, his quotes are sure to leave a lasting impression.

Itachi Uchiha quotes remind us to look beyond the surface and consider the deeper meaning behind our actions and decisions. His words resonate with many fans and have become an important part of the Naruto experience.

In this article, we have selected some of the best and most memorable Itachi Uchiha quotes from various sources, Tuesday (30/1/2024). So sit back, relax, and let's take a closer look at the timeless wisdom of Itachi Uchiha.

A. Wise Itachi Uchiha Quotes

1. "It is not wise to judge others based on your own perceptions and by their appearances." - Itachi

2. "Even the strongest of opponents always have a weakness." - Itachi

3. "It is foolish to fear what we have yet to see and know." - Itachi

4. "However strong you become, never seek to bear everything alone. If you do, failure is certain." - Itachi

5. "He who forgives and acknowledges himself, that is what it truly means to be strong!" - Itachi

6. "Growth occurs when one goes beyond one's limits." - Itachi

7. "Time doesn't heal anything, it just teaches us how to live with pain." - Itachi

8. "Those who cannot acknowledge themselves will eventually fail." - Itachi

9. "Knowledge and awareness are vague, and perhaps better called illusions. Everyone lives within their own subjective interpretation." - Itachi

10. "We do not know what kind of people we truly are until the moment before our deaths. As death comes to embrace you, you will realize what you are. That's what death is, don't you think?" - Itachi

11. "Change is impossible in this fog of ignorance." - Itachi

12. "Those who turn their heads against their comrades are sure to die a terrible death. Be prepared." - Itachi

13. "Pain must be the ultimate lesson, and it teaches one to understand what pain in life actually is. Because those who never understood someone else's pain will eventually end up knowing nothing." - Itachi

14. "People's lives don't end when they die. It ends when they lose faith." - Itachi

15. "No single thing is perfect by itself. That's why we're born to attract other things to make up for what we lack." - Itachi

16. "When the power of love overcomes the love for power, the world will know peace." - Itachi

17. "If you want to know who you are, you have to look at your real self and acknowledge what you see." - Itachi

18. "Your comrades are there to make up for what you cannot do and to prevent you from ignoring things that you actually might have been able to do." - Itachi

19. "Loneliness is this world's worst kind of pain." - Itachi

20. "No one who dares to raise their hand against a comrade ever dies a decent death, remember that." - Itachi

B. Famous Itachi Uchiha Quotes In Naruto

1. "Every jutsu has its weakness. This jutsu's weakness and risk is the existence of me!" - Itachi

2. "You don't become a Hokage in order to be acknowledged by the village, the one who is acknowledged by everyone is the one who becomes a Hokage." - Itachi

3. "Self-sacrifice… A nameless shinobi who protects peace within its shadow. That is a true shinobi." - Itachi

4. "You're such a child. You talk of nothing but pipe dreams; there are times when people must make painful choices." - Itachi

5. "You aren't even worth killing, foolish little brother." - Itachi

6. “Don’t cry Sasuke. Your big brother is here to protect you, no matter what happens." - Itachi

7. "Never forget your friends!" - Itachi

8. "Sorry, Sasuke… this is the last time." - Itachi

9. "That's why I wanted to show you the truth, Even if it's just a little. And no matter what you decide to do from here on out, you never have to forgive me – I will always love you." - Itachi

10. "You are weak. Why are you so weak? Because you lack hatred." - Itachi

11. "True Change cannot be made if it is bound by laws and limitations, predictions and imagination." - Itachi

12. "Any technique is worthless before my eyes." - Itachi

13. "No, it means to forgive yourself for what you aren't able to do." - Itachi

14. "You once said it was everyone who cares about you who helped you get where you are now. If you forget others because you have power, and become arrogant and egotistical, you'll eventually become just like Madara." - Itachi

15. "No matter how powerful you become, do not try to shoulder everything alone." - Itachi

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: 5 Mouthwatering Classic Thai Breakfasts You Must Try
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Here are some mouthwatering Thai breakfast that are perfect to start your adventure in Thailand.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
5 Mouthwatering Classic Thai Breakfasts You Must Try

Breakfast becomes something special when you're exploring a new country. It's like the beginning of a thrilling adventure that gets you all set to discover new things. (Photo by Lisheng Chang on Unsplash)

5 Mouthwatering Classic Thai Breakfasts You Must Try

Thailand is a top destination for food lovers. It's a place where you can find all sorts of delicious dishes.

From tasty street food to fancy restaurants, you'll never run out of options.

© 2023 trstdly.com

So, in this article, we're going to talk about some classic Thai breakfasts that you just have to try when you're in Thailand. So get ready to learn about yummy foods that will make your taste buds super happy! (Photo by Evan Krause on Unsplash)

1. Jok (Thai Congee)

Jok is the staple breakfast in Thailand. Jok is Thai congee or a type of rice porridge. Jok is usually served with egg, ginger, minced pork, and spring onion. It's a warm and comforting dish to start your day in Thailand. (Photo by Takeaway on Wikimedia/ CC BY-SA 3.0)

2. Paa Tong Ko (Thai Donuts)

Paa tong ko is known as a Thai breakfast donut. It's the Thai version of Chinese donuts. It's a deep-fried donut with a strip shape.
(Photo by Phoebus 28 on Wikimedia/CC BY-SA 4.0)

It's usually dipped in condensed milk, making it a perfect breakfast for those who have a sweet tooth. Paa tong ko is so popular and sold in many street carts in the morning.

(Photo by Chris Pople on Flickr/CC BY-ND 2.0)

3. Khai Chiao

Khai Chiao is the Thai version of an omelet. Different from other omelets, khai chiao is deep-fried in oil, making it crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. It's usually served over rice and topped with sweet chili sauce. (Photo by Ron Dollete on Flickr/CC BY-ND 2.0)

4. Moo Ping

Moo Ping is a Thai pork skewer. The pork is marinated in a mix of spice, fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. (Photo by bob walker on Flickr/bob walker)

The pork is grilled over charcoal and served with sticky rice. Moo Ping is often sold in street carts in the morning and is a very popular breakfast menu in Thailand. (Photo by Haydn Blackey on Flickr/CC BY-SA 2.0)

5. Khao tom

Khao tom is another warm, filling, and comforting dish to start your day in Thailand. It's made with cooked rice that is cooked into a soup along with various ingredients, such as seafood or fish. (Photo by Takeaway on Wikimedia/CC BY-SA 3.0)

Funny Aunt Quotes

Finland has consistently earned the title of the happiest country in the world.

5 Reasons Why Finland Is The Happiest Country in The World

Finland has consistently earned the title of the happiest country in the world, reflecting the harmonious lives of its citizens.

The country's commitment to its citizens makes Finland a shining example of a country that promotes holistic well-being.

In this list, we will give you 5 reasons why Finland is the happiest country in the world.

Finland's happiness is thanks to the balanced lives of its citizens, which includes work-life balance, access to nature, and a highly decentralized publicly funded healthcare system.

Balanced Life

The high level of social trust in Finland contributes to its ranking as the happiest country in the world. Most Finns expect their wallet to be returned to them if they lose it, reflecting the strong social trust in the country.

Social Trust

Finnish happiness is due to an appreciation for simple pleasures, such as clean air, clean water, and the ability to fully enjoy nature.

Simple Pleasure

Finland's low income inequality, high social support, freedom to make decisions, and low levels of corruption are factors that contribute to the country's happiness.

Income Equality

Finland's reliable and affordable public transportation, efficient healthcare system, and emphasis on communal well-being contribute to the overall quality of life and happiness in the country.

Quality of Life

9 People Dead And 78 Hospitalized After Eating Sea Turtle Meat In Africa

9 People Dead And 78 Hospitalized After Eating Sea Turtle Meat In Africa

Multiple media outlets are reporting that nine people, including eight children, have died, and at least 78 others have been hospitalized on Pemba Island in the Zanzibar archipelago.

They reportedly felt sick after consuming sea turtle meat, which is considered a favorite food in the region. 

The deaths were confirmed by African officials and are caused by chelonitoxism, a rare and potentially fatal form of food poisoning caused by eating marine turtles. 

The exact species of sea turtle consumed and the date of the first reported illness or death are not yet known.

Authorities have launched a disaster management team to advise against consuming sea turtles.

This incident follows a similar event in November 2021 when seven people died and three were hospitalized after consuming turtle meat on Pemba Island.

6 Places to Visit in Alabama: The Ultimate Travel Guide

6 Places to Visit in Alabama: The Ultimate Travel Guide

When thinking about traveling in the United States, some might not think about Alabama. However, this Southern state has a lot to offer, even though many people might not know about it.

Alabama is called "the beautiful" for a reason. It has lovely beaches along the Gulf Coast and interesting historical places like the Civil Rights Memorial in Montgomery.

If you're interested in exploring this charming Southern state, here are some of the best places to visit in Alabama to enjoy your trip to the fullest.

1. Birmingham

Birmingham is a vibrant city with a rich history and plenty of things to see and do.

You can visit the Birmingham Civil Rights Institute to learn about the city's role in the Civil Rights Movement or explore the Birmingham Museum of Art to see some amazing artwork. Don't forget to check out the delicious barbecue restaurants in the city - they're famous for a reason!

If you love the beach, Orange Beach is the place to be. With its white sandy shores and crystal clear waters, it's the perfect spot for relaxing in the sun or enjoying water activities like kayaking and paddleboarding.

2. Orange Beach

There are also plenty of great seafood restaurants along the beach where you can try some local dishes.

3. Gulf Shores

Just a short drive from Orange Beach, Gulf Shores is another fantastic beach destination in Alabama. You can spend your days sunbathing, swimming, and exploring the nearby Gulf State Park.

If you're a nature lover, don't miss the chance to spot some wildlife at the Bon Secour National Wildlife Refuge.

4. Montgomery

Montgomery is the capital city of Alabama and is full of history and culture.

You can visit the Rosa Parks Museum to learn about the Civil Rights Movement, or explore the Alabama State Capitol building to see where important decisions are made. Make sure to also check out the delicious Southern food in the city - you won't be disappointed!

Huntsville is known for its history of space exploration, so if you're a science buff, this is the place for you. Visit the U.S. Space & Rocket Center to learn all about the history of space travel, or explore the beautiful botanical gardens in the city.

5. Huntsville

Huntsville also has a vibrant arts scene, so make sure to check out some local galleries and theaters.

6. Dauphin Island

If you're looking for a peaceful and relaxing getaway, Dauphin Island is the perfect spot.

This small barrier island is home to beautiful beaches, nature trails, and plenty of opportunities for birdwatching. You can also visit the Dauphin Island Sea Lab to learn about the marine life in the area.

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
Grounded 2 Video Game Will Be Released This July?

Obsidian Entertainment has officially announced Grounded 2, the highly anticipated sequel to their popular survival game, during the Xbox Games Showcase 2025.

The upcoming game will enter Xbox Game Preview and Steam Early Access on July 29, 2025, allowing players to jump in early and help shape the game's development with their feedback.

Grounded 2 expands on the original’s concept of miniaturized survival, this time set in a much larger and vibrant new environment called Brookhollow Park, a suburban wilderness set in 1992.

The starting area alone is nearly as large as the entire backyard map from the first game.

Players will once again face off against giant insects and other creatures, but with new gameplay features such as taming, riding, and fighting alongside bugs like ants and spiders, each with unique abilities.

The game supports both first- and third-person perspectives and offers single-player as well as cooperative multiplayer modes.

Players can craft weapons and armor, build bases, and explore the expansive open world.

New tools and combat options include shields, knives, bows, and mounted combat on bug mounts, adding fresh dynamics to the survival experience.

Grounded 2 will be coming to Xbox Game Preview and Steam Early Access on July 29, 2025. Play it day one with Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass.

FULL TRAILER: https://t.co/bazpu8H3Cq pic.twitter.com/RFq5gpPZOb

— Grounded (@GroundedTheGame) June 8, 2025

Grounded 2 will launch on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox on PC, and Steam for $29.99 USD, and will be available from day one on Xbox Game Pass, including Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass.

Early access will be available on Xbox and PC, and will be accessible at no extra cost if you already have a Game Pass subscription.

The first Grounded game has been ported to PS5 and Switch, so it's likely that Grounded 2 will end up on them eventually, just not when its early access goes live in July.

The game supports Xbox Play Anywhere, enabling cross-save and cross-play between Xbox consoles and PC at no additional cost. 

Obsidian Entertainment is collaborating with Eidos Montreal to deliver a bigger and bolder game, building on the success of the original Grounded, which has sold millions of copies since its early access release in 2020. 

With its blend of nostalgia, expanded gameplay mechanics, and community-driven development, Grounded 2 is poised to be a standout survival adventure for fans and newcomers alike when it arrives later this summer.

Lionel Messi Birthday: Profile of The Football GOAT

Argentina's national team star and the main actor in Inter Miami's progress to the round of 16 of the FIFA Club World Cup, Lionel Messi is celebrating his birthday! The 8-time Ballon d'Or winner and former FC Barcelona player is officially 38 years old!

Lionel Andrés "Leo" Messi, born 24 June 1987, is an Argentine professional footballer who currently plays as a forward and captains the Argentina national team.

He is widely regarded as one of the greatest footballers of all time.

Brilliant Achievements and Impressive Career

Messi has won numerous individual awards, including a record eight Ballon d'Or and has been named FIFA World Player of the Year eight times.

He played a key role in Argentina's success in winning the 2021 Copa América, the 2022 Finalissima and the 2022 FIFA World Cup – ending Argentina's 36-year wait for a title. He also won the 2024 Copa América.

His illustrious club career was largely spent with FC Barcelona, ​​where he won numerous titles, including ten La Liga titles, seven Copa del Reys and four UEFA Champions Leagues.

He holds numerous La Liga records, including being the all-time top scorer. After leaving Barcelona, ​​he joined Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) before eventually joining Inter Miami.

At a young age, Messi showed great talent and joined FC Barcelona at the age of 13.

He quickly rose through the ranks and made his unofficial debut at the age of 16.

In the 2008-2009 season, he helped Barcelona achieve the treble winners (winning La Liga, Copa del Rey, and Champions League).

Messi is also known for his high goal productivity and his abilities as a playmaker.

Personal Life and Business Off the Field

Messi has been an Adidas ambassador since 2006.

He launched his own clothing line and opened his first retail store, the Messi Store, in Barcelona in 2019.

While playing for Inter Miami, Lionel Messi even launched his own energy drink brand called "Mas+ by Messi" in 2023.

In addition, it was also reported that after his tenure at Inter Miami ended, he had the option to become an owner of the club.

Lionel Messi is a global football icon, known for his incredible ability, impressive record, and huge influence on and off the pitch.

He is one of the most talented and successful players in the history of football.

7 Thrilling Jet Li Action Movies to Get Your Heart Racing

7 Thrilling Jet Li Action Movies to Get Your Heart Racing

Jet Li is a martial arts legend known for his thrilling action movies that are sure to get your heart racing.

Whether you're a hardcore fan of martial arts films or just looking for some excitement, these movies will not disappoint. Here are seven Jet Li action movies that you should definitely check out:

1. Fearless (2006)

(Available on: Vudu and Apple TV)

Fearless

Fearless tells the story of Huo Yuanjia, a martial arts master who overcomes personal tragedy to become a legendary fighter. Filled with intense fight scenes and powerful emotional moments, this movie will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.

2. Shaolin Temple (1982)

(Available on: Amazon Prime Video and Peacock)

Shaolin Temple 

In Shaolin Temple, Jet Li plays a young martial artist who joins the famous Shaolin Monastery to learn kung fu. With jaw-dropping fight choreography and an inspiring story of perseverance and self-discovery, this classic film is a must-watch for any martial arts enthusiast.

3. Once Upon a Time in China (1991)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Once Upon a Time in China

Set in late 19th-century China, Once Upon a Time in China follows the adventures of martial arts master Wong Fei-hung as he fights against foreign invaders and corrupt officials. With breathtaking action sequences and a deep exploration of Chinese history and culture, this movie is both thrilling and educational.

4. Once Upon a Time in China II (1992)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Once Upon a Time in China II

The sequel to Once Upon a Time in China, this film continues the saga of Wong Fei-hung as he faces new challenges and enemies. Featuring even more spectacular fight scenes and a gripping storyline, this movie is a worthy follow-up to the original.

5. Hero (2002)

(Available on: Vudu, Amazon Prime Video, and Apple TV)

Hero

6 Most Difficult Zodiac Signs to Move On: Obsession and Overcoming Your Ex

Moving on from a past relationship can be challenging for many people.

However, for some individuals, letting go of an ex-partner can be extremely difficult due to their zodiac sign traits. In astrology, certain signs are known for their intense emotions, strong passions, and difficulty moving on from past relationships. Here, we will explore the six most difficult zodiac signs to move on from.

Difficult Zodiac Signs to Move On

1. Gemini

Starting off the list is Gemini. Geminis are known for their dual nature, which can make it hard for them to let go of a past love fully. They tend to overthink and analyze their feelings, leading to a prolonged process of moving on.

Next up is Cancer. Cancers are known for their deep emotional connections and loyalty. Once they form a bond with someone, it can be hard for them to break that connection, even if the relationship has ended. Cancers may struggle with letting go and moving on from a past love.

2. Cancer

Libras are next on the list. Libras value harmony and balance in relationships. These features can make it difficult for them to accept when a relationship has come to an end. They may hold onto hope for reconciliation, making moving on from their ex-partner challenging.

3. Libra

Scorpios are known for their intense emotions and passion, which can make it hard for them to let go of a past relationship. They may become obsessed with the thoughts of their ex-partner, leading to difficulty moving on.

4. Scorpio

5. Virgo

Virgos are next on the list. Virgos are known for their analytical nature and attention to detail. They may struggle to let go of a past relationship because they overanalyze the situation and hold onto memories of the past. Their traits make it challenging for them to move on.

Lastly, Pisces rounds out the list. Pisces are known for their romantic and sensitive nature, which can make it hard for them to move on from a past love. They may hold onto emotions and memories of the relationship. These characteristics make it difficult for them to let go and move forward.

6. Pisces

7 Best Real-Time Strategy Games to Play on Your PC

7 Best Real-Time Strategy Games to Play on Your PC

The Best RTS Games for PC

Real-time strategy games are a popular genre among PC gamers, offering exciting gameplay where players must think quickly and strategically in order to outmaneuver their opponents. If you're looking for some great real-time strategy games to play on your PC, here are some top picks that you should definitely check out:

1. Company of Heroes 3

Company of Heroes 3 is the latest installment in the critically acclaimed series, offering intense World War II battles with stunning graphics and immersive gameplay. Command your troops on the battlefield and use strategy to overcome your enemies in this epic RTS game.

2. Age of Empires II Definitive Edition

Age of Empires II is a classic RTS game that has been remastered and updated for modern PCs. Build your empire, train your army, and conquer your enemies in this timeless strategy game that has stood the test of time.

3. Stellaris

Stellaris is a grand strategy game set in space, where you must explore, expand, exploit, and exterminate in order to dominate the galaxy. With deep strategic gameplay and endless customization options, Stellaris offers a truly immersive experience for fans of the genre.

4. Age Of Empires 4

Age of Empires 4 is the highly anticipated sequel to the beloved RTS series, bringing new civilizations, units, and gameplay mechanics to the table. Lead your empire to victory in epic battles against AI or other players in this exciting new chapter of the Age of Empires saga.

5. Crusader Kings 3

Crusader Kings 3 is a unique real time strategy game that focuses on dynasty building and medieval politics. Manage your family, expand your territory, and form alliances to secure your legacy in this captivating game that offers a fresh take on the genre.

6. Wargame: Red Dragon

Wargame: Red Dragon is a realistic RTS game set during the Cold War era, where players must command their armies in intense battles across realistic landscapes.

With a focus on tactics and strategy, Wargame: Red Dragon offers a challenging and immersive gameplay experience for fans of military strategy games.

7. Command and Conquer: Red Alert 2

Command and Conquer: Red Alert 2 is a classic RTS game that has stood the test of time, offering fast-paced gameplay and intense battles set in an alternate history World War II.

With iconic units and buildings, Command and Conquer: Red Alert 2 remains a fan favorite among RTS gamers.

How To Deactivate Instagram Account on Mobile Apps and Computer

Are you considering taking a break from Instagram? Wondering how to deactivate your Instagram account? You're not alone.

How To Deactivate Instagram Account on Mobile Apps and Computer

Many people find themselves needing a break from social media for various reasons. Whether it's to focus on personal well-being, take a digital detox, or simply step back from the online world for a while, deactivating your Instagram account can provide a much-needed respite.

Understanding how to deactivate your Instagram account is essential for anyone looking to step away from the platform temporarily. It's a straightforward process that allows you to take a break without losing your account data.

In this guide, we'll walk you through the steps to temporarily hide your profile and content from the platform. Whether you're using Instagram on your phone, computer, or mobile browser, we've got you covered. We made this guide on Tuesday (2/4/2024).

Why You May Want to Deactivate Your Instagram Account

Taking a break from Instagram can be beneficial for several reasons. First and foremost, it allows you to prioritize your mental health and well-being. Constantly scrolling through feeds, comparing oneself to others, and seeking validation through likes and comments can take a toll on one's self-esteem and overall happiness.

Deactivating your Instagram account provides a much-needed break from these pressures, allowing you to focus on yourself and your real-life relationships.

Moreover, deactivating your Instagram account can help you regain control over your time and productivity. The endless scrolling and the addictive nature of social media can consume hours of your day, leaving you feeling unproductive and drained. By taking a break from Instagram, you free up time to pursue other interests, hobbies, and activities that bring you joy and fulfillment.

Another reason to deactivate your Instagram account is to protect your privacy and digital footprint. In today's digital age, concerns about online privacy and data security are more prevalent than ever. This step ensures that your personal information, photos, and activities are no longer accessible to the public or third-party advertisers.

A. How to Deactivate Instagram Account on Android App

1. Tap on the profile button or your profile picture located in the bottom right corner to navigate to your profile page.

2. Next, tap on the three vertical lines button, also known as "more options," in the top right corner.

3. From the menu that appears, tap on "Accounts Centre," and then tap on "Personal details."

4. Now, tap on "Account ownership and control," followed by tapping on "Deactivation or deletion."

5. Tap on the account you wish to temporarily deactivate from the list displayed.

6. After selecting the account, tap on "Deactivate account," and then tap "Continue" to proceed.

7. You'll be prompted to re-enter your password for security reasons. Enter your password and tap "Continue."

8. Next, select the reason for deactivating your account from the options provided, and then tap "Continue."

9. Finally, tap on "Deactivate account" to confirm your decision.

B. How to Deactivate Instagram Account on iOS App

1. Tap on the profile button or your profile picture located in the bottom right corner to navigate to your profile page.

2. Next, tap on the three vertical lines button, also known as "more options," in the top right corner.

3. From the menu that appears, tap on "Accounts Centre," and then tap on "Personal details."

4. Now, tap on "Account ownership and control," followed by tapping on "Deactivation or deletion."

5. Tap on the account you wish to temporarily deactivate from the list displayed.

6. After selecting the account, tap on "Deactivate account," and then tap "Continue" to proceed.

7. You'll be prompted to re-enter your password for security reasons. Enter your password and tap "Continue."

8. Next, select the reason for deactivating your account from the options provided, and then tap "Continue."

9. Finally, tap on "Deactivate account" to confirm your decision.

C. How to Deactivate Instagram Account on Computer

1. Log into the Instagram account you want to deactivate.

2. Tap on the More menu button located at the bottom left corner of the screen.

3. Select "Settings" from the menu.

4. Tap on "Accounts Centre," then choose "Personal details."

5. Next, tap on "Account ownership and control," and then select "Deactivation or deletion."

6. Choose the account you wish to temporarily deactivate.

7. Tap on "Deactivate account," then select "Continue" to proceed.

8. You'll be prompted to re-enter your password for security purposes. Enter your password and tap "Continue."

9. Select the reason for deactivating your account from the options provided, then tap "Continue."

10. Finally, tap on "Deactivate account" to confirm.

D. How to Deactivate Instagram Account from Mobile Browser

1. Sign in to the Instagram account you want to deactivate.

2. Tap on your profile picture located in the bottom right corner to access your profile.

3. Tap on "Settings" at the top of the screen.

4. From the dropdown menu, tap on "Accounts Centre," then select "Personal details."

5. Next, tap on "Account ownership and control," and then tap "Deactivation or deletion."

6. Choose the account you wish to temporarily deactivate from the list displayed.

7. Tap on "Deactivate account," and then tap "Continue" to proceed.

8. You'll be asked to re-enter your password for security purposes. Enter your password and tap "Continue."

9. Select the reason for deactivating your account from the options provided, then tap "Continue."

10. Finally, tap on "Deactivate account" to confirm your decision.

Conclusion

These are the guide on how to deactivate Instagram account temporarily from various platforms.

Remember, deactivating your Instagram account is a temporary measure, and you can reactivate it at any time simply by logging back in with your credentials. Your profile and content will be restored as if nothing happened, allowing you to pick up right where you left off. It's a straightforward process that gives you the flexibility to take breaks from the platform whenever you need.
However, it's important to note that Instagram allows users to deactivate their accounts only once per week. So, if you choose to deactivate your account and then reactivate it, you'll need to wait at least a week before deactivating it again.

Whether you're deactivating your account for a short break or considering a more permanent hiatus, knowing how to deactivate and reactivate your Instagram account gives you control over your online presence. So, take care of yourself and your digital well-being, and remember that you can always come back whenever you're ready.

Carl Jung Quotes: 40 Inspirational and Insightful Words from the Famous Psychologist

Carl Jung Quotes: 40 Inspirational and Insightful Words from the Famous Psychologist

Have you ever stumbled upon Carl Jung quotes and found yourself intrigued by their depth? Carl Jung, a renowned Swiss psychiatrist and psychoanalyst, left behind a treasure trove of wisdom encapsulated in his quotes. But who exactly was Carl Jung?

Born in 1875, Jung delved into the depths of the human mind like an explorer navigating uncharted territories. His groundbreaking work revolutionized the field of psychology, earning him a place among the most influential thinkers of the 20th century.

Carl Jung's quotes offer profound insights into the human mind, often exploring themes of the unconscious mind, archetypes, and individuation. Through his extensive research and clinical practice, Jung developed concepts that continue to resonate with scholars and seekers alike.

In this article, we will share some of the best Carl Jung quotes, collected from various sources, Wednesday (18/4/2024). Through his insightful quotes, we will uncover the wisdom of a visionary mind whose words transcend time and speak directly to the heart of the human experience.

Insightful Carl Jung Quotes about Self-Discovery

1. "The world will ask you who you are, and if you don't know, the world will tell you."

2. "The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are."

3. "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves."

4. "Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people."

5. "Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes."

6. "You are what you do, not what you say you'll do."

7. "I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become."

8. "The most terrifying thing is to accept oneself completely."

9. "Whatever is rejected from the self, appears in the world as an event."

10. "Do not compare, do not measure. No other way is like yours. All other ways deceive and tempt you. You must fulfill the way that is in you."

B. Inspirational Carl Jung Quotes

1. "We cannot change anything until we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses."

2. "The creation of something new is not accomplished by the intellect but by the play instinct acting from inner necessity. The creative mind plays with the objects it loves."

3. "It all depends on how we look at things, and not how they are in themselves."

4. "A man who has not passed through the inferno of his passions has never overcome them."

5. "Man needs difficulties; they are necessary for health."

6. "Often the hands will solve a mystery that the intellect has struggled with in vain."

7. "The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it."

8. "There is no birth of consciousness without pain."

9. "Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not. "

10. "One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious."

11. "No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell."

12. "Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate."

13. "Where wisdom reigns, there is no conflict between thinking and feeling."

14. "The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases."

15. "The difference between a good life and a bad life is how well you walk through the fire."

C. More Famous Carl Jung Quotes

1. "The foundation of all mental illness is the unwillingness to experience legitimate suffering."

2. "The first half of life is devoted to forming a healthy ego, the second half is going inward and letting go of it."

3. "Everyone you meet knows something you don't know but need to know. Learn from them."

4. "Wisdom accepts that all things have two sides."

5. "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed."

7. "It is a fact that cannot be denied: the wickedness of others becomes our own wickedness because it kindles something evil in our own hearts."

8. "The man who promises everything is sure to fulfil nothing, and everyone who promises too much is in danger of using evil means in order to carry out his promises, and is already on the road to perdition."

9. "The greatest and most important problems of life are all fundamentally insoluble. They can never be solved but only outgrown."

10. "We should not pretend to understand the world only by the intellect. The judgement of the intellect is only part of the truth."

11. "There is no such thing as a pure introvert or extrovert. Such a person would be in the lunatic asylum."
