-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: This article talk about what causes global warming, why it is matters to us, and how to stop it.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_keywords: what causes global warming,global warming,climate change
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
What Causes Global Warming: 5 Major Causes and How to Stop It

Today, we celebrate Earth Day. As we honor our planet, many of us notice changes in our environment. Have you noticed that summers are getting hotter? Or that storms are becoming stronger? These changes happen because of global warming. What causes global warming is a question many people ask as they see these changes in weather patterns around the world.

Global warming affects everyone on Earth. It changes how we live, the food we grow, and the water we drink. What causes global warming is mainly human activities that release certain gases into the air. These gases trap heat from the sun and make the Earth warmer.

So, what causes global warming? In this article, we will talk about what global warming is, its causes, why it matters to us, and how to stop it. We gathered the information from various sources, Tuesday (22/4/2025).

What is Global Warming?

Global warming is the slow increase in Earth's temperature over time. Since the 1800s, our planet has become about 1.1°C (2°F) warmer. This may not seem like much, but even small changes in temperature can cause big problems for our planet.

When we talk about global warming, we mean the heating of Earth's surface, oceans, and air. This happens when certain gases in the air trap heat from the sun. These gases work like a blanket around Earth, keeping heat close to the surface instead of letting it go back into space.

Global warming is part of climate change. While global warming refers to rising temperatures, climate change includes all the effects that come from these higher temperatures. These effects include changes in rainfall, more extreme weather events, melting ice, and rising sea levels.

What Causes Global Warming?

Global warming happens because of certain human activities that release greenhouse gases into the air. These gases trap heat from the sun, making our planet warmer over time. Here are the main causes of global warming:

1. Burning Fossil Fuels

The main cause of global warming is the burning of fossil fuels like coal, oil, and natural gas. When we burn these fuels to make electricity, run cars, or heat buildings, they release carbon dioxide (CO2) into the air. Carbon dioxide is the most common greenhouse gas that traps heat in our atmosphere.

2. Deforestation

Deforestation is another major cause of global warming. Trees absorb carbon dioxide from the air. When forests are cut down or burned, this carbon dioxide goes back into the air. Also, fewer trees means less carbon dioxide is removed from the atmosphere.

3. Agriculture

Agriculture contributes to global warming in several ways. Cows and sheep produce a gas called methane during digestion. Methane is a powerful greenhouse gas. Farming also uses large machines that burn fuel and release carbon dioxide. Some fertilizers release another greenhouse gas called nitrous oxide.

4. Transportation

Transportation is a big source of greenhouse gases. Cars, trucks, planes, and ships mostly run on gasoline or diesel fuel. When these vehicles burn fuel, they release carbon dioxide. More people and more travel mean more greenhouse gases in the air.

5. Industrial Processes

Industrial processes also cause global warming. Factories that make cement, steel, chemicals, and other products use a lot of energy. This energy often comes from burning fossil fuels. Some industrial processes also directly release greenhouse gases.

Why Global Warming is Dangerous

Global warming creates many dangers for our planet and all living things. Here are the main risks:

1. Heat Waves and Health Problems

Global warming leads to higher temperatures across the world. These higher temperatures cause heat waves that can harm human health. Heat-related illnesses increase, and outdoor work becomes more difficult. Wildfires also start more easily and spread faster when conditions are hot.

2. Extreme Weather Events

Rising temperatures cause more severe storms and floods in many regions. As the air gets warmer, it holds more moisture. This leads to heavier rainfall and more destructive storms. Hurricanes, typhoons, and cyclones become stronger as ocean temperatures rise.

3. Water Scarcity and Flooding

Water problems increase with global warming. Some areas face more droughts as higher temperatures dry out the soil. Other places get too much rain at once, causing floods. These changes affect the water we drink and the food we grow.

4. Rising Sea Levels

The ocean suffers greatly from global warming. As the ocean gets warmer, its water expands and takes up more space. This, along with melting ice from glaciers, makes sea levels rise. Higher sea levels threaten coastal cities and islands. The ocean also absorbs carbon dioxide, which makes it more acidic and harms marine life.

5. Biodiversity Loss

Plants and animals face serious dangers from global warming. Many species cannot adapt quickly enough to changing conditions. Some are moving to new areas, while others may disappear forever. Scientists estimate that up to one million species could face extinction in the coming decades due to climate change.

6. Food Insecurity

Global warming affects food production around the world. Higher temperatures, changing rainfall patterns, and extreme weather events can damage crops and reduce harvests. Some regions may no longer be able to grow the crops they traditionally produced. This leads to food shortages and higher food prices, especially in poorer countries.

7. Spread of Diseases

As temperatures rise, disease-carrying insects like mosquitoes and ticks can survive in new areas. This leads to the spread of diseases such as malaria, dengue fever, and Lyme disease to regions where they were not common before. Warmer weather can also help harmful bacteria grow faster in food and water.

8. Economic Damage

The effects of global warming cause huge economic costs. Damage from storms, floods, and wildfires destroys homes and businesses. Agricultural losses, health impacts, and the need to adapt infrastructure all require massive spending. These costs will increase as global warming continues.

How to Stop Global Warming

There are many actions we can take to help stop global warming. Here are some important steps:

1. Reduce Fossil Fuel Use

Reducing fossil fuel use is the most important step to stop global warming. We can switch to clean energy sources like solar and wind power. Using less energy at home by turning off lights and appliances when not needed also helps. Energy-efficient appliances and vehicles use less power and produce fewer greenhouse gases.

2. Protect and Plant Trees

Protecting forests is vital in the fight against global warming. Trees absorb carbon dioxide, so planting more trees and preventing deforestation helps reduce greenhouse gases in the air. Supporting organizations that work to preserve forests is a good way to help.

3. Change Transportation Habits

Changing how we travel can make a big difference. Using public transportation, carpooling, walking, or biking reduces the amount of greenhouse gases from vehicles. When buying a car, choosing one with good fuel efficiency or an electric vehicle helps reduce emissions.

4. Support Sustainable Agriculture

Supporting sustainable agriculture practices helps limit greenhouse gases from farming. Eating more plant-based foods and less meat, especially beef, can reduce methane emissions. Buying locally grown food also helps because it doesn't need to be transported as far.

5. Reduce, Reuse, Recycle

Everyone can take part in reducing waste. Recycling paper, glass, and plastic reduces the need to make new materials, which requires energy. Reusing items instead of throwing them away and composting food waste also helps limit greenhouse gas emissions.

6. Support Climate-Friendly Policies

Supporting policies that address global warming is important. This includes voting for leaders who take climate change seriously and supporting laws that limit greenhouse gas emissions. Raising awareness about global warming and its causes helps more people understand the problem and take action.

Top 5 Spots For Street Food Hunting In Manila

Manila, the vibrant capital of the Philippines, is a city that never sleeps, and its streets are a treasure trove of delicious and affordable street food. From sizzling skewers of barbecued meat to savory snacks that will satisfy your taste buds, Manila's street food scene is a culinary journey like no other.

Top 5 Spots For Street Food Hunting In Manila

In this article, we will take you on a journey to uncover some of the best spots for street food hunting in Manila. These spots are a paradise for foodies who want to take a peek at the Philippines' rich culinary heritage.

(Photo by Lyman Hansel Gerona on Unsplash)

1. Ugbo Street

Located in the district of Tondo, Ugbo Street is known as the culinary hub in Manila. It is a popular spot for street food, especially at night.

You can find a wide variety of dishes here, from grilled meats and seafood to Filipino specialties like isaw (grilled intestines) and kwek kwek (deep-fried quail eggs).

It's definitely one of the best street food spots in Manila.

© 2023 trstdly.com

2. Concepcion Market

Concepcion Market is a famous street food spot in the city of Malabon, Metro Manila. One of the must-try treats here is the famous "pancit malabon," a flavorful noodle dish known for its thick, savory sauce and fresh seafood toppings. If you're in the mood for something savory, be sure to try "kakanin," a variety of sweet and sticky rice cakes that come in different flavors and colors.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Have fun, Juan! (@morefunwithjuan)

3. Binondo

If you carving for Chinese-style dishes, you should go to Binondo. Binondo is the Chinatown district of Manila and one of the oldest in the world. Just like any other Chinatown, the food here is amazing. (Photo by Michael Buillerey on Unsplash)

Just like any other Chinatown, the food here is amazing. One of the most iconic dishes to try here is the "siopao," a fluffy steamed bun stuffed with flavorful meats or sweet fillings. Another must-try is the "tikoy," a chewy rice cake that's especially popular during Chinese New Year celebrations.

© 2023 trstdly.com

4. Quiapo Market

Quiapo Market is an old public market that has a long connection to the Philippines' culinary heritage. (Screenshot Youtube @Mark Wiens)

As you explore this lively market, you will find a diverse range of delicious street foods.

From smokey barbecue to tasty desserts, you can find any food to satisfy your hunger and taste buds.

© 2023 trstdly.com

5. Sabroso Street Food Market

The Sabroso Street Food Market is located in Mandaluyong City, Manila. It's considered one of the havens for foodies in the city. One of the most iconic dishes you should try in this place is Isaw. It's Filipino grilled or barbecued pork or chicken intestines. (Photo Instagram @sabrosostreetfoodmarketph)

Don't forget to try kwek kwek or deep-fried quail eggs coated in orange batter.
(Photo: Facebook Sabroso Street Food Garden)

Mastering the “How Do You Handle Criticism?” Interview Question: A Comprehensive Guide

When you go for a job interview, you might be asked, “How do you handle criticism?” This question is important. Employers want to know if you can take feedback well and use it to get better at your job.

In this article, we will help you understand this question and show you how to answer it well.

Understanding the Question

When an interviewer asks how you handle criticism, they want to know a few things:

• Can you listen to feedback without getting upset?

• Do you learn from criticism and try to improve?

• Can you work well with others, even when they point out your mistakes?

• Are you open to new ideas and ways of doing things?

They ask this because good workers can take feedback and use it to do better. It’s not just about how you feel when someone criticizes you. It’s about what you do with that information.

Importance of Handling Criticism

Being able to handle criticism well is very important at work. Here’s why:

• It helps you grow and get better at your job

• It shows you can work well with others

• It helps create a good work environment where people can share ideas

• It makes you more flexible and able to change when needed

• It shows you’re professional and mature

Employers like workers who can take criticism well because it usually means they’re easier to work with and can improve over time.

Preparing Your Answer

To answer this question well, you should think about it before your interview. Here are some steps to help you prepare:

1. Think about times when you received criticism at work or school

2. Remember how you felt and what you did

3. Think about what you learned from those experiences

4. Come up with a clear way to explain how you handle criticism now

It’s good to have a real example ready to share. This makes your answer more believable and interesting.

Using the STAR Method

The STAR method is a good way to answer interview questions. It stands for Situation, Task, Action, and Result. Here’s how to use it for this question:

• Situation: Describe a time when you received criticism

• Task: Explain what you needed to do in response

• Action: Tell what you did to handle the criticism

• Result: Share how things turned out and what you learned

Using this method helps you give a clear, organized answer that shows how you handle criticism in real situations.

Sample Answers

Here are some good ways to answer the question:

Example 1: “I try to listen carefully when someone gives me feedback. I don’t get defensive. Instead, I ask questions to understand better. Then, I think about how I can use the feedback to improve. For example, my boss once told me my reports were too long. I asked for more details and learned how to make them shorter and clearer. This helped me do better at my job.”

Example 2: “I see criticism as a chance to learn and get better. When I get feedback, I write it down. Then I make a plan to work on the things that need improvement. I also like to follow up later to see if I’m doing better. This has helped me grow a lot in my career.”

These answers show that you’re open to feedback, willing to learn, and able to make positive changes.

What to Avoid

When answering this question, don’t say things like:

• “I don’t like criticism and try to avoid it.”

• “I get upset when people criticize me.”

• “I argue with people who give me feedback.”

• “I ignore criticism because I think I’m always right.”

These kinds of answers make you look like you’re hard to work with and unwilling to improve. They can hurt your chances of getting the job.

Demonstrating a Growth Mindset

A growth mindset means believing you can improve and learn new things. When answering how you handle criticism, it’s good to show you have this mindset. You can do this by:

• Talking about how you see criticism as a chance to learn

• Mentioning times when feedback helped you improve

• Showing enthusiasm for learning and getting better

• Explaining how you set goals based on feedback

For example, you could say: “I always try to learn from criticism. Once, a coworker pointed out that my presentations were a bit boring. Instead of feeling bad, I took a public speaking class. My presentations got much better, and I even started enjoying giving them more.”

Active Listening Skills

Active listening is very important when receiving criticism. It means really paying attention to what someone is saying, not just waiting for your turn to talk. When answering the interview question, you can show your active listening skills by:

• Mentioning that you give the person your full attention

• Explaining how you ask questions to understand better

• Talking about how you repeat back what you heard to make sure you understood

• Describing how you take notes during feedback sessions

You might say something like: “When I receive criticism, I make sure to listen carefully. I don’t interrupt, and I ask questions to clarify anything I’m not sure about. This helps me understand the feedback fully and shows respect to the person giving it.”

Emotional Intelligence in Handling Criticism

Emotional intelligence means understanding and managing your emotions well. It’s very helpful when dealing with criticism. In your answer, you can show emotional intelligence by:

• Talking about how you stay calm when receiving criticism

• Explaining how you recognize your initial feelings but don’t act on them right away

• Describing how you try to understand the other person’s point of view

• Mentioning how you manage any negative feelings in a healthy way

For instance: “When I first hear criticism, I might feel a bit defensive. But I’ve learned to pause and take a deep breath. This helps me listen objectively and respond professionally. I remind myself that the person is trying to help me improve, not attack me personally.”

Differentiating Constructive Criticism

It’s important to know the difference between helpful criticism and unhelpful criticism. In your answer, you can show that you understand this by:

• Explaining how you recognize constructive criticism

• Describing how you focus on the helpful parts of feedback

• Talking about how you handle criticism that isn’t constructive

• Mentioning how you ask for more specific feedback if it’s too general

You could say: “I always try to find the helpful parts in any criticism. If someone’s feedback is vague, I ask for specific examples. This helps me understand what I need to work on. If the criticism doesn’t seem constructive, I politely ask for more details or suggestions for improvement.”

Self-Reflection and Improvement

After receiving criticism, it’s important to think about it and plan how to improve. When answering the interview question, you can talk about your self-reflection process:

• Describe how you take time to think about the feedback

• Explain how you look at your own behavior objectively

• Talk about how you decide what changes to make

• Mention how you set goals for improvement

For example: “After receiving criticism, I always take some time to think about it. I try to look at my actions from an outside perspective. Then, I make a list of things I can do to improve. I set small, achievable goals to work on those areas.”

Implementing Feedback

It’s not enough to just listen to criticism – you need to show how you use it to get better. In your answer, explain how you put feedback into action:

• Talk about how you make a plan to address the criticism

• Describe how you break big changes into smaller steps

• Explain how you track your progress

• Mention how you ask for help or resources if needed

You might say: “When I get feedback, I make a clear plan to work on it. For example, when my manager said I needed to improve my time management, I started using a digital calendar and setting reminders. I also asked a colleague who’s great at time management for tips. After a month, I could see a big improvement in how I managed my tasks.”

Proactively Seeking Feedback

Showing that you actively look for feedback, not just wait for it, can impress interviewers. You can include this in your answer by:

• Talking about how you ask for feedback regularly

• Describing specific times when you’ve asked for criticism

• Explaining how you create opportunities for feedback

• Mentioning how you encourage others to be honest with you

For instance: “I don’t just wait for feedback – I ask for it. Every month, I schedule a short meeting with my supervisor to discuss my performance. I also ask my teammates for input after big projects. This helps me improve continuously and shows I’m committed to doing my best work.”

Using Criticism for Professional Development

Criticism can be a great tool for growing in your career. When answering the interview question, you can show how you use feedback for professional development:

• Explain how criticism helps you identify areas for growth

• Talk about how you’ve used feedback to learn new skills

• Describe how criticism has shaped your career goals

• Mention specific examples of how feedback led to professional achievements

You could say: “I see criticism as a valuable tool for my professional growth. For example, when a client mentioned that my designs weren’t very modern, I took an online course in current design trends. This not only improved my work but also sparked my interest in user experience design, which is now a key part of my career path.”

Effective Communication in Receiving Criticism

How you communicate when receiving criticism is just as important as how you feel about it. In your answer, highlight your communication skills:

• Talk about how you stay calm and professional when receiving feedback

• Explain how you ask for clarification without sounding defensive

• Describe how you express appreciation for the feedback

• Mention how you summarize what you’ve learned to ensure understanding

For example: “When receiving criticism, I make sure to stay calm and professional. I thank the person for their feedback and ask questions to fully understand their points. At the end of the conversation, I summarize what I’ve learned and discuss my next steps. This shows I value their input and am committed to improving.”

Building Positive Workplace Relationships

Handling criticism well can help you build better relationships at work. Include this aspect in your answer:

• Explain how accepting criticism helps create trust with coworkers and supervisors

• Talk about how you use feedback to improve teamwork

• Describe how handling criticism well has helped you resolve conflicts

• Mention how being open to feedback makes you a better leader or team member

You might say: “I’ve found that being open to criticism helps build strong relationships at work. When I show that I value my colleagues’ opinions and use their feedback to improve, it creates a positive atmosphere. This has helped me work better in teams and even resolve conflicts more easily.”

Handling Criticism Across Cultural Differences

In diverse workplaces, it’s important to understand that criticism might be given differently in various cultures. Show your awareness of this:

• Talk about how you’re sensitive to cultural differences in giving and receiving feedback

• Explain how you adapt your response to criticism based on cultural context

• Describe how you ask for clarification if you’re unsure about cultural norms

• Mention any experiences you’ve had with cross-cultural feedback

For instance: “I’m aware that different cultures have different ways of giving feedback. In my last job, I worked with team members from several countries. I learned to pay attention to both direct and indirect forms of criticism. If I’m unsure, I always ask for clarification to make sure I understand the feedback correctly.”

Non-Verbal Cues When Receiving Criticism

Your body language and tone of voice are important when receiving criticism. Include this in your answer:

• Explain how you maintain open body language when receiving feedback

• Talk about how you keep a neutral or positive facial expression

• Describe how you use your tone of voice to show you’re receptive

• Mention how you make eye contact to show you’re engaged

You could say: “When receiving criticism, I’m conscious of my non-verbal communication. I maintain eye contact, keep an open posture, and try to have a neutral or slightly positive expression. I also keep my tone of voice calm and interested. This helps the person giving feedback feel heard and respected.”

Following Up After Receiving Criticism

What you do after receiving criticism is just as important as how you receive it. Include this in your answer:

• Talk about how you follow up with the person who gave you feedback

• Explain how you report on your progress

• Describe how you ask for additional feedback as you improve

• Mention how you thank people for their input

For example: “After receiving criticism, I always make a point to follow up. I’ll update the person on my progress and ask if they’ve noticed improvement. This shows I took their feedback seriously and acted on it. It also opens the door for more feedback, which helps me continue improving.”

Turning Criticism into Learning Opportunities

Every piece of criticism can be a chance to learn something new. Show how you do this in your answer:

• Explain how you look for the lesson in every criticism

• Talk about how you’ve turned negative experiences into positive learning

• Describe how you share what you’ve learned with others

• Mention how learning from criticism has made you better at your job

You might say: “I always try to find the learning opportunity in criticism. Once, a client was unhappy with a report I wrote. Instead of getting discouraged, I asked for specific feedback and learned new ways to present data more clearly. I even shared these new techniques with my team, improving our overall work quality.”

Continuous Improvement Mindset

Showing that you’re always trying to get better can impress interviewers. Include this in your answer:

• Talk about how you see improvement as an ongoing process

• Explain how you regularly assess your own performance

• Describe how you stay updated in your field

• Mention how you use criticism as part of your continuous improvement

For instance: “I believe in always trying to improve. I regularly think about my work and look for ways to do better. I stay updated on new developments in my field and am always open to feedback. This helps me grow continuously in my career and bring more value to my team and organization.”

Conclusion

Answering the question “How do you handle criticism?” is a chance to show you’re a good worker who can learn and grow. Remember these key points:

• Show that you listen well and don’t get defensive

• Explain how you use criticism to improve

• Give a real example of a time you handled criticism well

• Talk about how you follow up and make changes

• Show that you’re always trying to learn and get better

By preparing a good answer to this question, you can show employers that you’re someone who can take feedback well and use it to do better at work. This can help you stand out in your interview and increase your chances of getting the job.

How to Tell if a Guy Likes You: 20 Signs and What You Need to Do

Dating can be confusing, especially when you're trying to figure out how someone feels about you. Learning how to tell if a guy likes you can help you understand where you stand with him. When a man is interested, he often shows his feelings through his actions, body language, and the way he communicates with you.

Have you ever wondered if that special guy is just being friendly or if there's something more? Maybe he texts you often, remembers small details about you, or seems nervous when you're around. These could be signs that he has feelings for you, but sometimes, it's hard to be sure without more information.

So, how to tell if a guy likes you? In this article, we will explore the most common signs that can help you understand if a guy likes you. We will look at both obvious and hidden signs of interest and give you advice on what to do (and what not to do) when you discover a guy has feelings for you. We wrote this guide on Saturday (12/4/2025).

How to Tell if a Guy Likes You

Here are 10 clear signs that can help you understand how to tell if a guy likes you:

1. He maintains eye contact - When he looks at you longer than normal and doesn't look away when you catch him staring, he's showing interest through his eyes and enjoying the visual connection.

2. He remembers small details - If he recalls your favorite song, the name of your childhood pet, or stories you shared weeks ago, he's paying special attention to everything you say.

3. He finds reasons to touch you - Casual touches like brushing your arm, fixing your hair, or sitting close enough that your knees touch show he wants physical connection without being too forward.

4. He texts you consistently - When he messages you throughout the day about random thoughts or sends good morning texts, he's making you a priority and keeping the connection alive.

5. He adjusts his schedule for you - A guy who rearranges his plans to spend time with you or always finds time in his busy week to see you is demonstrating that you're important to him.

6. He includes you in future plans - When he talks about concerts next month or trips next season with you in mind, he's mentally including you in his life beyond just the present moment.

7. He introduces you to important people - Meeting his close friends or family members is a significant step that shows he values you and wants you to be part of his wider social circle.

8. His body language is open around you - When he faces you directly, keeps his arms uncrossed, and leans toward you during conversations, his body is subconsciously expressing interest and engagement.

9. He offers help without being asked - If he volunteers to fix your computer, help you move furniture, or assist with problems you mention, he's looking for ways to be valuable in your life.

10. He shows genuine interest in your opinions - When he asks what you think about various topics and truly listens to your answers, he values your mind and wants to understand your perspective.

How to Tell if a Guy Secretly Likes You

When learning how to tell if a guy likes you secretly, look for these 10 subtle signs:

1. He acts nervous around you - If a usually confident guy suddenly stumbles over words, fidgets with his hands, or seems flustered in your presence, his hidden feelings might be causing this change.

2. His friends behave differently when you appear - When his friends give knowing smiles, tease him when you arrive, or suddenly leave you two alone, they likely know about his secret feelings for you.

3. He shows subtle jealousy - If he asks casual questions about other men in your life or his mood changes when you mention male friends, he may be hiding feelings of possessiveness.

4. He behaves differently one-on-one versus in groups - A notable shift in his personality, when you're alone together compared to group settings, might indicate he's more comfortable showing his true self privately.

5. He creates reasons to contact you - When he asks questions he likely knows the answers to or seeks your help with simple tasks, he's creating opportunities for interaction without revealing his intentions.

6. He engages with your social media - Consistent likes on your posts, especially on older content, suggests he's spending time looking through your profile due to his special interest in you.

7. He mirrors your body language subconsciously - If you notice him adopting similar postures, gestures, or speaking patterns as yours during conversations, his body is unconsciously trying to connect with you.

8. He finds your jokes unusually funny - When he laughs heartily at even your mediocre jokes or remembers funny comments you made weeks ago, he's emotionally connecting with your sense of humor.

9. He notices small changes in your appearance - Comments about your new hairstyle, different earrings, or subtle changes others miss show he's paying extraordinarily close attention to how you look.

10. He positions himself near you in group settings - If he consistently manages to end up sitting or standing next to you in gatherings without obvious effort, he's strategically placing himself in your vicinity.

What to Do When a Guy Likes You

When you discover a guy has feelings for you, here are 10 positive steps you can take:

1. Examine your own feelings first - Before responding to his interest, take time to understand what you truly feel about him. Knowing your own emotions will help you react honestly and avoid sending mixed signals.

2. Show similar interest back - If you like him too, respond with the same friendly signals by keeping eye contact, smiling when you see him, and showing you are happy in his presence to encourage him.

3. Initiate meaningful conversations - Take the initiative to start conversations about topics you both enjoy. Asking thoughtful questions shows you're interested in knowing him better and value his thoughts and opinions.

4. Suggest activities you both enjoy - Create opportunities to spend time together by proposing activities that match your shared interests. This provides natural settings for your connection to develop without pressure.

5. Be responsive to his messages - Show enthusiasm in your communications by responding to his texts in a timely manner. This positive feedback tells him his attention is welcome and encourages him to continue pursuing a connection.

6. Offer genuine compliments - Notice and comment on things you genuinely appreciate about him, whether it's his sense of humor, kindness to others, or talents. Specific compliments show thoughtful observation.

7. Create opportunities for one-on-one time - Spending time together without other friends around allows for deeper conversations and stronger connections. Accept his invitations or create situations where you can be alone together.

8. Be patient with developing feelings - Understand that everyone moves at different speeds in relationships. Give him space to express himself at his own pace, especially if he seems shy or has been hurt before.

9. Show interest in his life - Ask about his hobbies, work, family, and friends to demonstrate that you care about his whole life. Your genuine interest shows that you value him as a complete person.

10. Communicate openly but appropriately - While honesty is important, share your feelings at a pace that matches the relationship's development. Gradually increase emotional openness as trust and comfort grow between you.

Things You Shouldn't Do When a Guy Likes You

When discovering how to tell if a guy likes you and responding to his interest, avoid these 10 common mistakes:

1. Don't play mind games - Pretending disinterest when you're actually interested or vice versa creates unnecessary confusion. Such manipulation damages trust and prevents an authentic connection from forming naturally.

2. Avoid broadcasting his feelings to others - Telling friends or posting on social media about his interests can embarrass him, especially if he's private or shy. Respect his vulnerability by keeping his feelings confidential.

3. Don't compare him to previous partners - Each person is unique, so comparing him to exes or friends' partners creates unfair expectations. These comparisons can make him feel inadequate or that he's living in someone's shadow.

4. Don't lead him on - If you don't share his feelings, be honest rather than giving false hope. Being clear about just wanting friendship is kinder than letting him think there might be a chance for romance.

5. Never change your personality to please him - Pretending to like his interests or altering core aspects of yourself might work temporarily but isn't sustainable. Authentic connections only form when both people are being their genuine selves.

6. Don't rush the relationship timeline - Pushing for quick commitment or relationship labels before both of you are ready creates unnecessary pressure. Allow the connection to develop at a natural pace that feels comfortable for both parties.

7. Avoid testing his interest with tricks - Creating artificial scenarios to "test" his feelings or commitment is manipulative and destroys trust. Healthy relationships are built on honesty, not contrived loyalty tests.

8. Don't ignore relationship red flags - Being excited about his interest shouldn't blind you to concerning behaviors or incompatibilities. Pay attention to warning signs that indicate potential problems in a future relationship.

9. Avoid making assumptions about his intentions - Just because he shows interest doesn't automatically mean he wants a serious relationship. Don't project your desires onto his actions without clear communication about expectations.

10. Don't sacrifice your boundaries - Accommodating his every wish or neglecting your own needs to please him creates an unhealthy foundation. Maintain your personal boundaries and self-respect throughout your interactions.

5 Most Haunted Places In London

These places are famous for their spooky atmosphere and horror stories that will make you shivers. (Image by Peter H from Pixabay)

5 Most Haunted Places In London

London is a beautiful, lively city that is famous as one of the top tourist destinations in Europe. The city is full of many stunning landmarks, interesting museums, and shops that attract many tourists every year.

However, London has darker sides hidden behind its lively atmosphere. From cemeteries to old castles, these places are where mysterious things happen and scare many people. Some people, they try to stay away from these places because of their spooky atmosphere. However, there are no better places to explore than these places for ghosts and horror fans.

In this article, we make a list of some of the most haunted places in London, according to various sources, Friday (30/6/2023). If you are interested in horror stories, these places are perfect for you.

The Tower of London is one of the most famous haunted places throughout London. (Photo by It's No Game on Flickr/CC BY 2.0)

1. The Tower of London

Tower of London

The Tower of London is one of the most famous landmarks in London for two reasons. It's an old castle that is surrounded by dark history and mysteries. Many people claim the Tower of London is the most haunted place in London. According to the Travel Triangle, The Tower of London was used as a prison by Royal Family from 1100 to 1952. Many prisoners were tortured and executed in this prison.

There are many horror stories about this castle. The story says that the ghost of Guy Fawkes, a man who tried to kill King James I, is haunted by this building. Some said that they heard his scream coming from the Council Chamber. Some also claim that they saw the headless ghost of Anne Boleyn wandering around the castle. There's also a story of the ghosts of two little boys wearing nightshirts while holding hands appearing in the White Tower.

Highgate Cemetery is one of the biggest and most famous cemeteries in London. It's also surrounded by mysteries. (Photo by dilettantiquity on Flickr/CC BY-SA 2.0)

2. Highgate Cemetery

Highgate Cemetery

Highgate Cemetery is one of the biggest and most famous cemeteries in London. It's the place where the famous philosopher, Karl Marx, is buried. However, the cemetery is also famous as one of the most haunted places in London.

As quoted from the Authentic Vacations website, there's a story about the Highgate Vampire. It's said that the vampire has a tall and dark figure. The mysterious vampire often suddenly appeared, marked by a sudden drop in temperature. According to the website, there are also stories about ghostly cyclists or floating ghosts of a nun who appeared in Highgate Cemetery.

3. Hyde Park Pet Cemetery

Hyde Park is a big cemetery for pets. There are more than 300 pets buried in this cemetery. Hyde Park is very famous, especially among horror stories fans. According to the Royal Parks website, there's a story about a phantom carriage pulled by 4 ghostly horses. It is driven by a mysterious, white figure. The carriage runs around Hyde Park before disappearing mysteriously. Some people believe that the ghostly figure who rides the carriage is the ghost of King George IV. (Photo by Pedro Cambra on Flickr/CC BY 2.0)

Greenwich Foot Tunnel is an underground tunnel that crosses the River Thames. The Tunnel was built in 1899 and opened in 1902. According to the Insider website, the atmosphere in this tunnel is very spooky, especially after sunset. That's because the atmosphere in this tunnel was very quiet. Some people said that they saw a mysterious old couple dressed in Victorian clothes in this tunnel. (Photo by neiljs on Flickr/CC BY 2.0)

4. Greenwich Foot Tunnel

5. Bruce Castle Museum

Bruce Castle is an old mansion located in Tottenham, London. There's a story about a woman named Lady Constantia Lucy who killed herself by jumping out of the balcony while carrying her child with her. According to Timeout, she did it because her husband locked her in a tiny room. Some people said that they saw her ghost staring out the window of this castle. (Photo from Wikimedia/CC BY-SA 2.5)

People Can Free Stays at a Replica of Shrek's Swamp House in Scotland

"Shrek" fans can now have the chance to experience life as an ogre for a few nights. The famous swamp house from the film will be available on Airbnb. 

This moss-covered home is built in the hills of the Scottish Highlands, as reported by TMZ.

This swamp is an incredible replica that looks like the one in the animated film.

Lucky fans can book a two-night stay at this villa at the end of October.

Guests can truly enjoy themselves in this beautiful atmosphere. In the morning, visitors can enjoy waffles, just like Donkey likes. 

The most exciting thing is Shrek's outhouse next to the main building.

It gives visitors the chance to feel iconic scenes from the 2001 film.

For those who want to experience it, reservations for Shrek's Swamp start on October 13. The best part is that it's free!

According to New York Post, Airbnb also donated to HopScotch Children's Charity.

Spotify Adds "Jam" Feature For Real Time Listening Session

This feature is considered a full version of the previous listening feature known as "sessions".

Spotify Adds "Jam" Feature For Real Time Listening Session

A while ago, Spotify released a beta feature in the form of "listening sessions".

It is a feature where users can listen to music together in real time even if they are not in the same place.

However, the "session" is only available for premium users.

Most recently, Spotify has now released the "Jam" feature, which is billed as the full version of the "session" feature.

Introducing Jam – a new way for you and your friends to share the queue and choose what’s playing together. https://t.co/eAK0wcl8zB pic.twitter.com/wypBNkHlnH

— Spotify (@Spotify) September 26, 2023

As reported by The Verge, "Jam" feature can be enjoyed both premium and free users.

Released on September 26, this feature can accommodate up to 36 users to listen to music together.

In addition to listening to music in real time, users can also add music to playlists, and receive recommendations for music to play.

However, only premium Spotify users can open rooms for shared listening sessions and invite other users to enter.

"Jam" Participants will be able to select the device they want to play the music on if they want to listen remotely and be able to see who added a particular track.

Spotify premium account users have a lot of accessibility in managing "Jam" sessions.

They can manage who is in the Jam, the song order, and remove any songs from the lineup by default.

Hosts can also enable guest controls that give other Jam participants the ability to delete songs or change the order of songs.

To get a premium account and gain access to Spotify's many features, including starting the "Jam" feature, users are required to pay $5.99.

30 Real Friends Quotes to Strengthen Your Friendship Bonds

30 Real Friends Quotes to Strengthen Your Friendship Bonds

A real friend is someone who is always at our side, ready to listen and share stories with us. However, sometimes, it is difficult to express our feelings in words, even though there are many things we want to tell our friends. Sending your closest friend some real friends quotes might be a helpful way of conveying your feelings.

Real friends quotes usually talk about the definition of true friendship and reveal the strong bonds that exist within friendship itself. These words serve as a reminder of the huge influence that real friends have on our lives. It is also a reminder that real friends always offer unwavering support, laughter, and friendship through the ups and downs in life.

In this article, we have collected 30 real friends quotes to strengthen your friendship bonds. Don't forget to send these to your real friends to make them smile and be happy!

A. Short Real Friends Quotes

  • "Friends are the family you choose. "— Jess C. Scott

  • "A sweet friendship refreshes the soul." — Proverbs 27:9

  • "True friends are never apart, maybe in distance but never in heart." — Helen Keller

  • "No friendship is an accident." — O. Henry

  • "Sometimes being with your best friend is all the therapy you need." — Unknown

  • "Friends are the siblings God never gave us." — Mencius

  • "Life was meant for good friends and great adventures." — Unknown

  • "True friends are always together in spirit." — L.M. Montgomery

  • "True friends are like diamonds — bright, beautiful, valuable, and always in style." — Nicole Richie

  • "There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship." — Thomas Aquinas

B. Real Friends Quotes to Touch Their Hearts

  • "Real friends are like stars; you don't always see them, but you know they're always there." - Unknown
  • "Best friends share laughs, memories and inside jokes. They will always be honest and stand by your side no matter what. They wipe your tears, pick you up when you fall, and are forever a piece of your heart." — Unknown

  • "A true friend is someone who accepts your past, supports your present, and encourages your future." - Unknown

  • "But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine." — Thomas Jefferson

  • "Friendship isn't about whom you have known the longest... It's about who came and never left your side." - Unknown
  • "True friendship is when you can walk in total darkness with a friend and still feel like you're walking in the light." - Unknown

  • "A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him I may think aloud. I am arrived at last in the presence of a man so real and equal, that I may drop even those undermost garments of dissimulation, courtesy, and second thought, which men never put off, and may deal with him with the simplicity and wholeness with which one chemical atom meets another." — Ralph Waldo Emerson
  • "That's when I realized what a true friend was. Someone who would always love you — the imperfect you, the confused you, the wrong you — because that is what people are supposed to do." — Unknown

  • "True friendship is not about being inseparable, it's being separated and nothing changes." - Unknown

  • "A true friend is someone who listens to your words, understands your feelings, and walks with you through every challenge." - Unknown

  • "Never let your best friends get lonely…keep disturbing them." — Candlelight Publications

  • "I love that our effortless friendship fits perfectly with my laziness." — Unknown

  • "You don't have to be crazy to be my friend. I'll train you." — Unknown

  • "Best friends. Because if anyone else heard our conversations we'd end up in the mental hospital." — Unknown
  • "If you are ever lucky enough to find a weirdo, never let them go." — Matthew Gray Gubler

  • "God made us best friends because he knew our moms couldn't handle us as sisters." — Unknown

Titanic Ship to be Rebuilt with Modern Technology

Titanic Ship to be Rebuilt with Modern Technology

The Titanic sank in 1912 on its maiden voyage. The legendary ship will be recreated in exactly the same form and design as Titanic II.

Australian mining entrepreneur Clive Palmer has announced the creation of Titanic II. Clive was touting the plan ten years ago, but it has yet to become a reality.

The design and interior of Titanic II are the same as those of the legendary Titanic, but the security facilities are much higher.

"Blue Star Line will create an authentic Titanic experience, providing passengers with the same cabins and interiors, integrating modern security procedures and 21st century technology to create a high level of luxury comfort," he claims.

"We've brought in some of the world's best designers to make sure nothing is overlooked and the specifications are far superior to the original Titanic. It will be a ship of love with luxury and style," he added.

Passengers will be transported back in time, just like when they boarded the Titanic in ancient times. Palmer said this project was delayed because of several obstacles, including the coronavirus pandemic.

Titanic II will have 9 decks, 835 rooms, and replicas of everything on the first Titanic. It will be able to carry 2,435 passengers, with a Titanic-like course from Southampton to New York, as well as other lines.

The construction auction is scheduled to open in June, and the construction contract is due in December. The Titanic II costs between US$500 million and US$1 billion.

"The new ship will feature modern technology and the latest safety and navigation systems. There will be a luxurious staircase to below deck. Other facilities include traditional dining rooms, salons, luxury rooms, a grand ballroom, games, squash courts, swimming pools, a movie theater and a casino," Blue Star Line said.

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Crete is a paradise island in Greece. Here are our pick of the top 6 places to visit in Crete to add to your itinerary.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
6 Best Places to Visit in Crete, The Paradise Island of Greece

6 Best Places to Visit in Crete, The Paradise Island of Greece

Crete is a captivating island in Greece that offers a perfect blend of history, culture, and natural beauty. It is the largest island in Greece and is known for its stunning beaches, charming villages, and ancient ruins.

The warm Mediterranean climate, delicious cuisine, breathtaking landscapes, and interesting ruins make Crete a popular destination for travelers from all over the world.

If you plan to visit this breathtaking island on your next holiday, here are the top 6 places to visit in Crete to add to your itinerary.

1. Chania

Chania

Chania is a picturesque town located on the northwest coast of Crete. It is famous for its beautiful Venetian harbor, narrow streets lined with colorful buildings and historical sites.

One of the must-visit attractions in Chania is the Old Town, where you can explore the Venetian lighthouse, visit the Archaeological Museum, and shop for souvenirs at the bustling market. Don't forget to sample the local cuisine at one of the cozy tavernas in the town.

2. Elafonissi Beach

Elafonissi Beach

Elafonissi Beach is a paradise for beach lovers with its crystal-clear turquoise waters and pink sand. Located on the southwest coast of Crete, Elafonissi is a protected nature reserve that offers stunning views of the coastline.

You can relax on the beach, swim in the warm waters, or hike along the coastal trails for a truly memorable experience. Make sure to bring your camera to capture the breathtaking sunset over the horizon.

3. Knossos

Knossos

Knossos is an ancient archaeological site near Heraklion that dates back to the Minoan civilization. It is one of the most important archaeological sites in Greece and offers a fascinating glimpse into the ancient history of Crete.

Explore the ruins of the palace complex, admire the colorful frescoes, and learn about the advanced architectural techniques used by the Minoans. A visit to Knossos is a must for history enthusiasts and anyone interested in the rich cultural heritage of Crete.

4. Samaria Gorge

Samaria Gorge

Samaria Gorge is a must-visit natural wonder in Crete. As one of the longest gorges in Europe, it offers breathtaking views of towering cliffs, lush vegetation, and the occasional Cretan goat.

The hiking trail through the gorge is an unforgettable experience, leading you past cascading waterfalls, narrow passages, and the charming village of Agia Roumeli at the end. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes and pack plenty of water for this adventure!

5. Heraklion

Heraklion

As the capital of Crete, Heraklion is a bustling city that seamlessly blends modern amenities with ancient history. Visit the iconic Heraklion Archaeological Museum to marvel at artifacts from the Minoan civilization, explore the impressive Venetian fortress of Koules, or take a leisurely stroll along the picturesque Old Harbor. Don't miss the chance to sample traditional Cretan cuisine at one of the many tavernas in the city.

6. Rethymnon

Rethymnon

Rethymnon is a charming coastal town on the northern coast of Crete, known for its well-preserved Venetian old town and picturesque harbor. Stroll along the cobbled streets lined with colorful buildings, shop for handmade crafts at the local markets, and sample traditional Cretan dishes at cozy tavernas.

Don't forget to visit the imposing Fortezza, a 16th-century fortress that offers panoramic views of the town and the sea. Rethymnon is the perfect place to unwind, relax, and immerse yourself in the laid-back Cretan lifestyle.

Floating Luxury Restaurant Opens in the Middle of Lake in Norway

Floating Luxury Restaurant Opens in the Middle of Lake in Norway

A restaurant in Hardangerfjord, Norway named "Iris" is unique because of its unique shape, like a UFO, and floating on the water.

The restaurant building and an art installation were made in Tallinn, Estonia, using 1,256 tonnes of metal.

The restaurant, located in a remote part of Norway, opened this year and serves fresh, local seafood.

"Here on the coast of Norway, I can explore entire universes beneath the surface that I could only dream of in Copenhagen," the restaurant's owner, Chef Anika Madsen, says on the NZ Herald's website.

"This region offers some of the cleanest and most exciting seafood products in the world."

Fine-dining restaurant guests must spend around $650 per person and be served 18 curated dishes.

Some menus served are made from premium ingredients such as sea urchins, roasted deer liver, and game meat.

However, diners cannot order their own food choices or make changes to the set menu. Therefore, those with allergies or certain food restrictions are not advised to visit the restaurant.

This will be an exclusive dining experience for every visitor because the restaurant only has a capacity of 24 people in each session, which lasts six hours.

Since opening to the public, the fine dining experience has become a topic of conversation on social media.

Some compare it to the sci-fi film, Alien: Covenant or Arrival.

While others say, the restaurant is reminiscent of a 2022 horror film called The Menu, in which a chef invites guests to an exclusive restaurant on a remote island for a sinister reason.

The restaurant is claimed to be the largest floating art installation in the world and a think tank for salmon farming groups.

-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.title: How to Toast Pecans With 3 Simple Methods
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.meta_description: Learn how to toast pecans without burning them with these 3 simple methods: oven, stovetop, and microwave.
-- Batch 6\r\nSELECT * FROM scraped_arti.content:
How to Toast Pecans With 3 Simple Methods

Are you wondering how to toast pecans without burning them? Pecans are delicious nuts that grow on trees in warm places like Texas and Georgia. These nuts have a rich, buttery taste that many people love. Raw pecans are good for eating, but toasted pecans taste much better.

You can eat pecans straight from the package without cooking them. However, toasting pecans brings out their natural oils and makes them taste stronger and more flavorful. The heat also makes pecans crunchier and gives them a golden brown color that looks beautiful in recipes.

There are several different ways to toast pecans at home. You can use your oven, stovetop, or even your microwave. Each method works well, but some are faster than others. The key is watching the pecans carefully so they do not burn.

In this article, we will help you learn how to toast pecans with three methods: oven, stovetop, and microwave. We will also share some tips to help you toast pecans without burning them and how to store them so they can last longer. We gathered these guides from various sources, Thursday (26/6/2025).

How to Toast Pecans in the Oven

The oven method is the most popular way to toast pecans because it heats them evenly. This method works well when you need to toast large amounts of pecans at one time.

1. Heat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit. Do not use a higher temperature because pecans can burn quickly.

2. Spread the pecans in a single layer on a baking sheet. Make sure the pecans do not overlap each other. Use parchment paper if you want to prevent sticking.

3. Place the baking sheet in the middle of your oven. Set a timer for 8 minutes.

4. After 8 minutes, take the baking sheet out and stir the pecans with a spoon. This helps them toast evenly on all sides.

5. Put the pecans back in the oven for 2 to 4 more minutes. Watch them carefully during this time.

6. Remove the pecans when they smell nutty and look golden brown. They should feel crispy when you touch them.

7. Let the pecans cool completely on the baking sheet before using them. They will continue cooking slightly from the hot pan.

How to Toast Pecans on the Stovetop

Toasting pecans on the stovetop is faster than using the oven. This method works best for small amounts of pecans and gives you more control over the toasting process.

1. Choose a large, heavy pan like a cast iron skillet. Heavy pans distribute heat better and prevent hot spots.

2. Heat the empty pan over medium-low heat for 2 minutes. Do not add oil or butter to the pan.

3. Add the pecans to the warm pan in a single layer. Do not overcrowd the pan or they will not toast evenly.

4. Stir the pecans constantly with a wooden spoon. Keep moving them around the pan so all sides get heated.

5. Continue stirring for 3 to 5 minutes. The pecans will start to smell fragrant and turn golden brown.

6. Remove the pan from heat as soon as the pecans look toasted. They cook very quickly at the end.

7. Pour the hot pecans onto a cool plate immediately. Leaving them in the hot pan will make them continue cooking and possibly burn.

How to Toast Pecans in the Microwave

The microwave method is the quickest way to toast pecans. This technique works well when you need just a small amount of toasted pecans right away.

1. Place pecans on a microwave-safe plate. Spread them out so they are not touching each other.

2. Microwave the pecans on high power for 1 minute. Your microwave power may be different, so start with less time if needed.

3. Remove the plate carefully because it will be hot. Stir the pecans with a spoon to move them around.

4. Microwave for another 30 seconds to 1 minute. Check the pecans every 30 seconds to see if they are done.

5. The pecans are ready when they smell toasted and feel warm. They may not look as brown as oven-toasted pecans.

6. Let the pecans cool on the plate for 2 minutes before eating them. Microwaved nuts can be very hot inside.

Tips to Toast Pecans

Following these helpful tips will ensure your pecans turn out perfectly every time. These suggestions work for all toasting methods and will help you avoid common mistakes.

- Use fresh pecans: Old pecans do not toast well and may taste bitter. Buy pecans from stores that sell them quickly, or check the expiration date on packages.

- Choose similar sizes: Pick pecans that are about the same size so they toast at the same rate. Large and small pieces mixed together will cook unevenly.

- Watch carefully: Pecans can go from perfectly toasted to burned in just a few seconds. Stay near your cooking area and check them often.

- Do not add salt early: Wait until after toasting to add salt or seasonings. Salt can make pecans burn faster during cooking.

- Test doneness: Take one pecan out and let it cool, then taste it. Properly toasted pecans should be crispy and have a rich, nutty flavor.

- Cool completely: Always let toasted pecans cool down before storing them. Hot pecans will create moisture in containers and become soggy.

How to Store Pecans

Pecans can go bad easily if you don't store them the right way. Toasted pecans have natural oils that turn rancid when exposed to air and heat. Following these simple storage tips will keep your toasted pecans fresh and crunchy for weeks.

Store cooled toasted pecans in airtight containers like glass jars or plastic containers with tight lids. Keep the containers in a cool, dry place away from sunlight and heat sources. Room temperature storage works fine for up to one week. You can also keep toasted pecans in the refrigerator for up to one month, which helps preserve their oils and prevents them from becoming rancid.

For longer storage, place toasted pecans in freezer bags and freeze them for up to three months. Frozen toasted pecans maintain their flavor and crunchiness very well. When you want to use frozen pecans, let them thaw at room temperature for 15 minutes. You do not need to reheat them unless you prefer warm pecans for your recipe or snacking.

Carrying Gun-Shaped Purse at BET Awards, Angela Simmons Apologizes

Carrying Gun-Shaped Purse at BET Awards, Angela Simmons Apologizes

Angela Simmons faced backlash for carrying a gun-shaped purse at the 2024 BET Awards.

Got criticism, she apologized for the controversial fashion choice.

At first, she apologized for the controversial fashion choice.

She stated that she did not mean to upset anyone and saw the bag as fashion and not as a symbol of violence.

Despite his explanation, critics continue to express their disappointment and disbelief.

They look at her personal history with gun violence after the death of the father of her child in 2018, as reported by USA Today.

Simmons then clarified in an Instagram video.

She highlighted that she was not violent. Gun violence has dramatically affected her life.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by The Shade Room (@theshaderoom)

“So I see a lot of of conversation around the bag, purse I wore to the awards and normally I don’t address rumors and stuff, but I’m not like that. Never been like that,” she said in the video. 

“I’m super, like not violent. I’ve obviously been through a lot in my personal life when it comes to gun violence and it’s very personal to me. But I just liked the bag and I thought it was cool and thought it was a fashion moment.”

"I’m sorry if it bothered anyone but that’s not me, that’s just not how I am," she added.

Angela Simmons wore a stunning emerald-gemmed gown to the 2024 BET Awards.

The entrepreneur chose to wear an emerald bedazzled gun clutch to compliment her peacock-esque garb, and silver shoes.

Top Gun Quotes: 50 Best Sayings From American Action Film Top Gun

Top Gun Quotes: 50 Best Sayings From American Action Film Top Gun 

Top Gun Quotes

Top Gun: Maverick is an American action film that premiered in theaters in 2022, with Tom Cruise as the main character in this film. You can find lots of interesting messages that you can take as lessons. If you don't have time to watch it, reading Top Gun quotes could be an option to find an interesting message in this film.

The plot of this film centers on Maverick, a senior United States (US) pilot who returns to the elite Top Gun academy to train young pilots on missions to destroy a country's nuclear facilities. Maverick and the other characters are undoubtedly strongly motivated to complete their mission. By reading Top Gun quotes, you can also find out the motivational and inspirational words conveyed by the characters in this film.

In this article, we have selected the best and lesson quotes from Top Gun: Maverick film, Wednesday (6/3/2024).

A.Top Gun: Maverick's Famous Quotes

  • "The Navy calls it Fighter Weapons School. The Pilots call it Top Gun."

  • "He wants mach 10 let's give him mach 10."

  • "You fly for Top Gun or you don't fly ever again."

  • "Oh, Pete…I could never stay mad at you. That's the problem."

  • "I'm afraid rules are rules. You're lucky it's early."

  • "That's why we call him a hangman. He will always hang you out to dry."

  • "Light on. Let's turn and burn."

  • "As good as they are sir, they still have something to learn."

  • "I can't go as low as you sir, and that's saying something." 

  • "I don't sail boats, Penny. I land on them."

  • "No offense intended. Yet somehow you always manage."

  • "I'm not a teacher. I'm a fighter pilot."

  • "It's not what I am, it's who I am. How do I teach that?"

  • "If you get kicked out, you leave us with hangman."

  • "Naval aviator is not what I am. It's who I am."

  • "The Navy needs Maverick. The kid needs Maverick. That's why I fought for you."

  • "He will always resent me for what I did. Why should he resent her too?"

  • "I was trying to be the father he lost, I wish I would have done it better."
  • "Fighting with everything you have just to keep yourself from blacking out."

  • "Pete, if you lost your wingman up there you wouldn't give up. You'd keep fighting. Those are your pilots."

  • "I think the admiral is asking a rhetorical question."

  • "This is what you've all been training for. Come home safe."

  • "How are we going to get this museum piece in the air?"

  • "You told me not to think!"

  • "Thank you for saving my life." "It's what my dad would have done."

  • "Despite your best efforts you refuse to die."

  • "You should be a two-star general by now, yet here you are." "I am where I belong, Sir."

  • "The end is inevitable Maverick. Your kind is heading to extinction." "Maybe so, sir, but not today."

  • "Hangman, the only place you'll lead any is an early grave."

  • "I know what happens to everyone else if I don't."

Best Quotes from Top Gun: Maverick

  • "You don't have time to think up there. If you think, you're dead."

  • "As good as they are, they still have things to learn."

  • "Time is your greatest enemy."

  • "Don't think. Just do it."

  • "Everyone here is the best there is."

  • "What the enemy doesn't know is your limit."

  • "I can go as low as you, and that is saying something. "

  • "If I send him on this mission, he may never come home. And if I don't send him, he'll never forgive me. Either way, I'll lose him forever. "

  • "This was a nice moment. Let's not ruin it. "

  • "My dad believed in you. I'm not going to make the same mistake. "

  • "Just be cool. If they knew who we were, we'd be dead already."

  • "You said to create a team, sir. There's your team. "

  • "We don't want you to fly. We want you to teach it."

  • "What the past is the past, for both of us."

  • "Waiting for just the right moment, that never comes."

  • "Time is your greatest adversary."

  • "Easy, Maverick. Let's try not to get fired on the first day. "

  • "You're where you belong. Make us proud."

  • "Your ego is writing checks your body can't cash."

  • "Well, it's good to see you." "It's good to see you, too."

7 Best Neighborhoods in Sioux Falls, SD, for Ideal Living

Sioux Falls, South Dakota, is a vibrant city with various neighborhoods to choose from.


Are you looking for a bustling urban area or a quiet suburban community? There's something for everyone in Sioux Falls.

In this article, we'll explore the seven best neighborhoods in the Sioux Falls area for ideal living. Let's dive in and discover what each neighborhood has to offer!














Best Neighborhoods in Sioux Falls, SD

1. Downtown Sioux Falls:

Downtown Sioux Falls is the city's heart, offering a mix of historic charm and modern amenities.

With a bustling arts scene, trendy restaurants, and unique shops, this neighborhood is perfect for those who crave an urban lifestyle. Residents can enjoy events at the Washington Pavilion or stroll along the Big Sioux River.

teasd.com

2. Tea:

Tea is a quaint town located just outside of Sioux Falls. It offers a peaceful and family-friendly atmosphere. With top-rated schools and parks, Tea is an ideal neighborhood for those looking to raise a family in a safe and welcoming community.

Falls Park, Sioux Falls, SD by flickr/Daniel Garrido

3. Luverne:

Luverne is a charming small town located just a short drive from Sioux Falls. With tree-lined streets and historic architecture, Luverne offers a tranquil setting for those seeking a slower pace of life. Residents can enjoy local boutiques, restaurants, and parks while enjoying the town's rich history.

flickr/Kent InSD

4. Brandon:

Brandon is a growing suburb of Sioux Falls with a strong sense of community. With top-notch schools, parks, and recreational facilities, Brandon is perfect for families looking for a safe and friendly neighborhood to call home.

5. Southeastern Sioux Falls:

Southeastern Sioux Falls is a popular neighborhood known for its close-knit community and convenient location.

With easy access to shopping centers, restaurants, and entertainment options, residents in this area can enjoy the best of both worlds - a suburban feel with urban amenities.
Photo: flickr/James St. John

6. Southwest Sioux Falls:

Southwest Sioux Falls is a desirable neighborhood that offers a mix of new developments and established homes. With its proximity to parks, schools, and shopping centers, it is ideal for families and young professionals looking for a well-rounded community.

7. McKennan Park:

McKennan Park is a beautiful neighborhood known for its historic homes and tree-lined streets.

With the picturesque McKennan Park at its center, residents can enjoy outdoor activities such as picnics, concerts, and community events. The neighborhood also boasts a strong sense of community, with neighbors coming together for block parties and other social gatherings.
Photo: flickr/Richard Johnson

Sioux Falls presents a variety of neighborhoods to suit different lifestyles and preferences.

If you are looking for a bustling urban area or a peaceful suburban community, there's something for everyone in this vibrant city. So, are you raising a family, starting a career, or enjoying retirement?

Sioux Falls has the perfect neighborhood for you to call home. Consider exploring these seven best neighborhoods in Sioux Falls for your ideal living experience!

45 Star Wars Quotes: Funny, Wise, And Iconic Lines For Die-Hard Fans

Are you a die-hard Star Wars fan? If so, you must check out our collection of the best and most iconic Star Wars quotes of all time.

45 Star Wars Quotes: Funny, Wise, And Iconic Lines For Die-Hard Fans

Star Wars is one of the best and most iconic movie franchises in history. But beyond its epic battle scene and famous characters, the saga is filled with memorable lines that people remember for a long time. From the wise words of Yoda to the fiery rhetoric of Darth Vader, Star Wars has gifted us with a vast array of quotes that have resonated with fans around the world.

In this article, we have collected some of the best and most memorable Star Wars quotes from various sources, Monday (20/11/2023). These quotes will lift up our spirits, spark our imaginations, and offer valuable life lessons.

A. Funny Star Wars Quotes

1. "Be careful not to choke on your aspirations, director." - Darth Vader

2. "Why do I get the feeling that we've picked up another pathetic life form?" - Obi-Wan Kenobi

3. "Laugh it up, Fuzzball." - Han Solo

4. "I want to go home and rethink my life." - Elan Sleazebaggano

5. "You have your moments. Not many of them, but you do have them." - Princess Leia

6. "Curse my metal body, I wasn't fast enough!" - C-3PO

7. "It's a trap!" - Admiral Ackbar

8. "I want to go home and rethink my life." - Elan Sleazebaggano

9. "I Guess Every Once In A While Both Suns Shine On A Womp Rat's Tail." - Cobb Vanth

10. "How You Get So Big Eating Food Of This Kind?" - Yoda

B. Wise Star Wars Quotes

1. "Try not. Do or do not. There is no try." - Yoda

2. "Who's the more foolish: the fool or the fool who follows him? - Obi-Wan Kenobi

3. "The ability to speak does not make you intelligent." - Qui-Gon Jinn

4. "Yeah, I'm responsible these days. It's the price you pay for being successful." - Lando Calrissian

5. "Advice: Any organic who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." - HK-47

6. "Life is not without pain, but life concerns itself with how we handle that pain, or joy, or confusion, or triumph. Life is more than time passing before death; it is the sum and total of all we make of it."

- Elegos A'Kla

7. "Many of the truths that we cling to depend on our point of view." - Obi-Wan Kenobi

8. "We fight for justice because justice is the fundamental bedrock of civilization: An unjust civilization is built upon sand. It does not long survive a storm." - Mace Windu

9. "There is nothing wrong with fear. You need never be ashamed of it, as long as it doesn't stop you functioning. Fear is your natural warning system; it keeps you alive so that you can fight. Show me a man who isn't afraid and I'll show you a fool who is a danger to his entire ship." - Admiral Adar Tallon

10. "To be united by hatred is a fragile alliance at best." - Kreia

Miley Cyrus Apologizes to Mickey Mouse After Becoming the Youngest Disney Legend

Miley Cyrus Apologizes to Mickey Mouse After Becoming the Youngest Disney Legend

Disney awarded Disney Legends to several figures involved in producing historical works. The awards were presented during the final session of D23: The Ultimate Disney Fan Event, which honored 14 figures.

“The Disney Legends Award is the highest honor bestowed by our company. It celebrates special talents, recognizes outstanding achievements, and above all, it is our heartfelt thanks,” said Bob Iger, CEO of Disney.

The honorees include Harrison Ford, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kelly Ripa, Martha Blanding, James L. Brooks, Colleen Atwood, Frank Oz, Miley Cyrus, Steve Ditko, Mark Henn, Joe Rohde, James Cameron, Angela Bassett, and John Williams.

As the youngest Disney Legend honoree, Miley Cyrus was touched that she got the chance to play Hannah Montana, which became her iconic role.

“I'll tell anyone the secret of a Disney Legend. I tell you what you're not supposed to know,” Miley Cyrus was quoted as saying by Deadline.

“What I want to say is, legends get scared too. I feel scared now, but what's different is that we still do it. And you can all do it every day,” she continued.

In 2013, Miley Cyrus tried to change her image as a Disney star by appearing open. One of the phenomenal ones was when she wore an outfit with Mickey Mouse at the MTV Video Music Awards and performed with Robin Thicke.

“Disney is on a mission to rebuild and reorganize the company. That's why they hired Bob Iger and me,” she said.

Cyrus continued, “I was definitely not created in a lab and if I was there must have been a bug in the system that caused me to malfunction between 2013 and '16. Sorry, Mickey,” he concluded.

Then, Lainey Wilson made a tribute by singing The Best of Both Worlds, the Hannah Montana theme song.

Disney Legend is an award from Disney that began in 1987. More than 300 figures have received this award, which was held at the D23 Event.
